English: Take this powder, put a little portion in his meal anytime you prepare him food, the poison will kill him gradually till he dies totally.
Yoruba: Gba ẹbu u yìí kí o da díẹ̀ sínú oúnjẹ rẹ̀ ní gbogbo ìgbà tí o bá ti ń pèsè oúnjẹ rẹ̀, májèlé náà yóò máa pa á díẹ̀ díẹ̀ títí yóò o fi kú pátápátá.

English: After thirty days, this woman return to her mother’s place that: “my mother, I no longer have the intention to kill my husband.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ọgbọ̀n ọjọ́, ọmọbinrin yìí padà sí ọ̀dọ ìyá a rẹ̀  wí pé: " Ìyá mi, mi o ni èròngbà láti pa ọkọ mi mọ́.

English: At this moment, I am loving him more because he has changed drastically.”
Yoruba: Bí báyìí, mo ti wá ń fẹ́ràn rẹ̀ si nítorí pé o ti yípadà pátápátá."

English: At this moment he has become irreplaceable in my heart than before, I never expected it.
Yoruba: Ni báyìí o tí di aàyò ọkàn mi ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ, ju bí mo ti lérò lọ́kàn lọ pàápàá.

English: At this moment what can I do to reduce the efficacy of the poison that my husband has consumed?
Yoruba: Ni báyìí kíni mo lè ṣe láti dẹ́rọ́ ọ májèlé ti ọkọ mi ti jẹ?

English: “Please, help me my mother.”
Yoruba: Ẹ jọ̀wọ́, ẹ ràn-mí-lọ́wọ́ Ìyá mi.

English: This woman is begging with tears in her eyes.
Yoruba: Ọmọbirin yìí ń bẹ̀bẹ̀ pẹ̀lú omijé lójú.

English: The mother answered her: “Do not be scared my child.
Yoruba: Ìyá a rẹ̀ dá a lóhùn: "Má bẹ̀rù ọmọ ọ mi.

English: What I gave you is not poison but just mere powder for good health.
Yoruba: Ohun tí mo fún ọ kì í ń ṣe májèlé bikòṣe ẹbu a mára jí pépé lásán.

English: Without lying to you, you are the poison that is killing your husband gradually with trouble, quarrel, hardened heart, temperament, and not overlooking things.
Yoruba: Kí n máà parọ́, ìwọ ni májèlé náà tó ò ń pa ọkọ ọ rẹ díẹ̀díẹ̀ pẹ̀lú wàálà, ìjọ̀ngbọ̀n, agídí ọkàn, àfojúdi, ìgbónára, àti àìlámòjúrò.

English: When you begin to show him love, when you give him regards, when you put him in high esteem before he will become a good husband.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí o bá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní nífẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ̀, tí ò ń bu ọlá á fún-un, tí o sì mọ rírì i rẹ̀ ni yóò tò ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ padà di ọkọ rere lójú u rẹ̀.

English: Men are not as wicked as we women think. Mother spoke.
Yoruba: Ọkùnrin kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ burú bí àwa obìnrin ti ṣe lérò. Ìyá sọ̀rọ̀.

English: But the way we engage with them is the reason or example of how they will live with us.
Yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀nà tí à ń gbà láti bá wọn lò ló ń ṣe okùnfà tàbí àpèjúwe ìgbé ayé tí wọn yóò gbé pẹ̀lú u wa.

English: A woman, that can respect, use her body to work, has true love, show care to her husband, her husband too in return will show her love in all ramifications.
Yoruba: Obìnrin, tí ó bá lè tẹríbà, fi ara a rẹ̀ jì, ni ìfẹ́ tòótọ́, mọ pẹ́pẹ́fúrú ú ṣe sí ọkọ ọ rẹ, ọkọ ọ rẹ alára ti ṣetán ni gbogbo ọ̀nà láti fi ìfẹ́ bá ọ lò.

English: In conclusion, I hope that this will work for over 40 percent of men with prayers, patience and overlooking things.
Yoruba: Ni parí, mo lérò wípé èyí yóò ṣiṣẹ́ fún ìdá ọgọ́rin ọkùnrin pẹ̀lú àdúrà, sùúrù àti àmójúkúrò.

English: Listen, does the Yorùbá race know the Supreme Being or they don’t?
Yoruba: Ẹ gbọ́, ṣé ìran Yorùbá mọ Ọlọ́run àbí a ò mọ̀ ọ́n?

English: They say that speaking and confirming it is the bone of truth, father of liar is anyone that says that we do not know God until the foreign religions became a culture.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ní ká sọ̀rọ̀ ká bá a bẹ́ẹ̀ ni eegun òótọ́, baba òpùrọ́ ni ẹni náà tí ó sọ wípé a ò mọ Ọlọ́run àyàfi ìgbà tí ẹ̀sìn òkèèrè di àṣà.

English: There is nothing in our tradition that is of no good, that we cannot be proud of in the society of children of God, liars say that as we are dark in the face, so we are dark in the heart and in the brain, because of his own love, liar used deceit to call us the name that is not ours.
Yoruba: Kò sí nkan nínú ìṣe wa tí ó sunwọ̀n, tí a lè fi ìwúríi rẹ̀ yangàn láwùjọ ọmọ Ọlọ́run, purọ́ purọ́ wọn ní bí a ṣe dúdú lójú, la dúdú lọ́kàn àti lọ́pọlọ, torí ìfẹ́ ara ti rẹ̀, èké fi àgálámàṣà sọ wá lórúkọ tí a ò jẹ́.

English: They dyed black, they called it white, they use paint to paint the root of the knowledge that originated in this land (Africa), they renamed the characters of historical events that we participated in another name.
Yoruba: Wọ́n pa dúdú láró, wọ́n ní funfun ni, wọ́n fi esé sé ìmọ̀-ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ohun gbogbo tí ó ṣẹ̀ nílẹ̀ yìí (Adúláwọ̀), wọ́n fún ẹ̀dá ìtàn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ mánigbàgbé tí a kópa nínú u rẹ̀ lórúkọ mìíràn.

English: Disorganisers turned history upside down. The result of their deception is the reason why they say that we do not know God until they arrive, this is how they used religion to enslave one, they call father guinea corn, they called Èṣù our deity Satan.
Yoruba: Màdàrú dojú ìtàn kodò. Arapa ète wọn náà ló fà á tí wọ́n fi ní a ò mọ Ọlọ́run káwọn ó tó dé, báyìí ni wọ́n ṣe fi ẹ̀sìn mú ni sìn, bàbá ni wọ́n pè bàbà, wọ́n pe Èṣù ní Sátánì fún wa.

English: I have one question for thinkers, if truelly we do not know God the King Owner-of-the-universe Omnipresent, then why do we have such names in the African vocabulary?
Yoruba: Mo ní ìbéèrè kan fún aláròjinlẹ̀, bí ó bá jẹ́ wípé a kò mọ Ọlọ́run Ọba Olódùmarè Atẹ́rẹrẹ-káyé, báwọ̀ la ṣe ní irú orúkọ wònyí nínú ìfọ̀ èdè abínibíì wa nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀?

English: Do you know that it is this God of Heaven and Earth who has the most name, every tongue has a name for Him?
Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ìwọ́ mọ̀ wípé Ọlọ́run Ilẹ̀ àti Òkè yìí ló lórúkọ tó pọ̀ jù lọ, gbogbo ahọ́n ló ní orúkọ tí ó mọ̀ Ọ́n mọ́?

English: If we break it down and rearrange it, Owner-of-heaven; Oní-Ọ̀run. It is elision of words in Oní-Ọ̀run makes it Ọlọ́run.
Yoruba: Ká dà á sílẹ̀ kí a tún un ṣà, O-Ní-Ọ̀-Run; Oní-Ọ̀run. Ìpàrójẹ tó dé bá Oní-Ọ̀run ni ó fi di Ọlọ́run.

English: We are certain, there is heaven, we also know that heaven existed before earth came to being, we do not say that we do not know that there is a soul mightier than all souls, we know heaven is his resident.
Yoruba: A mọ́ dájú bí ọṣẹ pé, ọ̀run ń bẹ, a sì mọ̀ wípé ọ̀run ti ń bẹ kí ayé ó tó mọ́ ọ bẹ, a ò lá ò mọ̀ wípé ẹ̀mí kan ń bẹ tó ju ẹ̀míkẹ́mìí lọ, a mọ̀ pé ní ọ̀run ni ibùdóo Rẹ̀.

English: We know that the Owner-of-the-Universe is the king and controller of heaven and earth.
Yoruba: A mọ̀ wípé Olódùmarè ni ọba aláṣẹ lọ́run àti láyé.

English: His authority makes everything come to being.
Yoruba: Àṣẹ rẹ̀ ni ohun gbogbo fi ń bẹ.

English: It is in the hands of the Owner-of-heaven Owner-of-the-universe that everything came to earth, it is with His knowledge that things on earth came to be.
Yoruba: Ọwọ́ Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè ni ohun gbogbo ti wá sáyé, mímọ̀ọ́nṣe rẹ̀ ni ohun gbogbo fi ń bẹ láyé.

English: In the exoteric Ifá Ọ̀yẹ̀kú Mogbè corpus, Ifá says
Yoruba: Nínú Odù Ifá Ọ̀yẹ̀kú Mogbè, Ifá ní

English: “The earth is a market, heaven is home, cast Ifá for the Owner-of-the-universe, if you get to earth, if you forget heaven, Earth is a market, heaven is the home of everybody, you will report, what you saw.”
Yoruba: “Ayé lọ́jà, ọ̀run nílé, a díá fún Olódùmarè baba atáyé mátu, bẹ́ ẹ délé ayé, bẹ́ ẹ gbàgbé ọ̀run, Ayé lọ́jà, ọ̀run nilé ẹ̀yin èrò, ẹ ó jíyìn, ẹ ó jábọ̀, ohun tí ẹ rí.”

English: An explanation of how the Owner-of-heaven Owner-of-the-universe created earth just like a market which humans visit is what this Ifá verse is saying.
Yoruba: Alààyè bí Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè ṣe dá ayé gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọjà tí ọmọ aráyé wá ná ni ẹsẹ̀ Ifá yìí ń sọ fún wa.

English: When the Owner-of-the-universe sent Ọ̀rúnmìlà to earth, he scattered wisdom on earth, some people saw the wisdom that the Owner-of-the-universe scattered all over the earth, they picked it.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí Elédùà rán Ọ̀rúnmìlà wá sáyé, ó da ọgbọ́n sílé ayé, àwọn kan rí ọgbọ́n tí Olódùmarè fún Ọ̀rúnmìlà láti dà sílẹ̀ láyé, wọ́n sì ṣà á.

English: He-sees-it-to-pick, one who sees wisdom to pick on earth, he that performed greatly while on earth, becomes òrìṣà that men venerate after death.
Yoruba: Ó-rí-i-ṣà, ẹni tí ó rí ọgbọ́n ṣà nílé ayé, tí ó dábírà nígbà tí ó ń bẹ lórí lẹ̀ alàyè, ni ó di òrìṣà ténìyàn ńbọ lẹ́yìn ikú.

English: Their attitude, their behaviour, their character and ways of life is what human beings want to imitate.
Yoruba: Ìwà wọn, ìwùwàsí wọn, ìṣe wọn àti ìgbé ayé wọn ni àwọn èèyàn abìdíyànyàn ma ń fẹ́ wò kọ́ ṣe.

English: In Yorùbáland, the wise one are accorded respect, including brave and warriors, hunters, men of mysteries and everyone that is a professional is given reverence.
Yoruba: Ní ilẹ̀ Yorùbá, àwọn ọlọ́gbọ́n inú ẹ̀dá ni a máa ń gbóríyìn fún, pẹ̀lú àwọn akínkanjú èèyàn àti akọni jagunjagun, ọdẹ, awo tí ó gbójú gbóyà tí ó dájú nínú iṣẹ́ẹ rẹ̀.

English: In the ancient times, Yorùbáland has enormous number of intelligent men whose understanding of the world cannot be underestimated.
Yoruba: Láyé àtijọ́, ilẹ̀-kú-oótù-o-ò-jí-ire kún fún ènìyàn ọlọ́pọlọ pípé tí òye wọn kọ já sísọ.

English: The wonderful works that these ones left on earth make people call on them for assistance, advice and they see them as one to emulate.
Yoruba: Iṣẹ́ tí àwọn wọ̀nyìí ṣe sílẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ ayé ló sọ wọ́n di ẹni tí ọmọ aráyé ń ké pè fún ìrànlọ́wọ́, ìmọ̀ràn tí wọ́n sí wóò láwò kọ́ṣe.

English: Because of the great works embarked upon by people like these, gave birth to the believe that the soul of the Owner-of-the-universe resides with anybody that shows extravagant character that they are yet to encounter before.
Yoruba: Torí iṣẹ́ takuntakun ọwọ́ọ irú àwọn ènìyàn báwọ̀nyìí ní i má ńmú kí àwọn ọmọ Yoòbá ní gbàgbọ́ pé ẹ̀mí Elédùmarè wà ńnú ẹni kẹ́ni tí í ba ṣe nǹkan àràmàndà tí wọn kò rí rí.

English: They saw that, the authority of the Leader of heaven lives with such persons.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ríi pé, àṣẹ Ọlọfin ọ̀run ń gbé pẹ̀lú wọn.

English: In the second place, our forefathers believes that, some folks cohabitate with the Owner-of-the-universe in heaven, who are his messengers sent to earth from heaven.
Yoruba: Lọ́nà kejì, bàbá ńlá wa gbà pé, àwọn kan ńgbé pẹ̀lú Elédùmarè lọ́run, tí wọ́n jẹ́ òjísẹ́ẹ Elédùà tí ó ńránṣẹ́ wá sílé ayé láti àjùlé ọ̀run.

English: In ancient Ọ̀yọ́, reverence and awe for baby Ṣàngó started on his birthday when his umbilical cord refuse to separate from his abdomen.
Yoruba: Láti ọjọ́ tí abí Ṣàngó tí ìwọ́ rẹ kò já bọ̀ọ̀rọ̀ ni ìlú Ọ̀yọ́ Ilé ti ń fi ìkẹ́ àti àpọ́nlé fún ọmọ tuntun náà.

English: Also Ṣàngó used bitter kola as gun powder, and other miraculous things that he portrayed.
Yoruba: Bákannáà ni Ṣàngó fi orógbó ṣe ẹtù ìbọn, àti àwọn àrà ọwọ́ọ rẹ̀ mìíràn.

English: For this reason, Ṣàngó was regarded as supernatural, an intelligent person who sees wisdom to pick.
Yoruba: Torí ìdí èyí, wọ́n ka Ṣàngó sí alágbára abàmì, ọlọ́gbọ́n ènìyàn tí ó ri ṣà.

English: Same thing applies to Ògún, a great hunter who taught his people the knowledge in iron smelting.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà sì ni ti Ògún, ọdẹ tí ó mọ̀ nípa irin ṣíṣe tí ó sì kọ́ àwọn èèyàn rẹ̀.

English: Ọ̀rúnmìlà the father of the Ifá wisdom was human before he became òrìṣà.
Yoruba: Ènìyàn ni Ọ̀rúnmìlà baba ọgbọ́n Ifá náà kí ó tó di ò-rì-ṣà.

English: Even you too can become òrìṣà, if you put in more efforts in what you do, for people of the world to know you for it.
Yoruba: Ìwọ gan-an alára lè di òrìṣà, bí o bá tẹpá mọ́ṣẹ́ ọwọ́ ẹ, kí ọmọ aráyé fi mọ̀ ọ́.

English: What is mammography?
Yoruba: Kí ni mammography?

English: The examination of the breast to quickly ascertain if cancer is present is known as mammography in English language.
Yoruba: Àyèwò ọmú láti tètè mọ̀ bí àrùn jẹjẹrẹ ọmú bá ti wà lára ni wọ́n ń pè ní mammography lédèe Gèésì.

English: Examine the breast, is it the way it should be?
Yoruba: Ẹ yẹ ọmú wò, ṣé ó wà b'ó ṣe yẹ ó wà?

English: You did not notice strange thing?
Yoruba: O kò ṣàkíyèsíi nǹkan àjèjì?

English: Take care of it.
Yoruba: Ẹ tọ́júu rẹ̀ o.

English: You do not know that the breast that protrude out of your body is not for you?
Yoruba: Ẹ ò mọ̀ pé ọmú tí ó sú yọ láyàá yín yẹn kì í ṣe ti yín?

English: You know that?
Yoruba: Ẹ mọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀?

English: It is for both of us, if one uses it, he/she lives it for the other person to use it.
Yoruba: Àwa méjì la jọ ni í, bí ẹnìkíní bá lò ó, á á gbéeélẹ̀ kẹ́nìkejì ó lò ó.

English: The breast belongs to we and the children.
Yoruba: Àwa àti àwọn ọmọ la ni ọmú.

English: We men and little ones own the breast.
Yoruba: Àwa ọkùnrin àti ọmọọwọ́ ló lọmú.

English: There shouldn’t be any cause for alarm in that.
Yoruba: Àríyànjiyàn ò gbọdọ̀ wáyé nípa ìyẹn.

English: Take care of it for us.
Yoruba: Ẹ bá wa tọ́júu rẹ̀.

English: They have said that men that look at breasts often would live longer than those who don't look at breasts.
Yoruba: Wọ́n kú ti ní ọkùnrin t'ó bá ń wo ọmú lóòrèkóorè yóò pẹ́ láyé ju èyí tí ò wo ọmú.

English: It is ours not yours, we kept it in your possession help us keep it properly in good taste.
Yoruba: Ti wa ni ti yín kọ́, afipamọ́ síi yín lọ́wọ́ ni ẹ bá wa tọ́júu rẹ̀ dáadáa.

English: Only for our children, which we planted on your farm, your breast is what makes them grow.
Yoruba: Àdèfi àwọn ọmọọ wa, tí a gbìn s'ókoo yín, ọyàn yìí ní í jẹ́ wọ́n ta.

English: King Sunny Ade sang a song, he says “give the baby breast (twice), and do not deny a one month baby from suckling the breast, give the baby the breast.”
Yoruba: Sunny Aládé fi k'ọrin, ò ní "ẹ fún ọmọ lọ́yàn (ní ẹ̀mejì), ẹ mọ́ gbọyàn lẹnu ọmọ oṣù kan, ẹ fọ́mọ lọ́yàn mu".

English: You mothers, for this reason, you young women, check your breast often, so that we can treat it early if it happens to be cancer.
Yoruba: Torí ìdí èyí ẹ̀yin màámi, ẹ̀yin sisí mi, ẹ máa yẹ ọyàn an wò, k'á ba tètè gbógun tìí b'ó bá jẹ́ jẹjẹrẹ.

English: Women should eat the vegetable benth, which produces water in excess to curb breast cancer.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀fọ́ọ ebòlò, a ṣ'omi lójú kàrokàro ni kí obìnrin ó máa jẹ̀ láti dínàa jẹjẹrẹ ọmú.

English: The breast is cut off this day if it is affected by cancer, this beauty eat benth vegetable, do not give breast cancer a chance.
Yoruba: Gíge dànù ni à ń gé ọyàn t'ó bá ti ní kòkòròo jẹjẹrẹ lóde ònìí, ẹlẹ́lẹ̀ yìí máa jẹ ẹ̀fọ́ ebòlò má ṣe fún jẹjẹrẹ ọmú láyé.

English: This hip East Nashville cocktail lounge crafts inventive drinks using offbeat, seasonal ingredients, along with draft wines, sophisticated small plates and charcuterie boards.
Yoruba: Yàrá ìgbàlódé ohun mímu àdàlùu East Nashville yìí máa ń ṣe ohun-mimu àrà ọ̀tọ̀ nípa lílo àwọn èròjà tí àkókò-kan-nínú-ọdún, pẹ̀lú ọtí wàìnì tí a pọn lẹ́nu ẹ̀rọ, àwọn àwo kéékèèké tí ò lẹ́lẹ́gbẹ́ àti pátákó ẹran-tútù-sísè.

English: Stylish velvet horseshoe banquettes and brass fixtures add an intimate feel to the upscale space.
Yoruba: Àga bàtà ẹṣin aláràn-án tí ó bá ìgbà mu àti idẹ tí a fi ṣẹ̀ṣọ́ sii lára-á mú u rí bí àyè ọlọ́lá.

English: Great vibe + fantastic, inspired cocktails without all the pretense.
Yoruba: Ìrísí dídára + ńlá, ìmísí ohun mímu àdàlù dáradára tí kò ní ẹ̀tàn nínú rárá.

English: Zagat editor Molly Moker heads to 44 Farms in Cameron, Texas, for a first-hand look at some of the work that goes into raising the ranch's black Angus beef.
Yoruba: Molly Moker tí ó jẹ́ olóòtú Zagat kọrí sí ọ̀dọ̀ àgbẹ̀ 44 ní Cameron, Texas, láti fi ojúkorojú wo díẹ̀ lára iṣẹ́ tí ó ní láti jẹ́ ṣíṣe fún ìgbésókèe ọgbà-ẹranko ẹran màálù dúdú Augus.

English: Rock Stars Redefining the Industry
Yoruba: Àwọn Ìràwọ̀ Akọrin Rock ń fún iléeṣẹ́ náà nítumọ̀ mìíràn

English: Meet the Zagat 30 Under 30 rock stars.
Yoruba: Mọ àwọn ìràwọ̀ Zagat 30 tí kò tó ọmọ ọgbọ̀n ọdún.

English: From a tricycle-riding barista in Boston to an Austin goat farmer who moonlights as a brewer, these visionaries need to be on your must-watch list.
Yoruba: Láti òṣìṣẹ́ẹ kẹ̀kẹ́-ẹlẹ́sẹ̀mẹ́ta kan ni Boston sí àgbé ẹlẹ́ranọ̀sìn ewúrẹ́ ní Autin tí òkìkíi rẹ̀ kàn gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ọ̀pọntí, ó yẹ kí o kíyèsí àwọn ẹni ológo ọjọ́ ọ̀la wọ̀nyí.

English: It's Hawaiian Surf Culture, catch a wave with Big Wave Dave and learn why royalty loved to surf the perfect long waves found on Waikiki beach year round.
Yoruba: Àṣàa Wa-pátákó-lórí-omi Hawaii ni, wá darapọ̀ mọ́ Big Wave Dave kí o mọ ìdíi rẹ̀ tí àwọn ẹni ọlọ́lá fi nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí pátákó-wíwà lórí ìgbì omi ní orí etíkun Waikiki tí ó máa ń wà yíká ọdún.

English: A true surfing ohana, husband, wife, son, and dog........we are super excited to host this experience, we have been hosting on AirBnB since 2014, as hosts we have been sharing the surf experience with all our guests.
Yoruba: Ẹbíi pátákó-wíwà-lórí-ìgbé-omi tòótọ́, ọkọ, aya, ọmọ ọkùnrin, àti ajá………ara wá yá rékọjá gidigidi láti gba àlejò ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ mánigbàgbé yìí, a ti ń gbàlejò lóríi AirBnB láti ọdún-un 2014, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi olùgbàlejò a ti ń ṣàlàyé àwọn ìríríi bí wọ́n ṣe ń wa-pátákó-lórí-ìgbé-omi fún àwọn àlejòo wa.

English: Prying ourselves away from the historic center of Paris, we'll walk into the picturesque Latin Quarter to learn how to burn witches and see a former CIA false-front store where the KGB watched from across the street.
Yoruba: À ń tìkára wa ṣe ìbojúwò kúrò láti àárín-gbùngbùn-un ìlú tí ó kún fún ìtàn-an nì Paris, a óò rìn wọ inú ilée Latin Quarter tí ó rẹwà ní wíwò láti kọ́ bí a ti ṣe ń dáná sun àwọn àjẹ́ àti láti wo ilé ìtajà oníwájú-ìdíbọ́n fún ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ CIA ìgbà kan rí níbi tí KGB ti ń ṣọ́ ojú pópó.

English: While in Fundy, tidal bore rafting is a great water-coaster experience; you can ride 8-foot waves in the Shubenacadie River and then mudslide like a child again on its banks.
Yoruba: Ní Fundy, ọkọ̀-ojú-omi-afátẹ́gùn-sínú-rẹ̀ tí ó ti ìṣàn odò wá jẹ́ ìríríi bèbè omi ńlá kan; o leè wa ọkọ̀ lórí ìgbì-omi ìwọ̀n ẹsẹ̀ 8 ní Odò Shubenacadie tí wà á sì tún yọ̀ nínú ẹrẹ̀ bí ọmọdé ní bèbèe rẹ̀.

English: Once we are able to do this

English: The only thing associated with it is that...

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, ṣé ọkùnrin tí ìyàwó ẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí ń bá sùn rè é?

Yoruba: Rárá, Ọkọ mi tẹ́lẹ̀ rí ni, èyí tí mo sọ fún ẹ nípa ẹ̀

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, mo rántí pé o ní òun ló ra ọkọ̀ yẹn fún un

English: --- Nigeria plans to recruit more troops
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà yóò gba ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun tuntun.

English: Nigeria is planning to recruit more troops and officers to beef up personnel of the security agencies, to contain the threats and security concerns in the land.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti setán láti gba ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun tuntun láti fi kún àwọn ọmọ ogun tó wà nílẹ̀ láti le gbógun ti ìdúnkoòkò àti ètò ààbò tó ń ṣe sége-sège.

English: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo this when he received clergymen from the Northern part of Nigeria under the auspices of the Arewa Pastors Forum for Peace, on a courtesy visit to the Presidential Villa on Monday.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Òsínbàjò ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ẹgbẹ́ àwọn àlùfáà láti ìlà oòrùn, Arewa Pastors Forum for Peace, nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá, lọ́jọ́ Ajé.

English: Professor Osinbajo said; “We are doing everything that needs to be done.
Yoruba: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Òsínbàjò tún ní; “ À ń sa ipá wa lórí ètò ààbò.

English: “We are handling security well, and as you know, including military deployment in diverse fields, like the Boko Haram in the Northeast.
Yoruba: “Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ se mọ̀ pé, à ń sa ipá wa lórí ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, nípa kíkó àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun lọ sí ìlà oòrùn láti kojú ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram.

English: In fact, we have to now recruit more into the army, resources also – to buy more arms and more platforms.”
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, a fẹ́ gba àwọn ọmọ ogun tuntun láti fi kún àwọn tó wà nílẹ̀, a tún ti ya owó kan sọ́tọ̀ láti fi ra irinsẹ́ ogun.

English: Government Priority He stated that the Buhari administration considered tackling insecurity a very serious task.
Yoruba: "Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ̀n Òsínbàjò tún ní ìjọba ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari kò káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa mójútó ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: The Vice President urged the group as ‘Men of God,” to come up with ideas on how to find lasting peace.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ wá rọ ẹgbẹ́ àwọn àlùfáà náà pé ‘Ẹ̀yin ènìyàn Ọlọ́run," ẹ wá ètò tí ìjọba yóò máa tẹ̀lé láti mójútó ètò ààbò.

English: The President of the Forum, Bishop Mbayo Japhet said the visit to the Presidential Villa was to support the government and described Professor Osinbajo as an apostle of peace.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà, Bisobu Mbayo Japhet náà sọ pé àwọn wá sílé ààrẹ láti wá sàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba láti tún wá sàpèjúwe ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Òsínbàjò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn àlááfíà.

English: --- Nigerian Government to maintain subsidy on rail transport fares – Minister
Yoruba: --- A ò ní fowó kún ọkọ̀ ojú irin nítorí àwọn mẹ̀kúnù- Rotimi Amaechi.

English: The Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi, on Monday, said the government will not further increase ticket prices on the Abuja-Kaduna rail route, Several people have called for an increase in the ticket price to ensure the railway makes enough profit to pay back the loans incurred in building it and become sustainable.
Yoruba: Bí àwọn ènìyàn se ń pè láti jẹ́ kí wọ́n fi owó kún iye tí àwọn ènìyàn ń wọ ọkọ̀ ojú irin, kí ìjọba leè tètè san owó tí wọ́n ya padà láti fi ra ọkọ́ ojú irin náà sùgbọ́n mínísítà fún ètò ìrìnnà, Rotimi Amaechi ti ní ìjọba kò ní dẹ́kun láti máa sèrànwọ́ nípa fífi owó kún ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Àbújá sí Kaduna.

English: But Amaechi, who spoke in an interview, said railways don’t make profits (from passenger ticket prices) across the world because they are usually subsidized.
Yoruba: Amaechi, sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọrọ̀yìn sọrọ̀, pé ní gbogbo àgbáyé kò sí ibi tí wọ́n ti ń lo ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti pa owó sápò ìjọba.

English: “If we increase the cost of the tickets, what about the poor man that wants to move from Abuja to Kaduna, that lives in Kaduna to save the cost of accommodation,” he said.
Yoruba: Amaechi ní “Tí a bá fi owó kún iye tí àwọn ènìyàn ń wọ ọkọ̀ ojú irin, Báwo ni àwọn mẹ̀kúnù tí wọn ń se isẹ́ ní Àbújá, sùgbọ́n tí wọn ń gbé ní Kàdúná nítorí owó ilé".

English: Meanwhile, to solve the problem of ticket racketeering on the Abuja-Kaduna rail route, the Minister said the Nigeria Railway Corporation (NRC) is set to roll out new locomotives and coaches.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, láti wá ojútùú sí ìpèníjà tó wà níbi ríra ìwé ìrìnnà ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Àbújá sí Kàdúná, mínísítà ní ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó ọkọ̀ ojú irin Nigeria Railway Corporation (NRC) yóò tún pèsè àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin tuntun.

English: On the Lagos-Ibadan railway, the Minister declined to give a deadline for the route’s completion.
Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Èkó sí Ìbàdàn Mínísítà kò fésìì lórí ìgbà tí ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Èkó sí Ìbàdàn yóò parí.

English: Amaechi said “What they told us the first time was April 2020.
Yoruba: Amaechi ní “Ohun tí wọn sọ fún wa ni pé wọn yóò parí isẹ́ náà ní osú kẹrin, ọdún 2020.

English: But they ran into problems.
Yoruba: Sùgbọ́n wọ́n ní ìpèníjà.

English: Their goods were yet to be cleared from the seaport.
Yoruba: Wọn kò tí ì rí ẹrù wọn gbà láti èbúté ọkọ̀ ojú omi.

English: --- Federal Govt., U.S to sign agreement on assets repatriation
Yoruba: --- Orílẹ̀ èdè Amerika àti Nàíjíríà yóò tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn láti da $321m padà.

English: The Federal Government of Nigeria is to sign a tripartite agreement with the Island of New Jersey and the United States of America on repatriation of looted assets worth $321million.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti gbaradi láti tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhun pẹlu ilu New Jersey ati United States of America nípa dídá $321m owó orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tí wọ́n jí kó pamọ́ si orílẹ̀ èdè naa.

English: This is part of the Federal Government’s efforts to recover more stolen funds stashed abroad.
Yoruba: Ìwé àdéhùn náà wa lára ìgbìyànjú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti rí i pé gbogbo owó tí àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ kan kó sálọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ni wọ́n dá padà sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami, SAN, is expected to sign on behalf of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, he has departed Nigeria to United States-Nigeria on Sunday
Yoruba: Mínístà fún ètò ìdájọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Abubakar Malami ní yóò máa tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn ọ̀hún lórúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ni ó ti fi orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà sílẹ̀ lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè America, lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

English: The meeting is an annual event between Nigeria and the U.S. aimed at reviewing bilateral relations and taking necessary steps to advance mutual interest in all diplomatic areas among the two countries.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé ọ̀hún ló máa ń wáyé lọ́dọọdún láàrin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti America láti se àgbéyẹ̀wò nípa ìbásepọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì, lọ́nà tí ìbásepọ̀ wọn yóò tún se leè múná-dóko sii.

English: Some other Nigerian government delegates expected to be part of the meeting include: the Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment, Otunba Adeniyi Adebayo; Minister of Defence, Maj.-Gen. Bashir Magashi (rtd); Minister of Foreign Affairs, Geoffrey Onyeama; National Security Adviser, Maj.-Gen. Babagana Monguno (rtd) as well as Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó lọ sojú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nílẹ̀ America níbi ìpàdé náà ní: Mínísítà fún ọ̀rọ̀ ilé-isẹ́, ètò isẹ́ àti okoòwò Otúnba Adéníyì Adébáyò, Mínísítà fún ètò abbo, Maj.-Gen.Bashir Magashi (rtd), Mínísítà fún ilẹ́ ókeeré, Geoffrey Onyeama, olùdámọ̀ràn fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ lórí ètò aabo, Maj.-Gen.Babagana Monguno (rtd) àti mínísítà fún ètó ọmọnìyàn, àjálù àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ.

English: --- Plateau Governor orders arrest of community leaders as death toll increases
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà pàsẹ láti mú àwọn adarí agbègbè, bí ẹ̀mí se ń sòfò ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

English: Death toll has risen to 22 in the killings in some communities in the central zone of Plateau State.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀mí tó ti sọnù ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau ti di méjìlélógún báyìí, bi ìwà ìpànìyàn se ń tẹ̀síwájú.

English: Governor Simon Lalong confirmed the casualty figure on Tuesday when he met with the community leaders at the Government House in Jos, the state capital.
Yoruba: Gomina Simon Lalong lo sọ eleyii lasiko to n se ipade pẹlu awọn adari agbegbe lọjọ Ìsẹ́gun nile gomina to wa ni Jos, to jẹ olú-ìlú ipinlẹ Plateau.

English: While appraising the security situation before it gets out of hand, he stated his displeasure with the efforts of the security agencies and the role of leaders in some of the communities that have been under severe attacks recently.
Yoruba: Ó wá fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lori ọwọ́ tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá, agbófinró àti adarí agbègbè ọ̀hún se mú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí ó tún jẹ́ kí ìwà ìpàìyàn náà tún fi lee si ́i ju ti àtẹ̀yìnwá lọ.

English: The governor decried the latest attacks where gunmen invaded Ruboi and Marish communities in Bokkos Local Government Area of the state.
Yoruba: Gómìnà tún fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí bí àwọn agbébọn kan se kọlu àgbègbè Ruboi àti Marish ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Bokkos tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: During the unfortunate incident, at least 15 people were killed and five others injured with several buildings destroyed.
Yoruba: Lásìkò ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ènìyàn mẹ́ẹ̀dógún ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn, nígbà tí ènìyàn márùn ún farapa, tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ dúkìá àti ilé sì jóná.

English: Governor Lalong read the riot act at the meeting and condemned the activities of those he called elements who were bent on taking the state back to the dark days of chaos.
Yoruba: Lásìkò ìpàdé ọ̀hún ni Lalong wá ka ìwé òfin sí etí àwọn tó bá tún fẹ́ gbìmọ̀ràn láti dá wàhálà mííràn sílẹ̀.

English: He, therefore, ordered the arrest of community leaders in the affected areas until the suspects involved in the various attacks were produced.
Yoruba: Ó wá pàsẹ pé kí wọn mú àwọn adarí àgbègbè níbi tí wàhálà náà ti wáyé, títí tí wọn yóò fi mú àwọn afurasí tó lọ́wọ́ nínú wàhálà náà.

English: The Commissioner of Police in Plateau, Mr Isaac Akinmoyede, was among the stakeholders present at the meeting.
Yoruba: Kọmísọ́nà ọlọ́pàá fún ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau, Isaac Akínmóyèdé, jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìpàdé ọ̀hún.

English: In his briefing, he cautioned the community leaders against instigating members to take up arms in situations and not to harbour criminals in their domain.
Yoruba: Ó wá kìlọ̀ fún àwọn adarí àgbègbè ọ̀hún láti máa se gba ìwà ọ̀daràn láàyè ní agbègbè wọn.

English: The meeting held two days after reports that 13 were killed in an attack by gunmen on Kwatas village also in Bokkos Local Government Area of the state.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé náà wáyé lẹ́yìn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó gba ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní àgbègbè Kwatas ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Bokkos ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

English: According to police authorities in the state, the assailants suspected to be herdsmen attacked the village on Sunday night.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gé bí àwọn ọlọ́pàá se sọ pé, àwọn ọ̀daràn daran-daran ló wá se ọsẹ́ ní agbègbè ọ̀hún ní àsálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú.

English: --- Fire guts sections of Lagos market
Yoruba: --- Ìjàḿbà iná ní ọjà Balogun nílùú Eko.

English: Some buildings at the Balogun market, located on Lagos Island are currently on fire.
Yoruba: Ìjàḿbà iná ń sẹlẹ lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ ní ọjà Balogun nílùú Eko báyìí,.

English: This incident comes about a week after a similar inferno razed a timber market in the Mushin area of Lagos.
Yoruba: Eléyìí wáyé lẹ́yìn ìjàm̀bá iná kan tí ó sẹlẹ̀ ni ọjà Mushin ní ọjọ karun un sẹ́yìn níbi tí àwọn ọlọ́jà ti pàdánù ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye dúk̀ía wọn.

English: --- President Buhari cautions against reprisal on Plateau attacks
Yoruba: --- Àwọn agbébọ́n pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned attacks that resulted in the death of 13 persons in Plateau State, assuring Citizens that terrorism, banditry, kidnapping and associated crimes would be defeated.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Naijiria , Muhammadu Buhari ti fi àìdùnú rẹ̀ hàn sí bí àwọn agbébọn se pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau, ààrẹ wá fi dá àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà lójú pé,gbogbo ìwà ìpànìyàn, ìdígunjalè, ìjínigbé àti àwọn ìwa ọ̀daràn mìíràn kò ní pẹ́ di àfisẹ́yìn tí eégún ń fi asọ.

English: President Buhari reiterated that “revenge, hatred and violent attacks should have no place in a multi-ethnic, multicultural and multi-religious society as we have in this country.’’
Yoruba: “Ààrẹ Buhari wá rọ àwọn ènìyàn náà pé “ kò sí ànfààní níbi ẹ̀san, ìkórìíra àti ìwà ipá níbi tí ẹlẹ́yà púpọ̀, ẹlẹ́sìn àti àṣà orísìírìsí  bá wà, gẹ́gẹ́ bí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, tí a wà yíí.

English: The President called on community and religious leaders to counsel the youths on the need for peaceful co-existence.
Yoruba: ’’ Ààrẹ wá rọ àwọn adarí ẹlẹ́sìn àti adarí agbègbè náà láti rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ wọn nípa ìbásepọ̀ àlááfíà.

English: President Buhari sends condolences to families of the victims, government and people of Plateau State.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá bá àwọn ẹbí àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau kẹ́dùn lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú ọ̀hún.

English: --- Nigeria partners with Netherlands on education
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà àti Netherland yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètọ ẹ̀kọ́.

English: The Nigerian Government and the Kingdom of the Netherlands are partnering to explore areas of partnership in the education sector as a means of deepening relationship.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti Netherlands ti fohùnsọ̀kan láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètọ ẹ̀kọ́, kí ìbásepọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà tún le fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ síi.

English: The Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Education, Sonny Echono, stated this in Abuja when a team from the Netherlands Institute of International Relations Clingendael, led by its General Director, Monika Sie Dhian Ho, paid him a working visit.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé ìjọba àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ẹ̀kọ́, Sonny Echono, ló sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá, lásìkò tí ikọ̀ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Netherlands Institute of International Relations Clingendael, tí ọ̀gbẹ́ni Monika Sie Dhian Ho, jẹ́ adarí rẹ̀, yọjú síí.

English: The Permanent Secretary said Nigeria stands to gain a lot from the partnership.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé ìjọba fún àjọ ọ̀hún ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò jẹ́ ànfààní púpọ̀ nípa ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ náà.

English: According to the Permanent Secretary, “there are many aspects of the education sector that needs the intervention of investors from the advanced world”.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ̀wé náà se sọ ó ní, “Orísìírísìí ọ̀nà nípa ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ló nílò ìrànwọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn olókoòwò láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè".

English: Sonny Echono reiterated that the Nigerian Government was opened to all investment interventions in the sector.
Yoruba: Sonny Echono sọ pé ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ṣetán láti bá àwọn tó bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ètò okòowó lórí ẹ̀kọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ṣe.

English: Echono urged the Dutch government to consider partnering with Nigeria in developing the Agricultural education, Information and Communication Technology and Vocational education subsectors.
Yoruba: Echono tún wá rọ ìjọba orílẹ̀ Dutch láti tún fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lórí ètò ọ̀gbìn, ìròyìn àti ị̀mọ̀ ẹ̀rọ àti ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nípa isẹ́ ọwọ́.

English: Earlier, the General Director of the Institute, Monika Sie Dhian said that the team was sent by the Dutch government to find areas of collaboration with the Nigerian government to help its developmental efforts.
Yoruba: Sáájú èyí ni, olùdarí ilé -ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀hún, Monika Sie Dhian wá sọ pé ìjọba orílẹ̀ Dutch, ló rán àwọn wá sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti wá béèrè ọ̀nà tí ìjọba ọ̀hún yóò fi leè fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Senate sets priorities ahead of resumption
Yoruba: --- Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò sàgbéyẹ̀wò ètò ààbò, òfin epo rọ̀bì àti ìdìbò.

English: The Nigerian Senate has set as top most on its agenda in 2020, the issues of security, Petroleum Industry Bill, PIB and electoral reforms as the Lawmakers reconvene in plenary this Tuesday after a month Christmas recess.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórilẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti se ìpinnu fún ọdún 2020, láti mójútó ètò ààbò, òfin fún epo rọ̀bì àti àtúnse òfin lórí ètò ìdìbò, ní kété tí wọ́n bá ti wọlé lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹ́gun.

English: President of the senate Dr. Ahmad Lawan observed that the heightening spate of insecurity was of growing concern that requires the collective effort of the Executive and Legislature, alongside all tiers of government at the State and Local levels.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Ahmad Lawan ní òhun wòye bí ẹsẹ̀ ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí se ń se sége-sège bí ẹsẹ̀ télọ̀ jẹ́ ojúse gbogbo wọn yálà, ìjọba àpapọ̀, ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti gbogbo àwọn ìpele ìjọba tí ó wà, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ ní láti mójútó.

English: The Senate President added that the Upper Chamber, upon resuming on Tuesday 28, 2020, would adjourn till Wednesday in accordance with its tradition to honour the demise of a member of the House of Representative, Muhammadu Gawo, representing Garki/Babura Federal Constituency in Jigawa State, who passed away in Dubai during the Christmas break.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé, nígbà tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin bá wọlé lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹ́gun ọjọ́ kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n, Ọdún 2020 wọn yóò tún sún ìjokòó ọ̀hún síwájú di ọjọ́Rú ni ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà wọn láti bu ọlá fún ọ̀kan nínú wọn tí ó jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nipé lásìkò àjọ̀dún kérésìmesì ní Dubai, ìyẹn olóògbé Muhammadu Gawo, tó ń sojú fún Garki/Babura ní ìpínlẹ̀ Jigawa.

English: --- Cross River State seeks support for  Deep Sea Port
Yoruba: --- Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River ń fẹ́ àtìlẹ́yìn fún ìbùdó omi òkun.

English: The Cross River State government has appealed to Nigerian government for assistance towards completing the super high way and Bakasi Deep Sea Port, which the State is currently constructing.
Yoruba: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River ti rọ ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti sàtìlẹyìn fún ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ àti ìbùdó omi òkun tó wà ní Bakasi tí ìpínlẹ̀ náà ti dawọ́lé.

English: The State Governor, Professor Ben Ayade made the appeal on Monday, at the Presidential Villa, Abuja, after he met with President Muhammadu Buhari.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ben Ayádé lọ bẹ̀bẹ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé, nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá, lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari.

English: The Governor said the two projects were of significant importance to both Cross River State and the country at large.
Yoruba: Gómìnà náà sọ pé isẹ́ àkànṣe méjì ní ìjọba òhun tí gùnlé, ní èyí tí ó se pàtàkì sí ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: He said: “I will like to commend Mr. President most especially for his usual kindness towards the people of Nigeria and Cross River in particular.
Yoruba: Ó ní: “Mo gbóróyìn fún ààrẹ Buhari fún ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ sí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti pàápàá jùlọ fún ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River.

English: However, the discussion also went beyond that to his key trust, which is Nigeria beyond oil.
Yoruba: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀ ìjíròrò wa kìí se lórí ìgbàgbọ́ tí a ní nínú ìsèjọba yìí nìkan sùgbọ́n a tún jíròrò nípa ohun tí ó ju epo rọ̀bì lọ.

English: Governor Ayade assured the people that he would continue to implement projects that would impact on their lives.
Yoruba: Gómìnà Ayade wá fọkàn gbogbo àwọn ́ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Rivers balẹ̀ pé, òun yóò túbọ̀ máa tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ àwọn isẹ́ àkànse tí àwọn ènìyàn yóò máa jẹ ìgbádùn rẹ̀.

English: Employment Generation He announced that the State intends to generate employment for over two thousand young people through agriculture.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà tí pinnu láti fún ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní isẹ́ nípa ètò ìdàgbàsókè ohun ọ̀gbìn.

English: The Governor said President Buhari would soon visit the State to inaugurate an empowerment scheme for the youth tagged ‘G-Money
Yoruba: Gómìnà tún sọ pé ààrẹ Buhari kò ní pẹ́ wá sí ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti wá se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ àwọn ètò ìrónilágbára fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ bí i ‘ètò G-Money ’.

English: --- NAF destroys ISWAPs’ staging area in Borno
Yoruba: --- Ilé-isẹ́ ogun òfurufú ti dáná sun ibùdó ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ (ISWAP) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

English: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) has destroyed an Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) staging area at Gashigar in Borno, and neutralised several of the insurgents.
Yoruba: Ilé-isẹ́ ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú (Nigerian Air Force NAF) ti dáná sun ibùdó ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀, Islamic State of West Africa Province, (ISWAP) tó wà ní Gashigar ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

English: NAF said it also took out terrorists’ hideouts at Tumbun Rego on the fringes of Lake Chad and at Bula Bello near Sambisa Forest all in Borno.
Yoruba: Ilé-isẹ́ NAF sọ pé wọn tún se ìkọ̀lù sí ibi tí àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀  ń sá pamọ́ sí ní àwọn agbègbè  Tumbun Rego tó wà ní  Lake Chad àti  Bula Bello ní agbègbè igbó Sambisa ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

English: Air Commodore Ibikunle Daramola, NAF Director of Public Relations and Information who made this known in Abuja, added that it was achieved in air strikes conducted by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation LAFIYA DOLE on Friday and Saturday on the heels of credible intelligence reports.
Yoruba: Air Commodore Ìbíkúnlé Dáramólá, NAF tó jẹ́ adarí ẹka ìbára-ẹni-sepọ̀ àti ìròyìn ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílùú Àbújá láti sọ nípa ìkọlù orí afẹ́fẹ́ ti ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú, Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation LAFIYA DOLE se láti fi dáná sun ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀.

English: --- Tax revenue will reduce borrowing in Nigeria – SGF
Yoruba: --- Ìjọba àpapọ̀ kò nilò láti ya owó nílẹ̀ òkèèrè – SGF.

English: Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF), Mr. Boss Mustapha has stated that if more revenue could be generated from tax there would be less need for government to borrow.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Naijiria, Boss Mustapha ti ní ti ìjọba bá leè máa rí owó nípa sísan owó –orí, wọn kò nílò láti tún yá owó mọ́.

English: Boss Mustapha made this known in his office when the Executive Chairman, Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS), Mr. Mohammed M. Nami and Service’s Board paid him a courtesy visit.
Yoruba: Boss Mustapha sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ni ọ́fíìsì rẹ̀ lásìkò tí alága ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó ètò bí owó se ń wọlé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà (FIRS), Mohammed M. Nami se ẹ́ -kááre, ẹ -ǹ- lẹ́- níbẹ̀ -yẹn sii.

English: The SGF advised the FIRS Chairman to be proactive in his tax collection drive.
Yoruba: Boss Mustapha tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba àpapọ̀ nílò gbogbo owó láti leè jẹ́ kí ó se ojú rẹ̀.

English: The SGF congratulated the FIRS Chairman on his recent appointment.
Yoruba: Ó wá kí alága àti ìgbìmọ̀ rẹ̀ kú orí –ire fún ipò tuntun wọn.

English: --- President Buhari authorises air raid on bandits’ hideouts in Niger State
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari pàsẹ láti kọlu jàǹdùkú,ọ̀daràn àti olè lórí afẹ́fẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Niger.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has authorised the deployment of air power to counter the menace of bandits operating in the forest area bordering Kaduna, Niger and Zamfara states, The President has received assurances that with the harmattan dust gradually easing its hold on the skies, fighter aircraft would this week join the efforts to provide effective air attacks against bandits, kidnappers and cattle rustlers that have been attacking remote communities around Dogon Gona forest in Niger State.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti pàsẹ pé kí àwọn ọmọ ogun orí òfurufú bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìkọlù orí afẹ́fẹ́ láti gbógun ti gbogbo àwọn jàǹdùkú,ọ̀daràn àti olè tí wọ́n ń lo inú igbó láti se isẹ́ ibi wọn ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, Niger ati Zamfara Ààrẹ ti rí ìdánilójú pé bí eruku ojú ọjọ́ ṣe ń kúrò lójú òfurufú, àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun orí afẹ́fẹ́ yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́sẹ̀ yìí láti maa ṣe ikọlu si gbogbo ibi ti àwọn ọ̀daràn daran-daran máa n sa pamọ́ sí láti se àwọn ènìyàn ní ìjàm̀bá pàápàá jùlọ ni agbègbè Dogon Gona ni ipinlẹ Niger,tó jẹ́ ààrin gbùngbùn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: President Buhari described the repeated attacks leading to the losses of several lives in the communities “as a disaster for the nation.”
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá sàpèjúwe àwọn ìkọlù tó ń wáyé ní agbègbè ọ̀hún, ní èyí tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn bí “òfò fún orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: In line with this directive, the Nigerian Air Force is setting up refuelling facilities at Minna, Niger State to support the aircraft operations.
Yoruba: "Ní ìbámu ìlànà yìí, ilé-isẹ́ ọmọ ogun òfurufú àti agbófinró orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti setán láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní pẹrẹu láti ṣe ìkọlù sí àwọn ọ̀daràn nílùú Minna, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Niger láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú.

English: President Buhari commiserates with the government and people of Niger State following the attacks and the loss of lives that followed.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá bá ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Niger àti àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Niger kẹ́dùn lórí ìkọlù àti òfò ẹ̀mí tó sẹlẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: The president assures that victim communities in the state will not be abandoned by the rest of the country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ wá fi dá àwọn tó farapa níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lójú pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà kò ní gbàgbé wọn.

English: --- Nigeria, India to strengthen bilateral ties
Yoruba: --- India yóò ran Nàíjíríà lọ́wọ́ nípa ètò ajé, okòòwò, ààbò,ẹ̀kọ́.

English: India says it is ready to strengthen bilateral relations with Nigeria in the areas of Trade and investments, Security, Education, Aviation and medical tourism for the benefit of both countries.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè India ti sọ pé òhun setán láti túbọ̀ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nípa ètò ajé, okòòwò, ààbò, ẹ̀kọ́, ọkọ̀ òfurufú àti ètò ìgbafẹ́ nípa ìlera fún àǹfààní orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì.

English: The Indian High Commissioner to Nigeria, Mr. Abhay Thakur, stated this, during the celebration of the Indian 70th year Republic Day and the 60th anniversary of the establishment of Nigeria/India diplomatic relations, organized by the Commission in Abuja, the Nigeria’s capital.
Yoruba: Asojú orílẹ̀ èdè Inidia ní Nàíjíríà, Arákùnrin Abhay Thakur sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tí orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀hún ń se ayẹyẹ àádọ́rin ọdún tí wọń gba òmìnira àti ọgọ́ta ọdún tí orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì náà ń bá ara wọn se papọ̀, ní èyí tó wáyé nílùú Àbújá, lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: Abhay Thakur explained that “India is Nigeria’s largest trading partner, and Nigeria is Indian largest partner in Africa.
Yoruba: Abhay Thakur sàlàyé pé “India jẹ́ alábàáṣepọ̀ nínú ètò ìṣòwò tí ó tóbi jùlọ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, àti Nàíjíríà náà sì jẹ́ alábàáṣepọ̀ tí ó tóbi jùlọ lórílẹ̀ èdè India ní Afirika.

English: Nigeria has been the third largest supplier of crude oil and second largest supplier of Liquefied Natural Gas (NLG) to India in the year 2019-20.”
Yoruba: Àwọn pàṣípààrọ̀ lórí ètò okoòwò láàrin orílẹ̀ méjèèjì ọ̀hún ti gòkè àgbà láàrin oṣù mẹ́jọ àkọ́kọ́ lọ́dún 2019-20.

English: India stands together with Nigeria in its fight against Boko Hatam.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè India ti pèsè ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún Nàíjíríà nípa gbígbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram.

English: The Nigerian State Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ambassador  Zubairu Dada, reiterated Nigerias commitment to boost diplomatic relations with India for the mutual benefits of the two countries.
Yoruba: " Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ọ̀rọ̀ òkèèrè lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Zubairu Dada, náà tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà pẹ̀lú India lọ́nà tí ìbásepọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀ méjèèjì náà yóò se tún leè tẹ̀síwájú sii:

English: Zubairu said: “As Nigeria and India celebrate their 60th year of the establishment of the diplomatic relations and India celebrating its 70th years anniversary of its National Day, Nigeria is committed to consolidating on the existing of mutual trust on deepening cooperation in various fields.
Yoruba: Zubairu sọ pé “ Bí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti India se ń se ayẹyẹ ọgọ́ta ọdún lórí ìbásepọ̀ wọn, tí Inidia náà sì ń se ayẹyẹ àádọ́rin ọdún tí wọn ti gba òmìnira, Nàíjíríà yóò tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú India lọ́nà tí ìbásepọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀ méjèèjì náà yóò se tún leè tẹ̀síwájú síi:"

English: India and Nigeria have been enjoying diplomatic relations since November 1958.
Yoruba: Láti  osù kọkànlá, ọdún 1958 ni orílẹ̀ èdè India àti Nàíjíríà  ti ń bá ara wọn se papọ̀.

English: --- Clerics pray for peace in Nigeria
Yoruba: --- Àwọn àáfà gbàdúrà fún àlàáfíà orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The prayer session was conducted during a wedding Fathia attended by President Muhammadu Buhari between his niece, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal and Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, at the National Mosque Abuja.
Yoruba: Àpèjọ àdúrà náà wáyé lásìkò ìgbéyàwó àbúrò ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal àti Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, tí ó wáyé ní Mọsalasi ìlú Àbújá, ní èyí tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari náà wà níbẹ̀.

English: At the event, the President blessed the couple, while clerics used the opportunity to pray for extensively for peace and stability in the country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari lo àsìkò ayẹyẹ náà láti gbàdúrà fún tọkọ-taya, bákan náà ni àwọn àáfà lo ànfààní náà láti gba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àdúrà fún ètò àlàáfíà, ìdúrósinsin àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The President’s family at the Islamic wedding was represented by Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Muhammed Bello alongside the Dan Madamin Daura, Alhaji Musa Haro.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìgbéyàwó ọ̀hún tí wọn sojú ẹbí ààrẹ níbi ìgbéyàwó náà ni Mínísítà ìlú Àbújá, Muhammed Bello pẹ̀lú Dan Madamin Daura àti Alhaji Musa Haro.

English: --- Nigeria legalizes agreement with Macao on transfer of sentenced persons
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà ti fẹnukò pẹ̀lú Marco láti dá àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n padà sílé.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has assented to the Instrument of Ratification of the Agreement on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons between the Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and the Government of the Macao Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti fẹnukò pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Republic of China láti da àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n wà lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n lórílẹ̀ èdè China padà sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: This is sequel to the Federal Executive Council’s Decision of August 1, 2018, which approved and directed the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami, to prepare the Instrument of Ratification of the above Agreement for the President’s signature.
Yoruba: Ìpinnu yìí wá lára ohun tí ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ fẹnukò lé lórí ní ọjọ́ kínní, oṣù kejì, ọdún, 2018, ìgbìmọ̀ Ìjoba pàsẹ fún àdájọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tí ó tún jẹ́ mínísítà fún ètò ìdájọ́, Abubakar Malami láti se ìwé àdéhùn tí ààrẹ yóò bọwọ́lù.

English: Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina revealed this to Journalists in a statement issued on Friday.
Yoruba: Olùràlọ́wọ́ ààrẹ fún ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Fémi Adésínà ti fi tó àwọn oníròyìn létí pé ààrẹ ti bọwọ́lu ìwé àdéhùn náà.

English: --- EFCC to repatriate high profile looters – Magu
Yoruba: --- Àjọ EFCC yóò mu ́àwọn tó bá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìwà ìbàjẹ̀ padà sórílẹ̀ Nàíjíríà- Magu.

English: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) says it is set to repatriate high profiled looters on its watch list in some parts of the world.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti síse owó ìlú kúmọ-kúmọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission(EFCC), ti ní gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn jàǹkàn-jàǹkàn tó bá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìwà ìbàjẹ́ sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n sálọ sókè òkun, ni àwọn yóò mú wá padà sórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà  láti wá jẹ́jọ́.

English: The EFCC chairman, Mr Ibrahim Magu disclosed this on Tuesday in Ilorin, the Kwara state capital during a brief chat with newsmen.
Yoruba: Adelé àjọ EFCC, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Ibrahim Magu sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun nílùú Ìlọrin, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn.

English: He announced that a massive protest against corruption would be staged by the Commission and youth Corp members across the federation on the 14th of next month (February) to create awareness on the dangers of corruption.
Yoruba: Magun tún ṣàlàyé pé àjọ náà àti ẹgbẹ́ àwọn àgùnbánirọ̀ yóò ṣe ìkéde ìfẹ̀hónúhàn nípa ewu tó wà níbi ìwà ìbàjẹ́ káàkiri orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lọ́jọ́ kẹrìnlá osù kejì ọdún.

English: He added that no ongoing corruption cases across the country would be abandoned midway, assuring that all such suspects would be charged to court as soon as investigations on their cases are completed.
Yoruba: Magun tún tẹ̀síwájú pé gbogbo ẹ̀sùn nípa ìwà ìbàjẹ́ tí àjọ náà gùnlé ni wọn yóò ri i pé wọn yanjú rẹ̀, tí àwọn afuarasí ọ̀hún yóò fojú balé ẹjọ́, ní kété tí wọn bá ti parí ìwádìí wọn.

English: Magu, said the “Ilorin Zonal Office was not established to witch-hunt anyone,
Yoruba: Magu ní kìí se pé àwọn dá ọfíísì àjọ EFCC sílẹ̀ ní Ìlọrin láti máa mú àwọn aláìsẹ̀.

English: “We need the cooperation of the media in making Nigeria corruption free.
Yoruba: Ó wá rọ́ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àjọ náà kí wọn leè se àseyọrí.

English: --- Supreme Court upholds Simon Lalong’s election as Plateau Governor
Yoruba: --- Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga da Simon Lalong láre gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

English: The Supreme Court has affirmed the election of Simon Lalong as the governor of Plateau State.
Yoruba: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga tó wà ní ìlú Àbújá, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíria ti fòntẹ̀ lu Simon Lalong gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau tí wọ́n dìbò yàn.

English: Jeremiah Useni of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) had filed an appeal at the apex court to challenge the victory of the candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the election.
Yoruba: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga ọ̀hún ní wọn dá ẹjọ́ Jeremiah Useni tí ó jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀ òsèlú Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) tí ó gbé wá sílé ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún nù, pé kò fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ láti tako ìbò tó gbé Simon Lalong wọlè gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlè ọ̀hún.

English: His appeal was, however, struck out in a unanimous judgment of the Supreme Court delivered by Justice Adamu Galinje.
Yoruba: Nínú ẹjọ́ tí adájọ́ Adamu Galinje dá ni ó ti sọ pé olùfẹ̀sùnkàn náà kò ní ẹ̀rí tó leè fi òtítọ́ ẹ̀sùn rẹ̀ múlẹ̀.

English: --- Supreme Court dismisses appeal challenging Tambuwal’s victory as Sokoto Governor
Yoruba: ---Ilé ẹjọ́ gíga da ẹjọ́ kòtémilọ́rùn tí́ wọn pè tako àṣeyọrí Tambuwal’s gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ sokoto

English: Aminu Tambuwal of the PDP has been affirmed as the winner of the 2019 governorship election in Sokoto State by Nigeria’s Supreme Court.
Yoruba: Aminu Tambuwal olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà láti inú ẹgbẹ́ alábùradà (PDP) ní ilé ẹjọ́ gíga ti gbà gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ẹni tó jáwé olúborí nínú ìdìbò gómìnà ti ọdùn 2019

English: In a judgment read by Justice Uwani Abba-Aji, the justices dismissed the appeal filed by the All Progressives Congress (APC) and its governorship candidate, Ahmad Aliyu for lacking in merit.
Yoruba: Nínú ìdájọ́ tí adájọ́ Abba-Aji kà sóde, Adájọ́ náà dá ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn ti ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú olóṣùṣùọwọ̀ (APC) àti olùdíje fún ẹgbẹ́ náà Ahmad Aliyu pè dànù látàrí pé ẹjọ́ náà kòmúnádóko tó.

English: On Nov. 22, 2019 a five-man panel of the Court of Appeal, presided over by Justice Usaini Murkhtar, dismissed the appeals.
Yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ kejìlélógún osù kọkànlá ọdún 2019 àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́nu márùn ún ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn, tí Adájọ́ Usaini Murkhtar ṣe aládarí wọn da ẹjọ́ náà sígbó.

English: The Appeal Court ruled that the appellant failed to prove his case beyond reasonable doubt, thereby dismissed the case.
Yoruba: Ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn náà sọ pé olùpẹ̀jọ́ náà kòní ẹ̀rí tó múnádóko láti fi yíí àwọn adájọ́ náà lọ́kàn padà ìdí nìyí tí wọn fi da ẹjọ́ náà sígbó.

English: --- Supreme court upholds Ganduje’s victory
Yoruba: --- Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga da Abdullahi Ganduje láre gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano.

English: The Supreme court has declared Ganduje duly elected governor of Kano state.
Yoruba: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti fòntẹ̀ lu Abdullahi Ganduje gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano tí wọ́n dìbò yàn.

English: The panel dismissed the petitions filed by the PDP and Yusuf, governorship candidate of the opposition party, on the grounds that the petitions lack merit.
Yoruba: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga ọ̀hún ni wọ́n dá ẹjọ́ tí Abba Yusuf tó jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú Peoples Democratic Party gbé wá sílé ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún ni pé kò fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀.

English: --- Minister tasks Nigerians on patriotism, commitment to nation building
Yoruba: --- Ẹ jẹ́ onítara àti ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà rere: Lai Mohammed.

English: The Minister of Information and Culture, Alh. Lai Mohammed has urged Nigerians to be patriotic so that the country could have meaningful development.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àsà, Alh. Lai Mohammed ti rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti jẹ olùfọkànsìn àti onítara, kí orílẹ̀ èdè leè ní ìdàgbàsókè tó ní ìtumọ̀.

English: The Minister made the call on Saturday while speaking with Newsmen on the sidelines of a wedding ceremony at the Nigerian Air Force Protestant Church, Lagos.
Yoruba: Mínísítà pe ìpè yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn lásìkò ètò ìgbéyàwó tó wáyé ní ilé-isẹ́ àwọn ọmọ ológun orí afẹ́fẹ́, nílé ìjọ́sìn protestant tó wà nílùú Èkó.

English: He said that Nigerians needed to know that the change they wanted to see in the government should begin from individual homes.
Yoruba: Ó ní ìyípadà tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń fẹ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ìjọba gbọdọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ilé ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan.

English: “We quite appreciate the aspirations of Nigerians and the government remains focused and determined to ensure that all the promises regarding the economy and creating more jobs will come through.
Yoruba: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé “A mọ̀ rírì ohun tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń fẹ́, ìjọba kò sì ní káàrẹ́ láti mú gbogbo ìlérí tí ó se sẹ́, páàpáà jùlọ nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àti láti pèsè isẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ janturu.

English: “Everybody must play his or her own role by being patriotic and making sure we do not incite violence against ourselves or the government.
Yoruba: “Gbogbo ènìyàn gbọdọ̀ mọ ojúse rẹ̀ láti jẹ onítara àti láti máa dáwọ́le ohun tí ó le dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ láàrin ara wa tàbí sí ìjọba.

English: --- Nigeria has made substantial progress in 20 years – Senate President
Yoruba: --- Ìdàgbàsókè ti dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn- Lawan.

English: President of the Senate, Senator Ahmad Lawan, believes that Nigeria has made significant progress over the last twenty years since the country’s return to democracy in 1999.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Ahmad Lawan sọ pé ìyàtọ̀ ńlá àti ìdàgbàsókè ló ti dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti bí ogún sẹ́yìn , lẹ́yìn tí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti padà sí ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa lọ́dún 1999.

English: Senator Lawan stated this in a speech delivered at the 17th Edition of the Daily Trust Dialogue with the theme “Twenty Years of Democracy in Nigeria: Strengths, Weaknesses and Opportunities”, which held in Abuja on Thursday.
Yoruba: Asòfin Ahmad Lawan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nínú ìwé apilẹ̀kọ rẹ̀ níbi ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ìkẹtàdínlógún ti ilé –isẹ́ akọ̀rọ̀yìn Daily Trust Dialogue se àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀, tí wọn pe àkòrí rẹ̀ ní “Ogún ọdún ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa lorílẹ̀ édé Nàíjíríà: Agbára, Aláìlágbára àti  àwọn ànfààní rẹ̀ ", tí ó wáyé nílùú Àbújá lọ́jọ́BỌ̀.

English: The Senate President, who was the Special Guest of Honour at the event, was represented by the Deputy Chief Whip of the Senate, Senator Aliyu Sabi Abdullahi.
Yoruba: Aliyu Sabi Abdullahi, tí ó jẹ́ igbákejì alámòjútó ètò, nílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ló sojú abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Lawan, tí ó jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún.

English: The Senate President while harping on the need to strengthen the country’s economy,
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tún tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti gbé láti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: He said the National Assembly passed legislations towards increasing Nigeria’s revenue base in addition to ensuring appropriate application.
Yoruba: Ó ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti se ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ òfin, ní èyí tí ó ti jẹ́ kí owó tó ń wọlé sí àpò òsùwọ̀n orílẹ̀ èdè yìí tún pọ̀ síi.

English: Among the dignitaries who attended the event are the former Vice President of Nigeria, Mohammed Namadi Sambo who Chaired the occasion; Governor of Ekiti State and Chairman of the Nigeria Governors’ Forum, Kayode Fayemi, and immediate past Chairman of the All Progressive Congress (APC), Chief John Oyegun.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì tó wà níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún ni igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Mohammed Namadi Sambo, tí ó jẹ́ alága ayẹyẹ náà; Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì àti alága àwọn gómìnà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Káyòdé Fáyemí, àti alága ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú All Progressive Congress (APC) tẹ́lẹ̀rí, olóyè John Oyegun.

English: --- Nasarawa State is enjoying stability – Governor Sule
Yoruba: --- Ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa ti ń jẹ̀gbádùn ètò ààbò tó péye – Abdullahi Sule.

English: Governor Abdullahi Sule of Nasarawa State says security has greatly improved in his state, as a result of measures put in place to check the activities of criminals.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa, Abdullahi Sule ti sọ pé ètò ààbò ti fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ si ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tí wọ́n gbé láti gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn.

English: He made the disclosure, while speaking to State House correspondents, after he met with President Muhammadu Buhari.
Yoruba: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn ilé akéde sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari.

English: He said: “As a member of the APC and as a governor representing the party, I came in to pay respect to the leader of our party, Mr. President and I came in also to brief him about a state that has the greatest proximity to the Federal Capital, that is Nasarawa.
Yoruba: Ó ní: “Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀kan lára ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú APC, tí mo sì tún jẹ́ gómìnà tó ń sojú ẹgbẹ́ náà, mo wá láti rí adarí ẹgbẹ́ wa, ààrẹ Buhari láti sọ nípa bí ìpínlẹ̀ míì, tí ó ní ànfààní láti súnmọ́ ìlú Àbújá se ń lọ síi, ìyẹn Nasarawa.

English: It is very important for Mr. President to know what is happening in the state and I used the opportunity to brief him on certain issues, issues about security, issues about development that are taking place in Nasarawa.
Yoruba: Mo ní ànfààní láti sọ fún ààrẹ Buhari nípa bí ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa se ń lọ, bí i ètò ààbò àti ìdàgbàsókè tí ó ti dé bá ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa ‘’

English: Governor Sule said he was in the State House to thank President Buhari for establishing a Mobile Police Training Institute in Nasarawa State.
Yoruba: Gómìnà Sule ní òun wá rí ààrẹ Buhari láti wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ fún bí ó ṣe dá ilé-ẹkọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá sílẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

English: --- Nigerian President nominates Kingsley Obiora as CBN Deputy Governor
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari yan Kingsley Obiora gẹ́gẹ́ bi igbákejì gómìnà CBN.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has sent the name of Dr Kingsley Isitua Obiora to the Senate for confirmation as Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti forúkọ Kingsley Isitua Obiora ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì gómìnà fún ilé-ìfowópamọ́ ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ (CBN).

English: In a letter to President of the Senate, Ahmad Lawan, President Buhari said the nomination was in accordance with the provision of Section 8(1) (2) of the Central Bank of Nigeria (Establishment) Act 2007.
Yoruba: Nínú ìwé tí ààrẹ Buhari fi ránsẹ́ sí abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ́ asòfin, Ahmad Lawan, láti yan Kingsley Isitua Obiora gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì gómìnà fún ilé-ìfowópamọ́ ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ (CBN) wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú òfin 8(1) (2) tí ó dá banki CBN sílẹ̀ (Establishment) Act 2007.

English: Dr Obiora, upon confirmation by the Senate, replaces Dr Joseph Nnanna, who retires on February 2, 2020.
Yoruba: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obiora, ni yóò dípò Joseph Nnanna, tí ó fẹ̀yìntì ní ọjọ́ kejì, osú kejí, ọdún 2020.

English: Dr Obiora holds a Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Statistics from the University of Benin, a Masters in Economics from the University of Ibadan, and a Doctorate in Monetary and International Economics, also from the University of Ibadan.
Yoruba: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obiora gba oyè Bachelor’s degree nínú ìmọ̀ ètò ìnáwó (Economics) àti ìsirò láti fásitì Benin, ó tún ní ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ nínú ètò ìnáwó (Masters in Economics) láti Fásitì ìlú Ìbàdàn, ó tún gba oyè ọ̀mọ̀wé nínú Monetary and International Economics, láti fásitì ìlú Ìbàdàn.

English: He is currently an Alternate Executive Director in the International Monetary Fund (IMF) In Washington DC, United States of America.
Yoruba: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obioraje jé ọ̀kan lára àwọn adarí nílé ìfowópamọ́ àgbáyé International Monetary Fund (IMF) ni Washington DC, lórílẹ̀ èdè United States of America (USA).

English: --- Nigerian Government declares Operation Amotekun an illegal outfit
Yoruba: --- Ìdásilẹ̀ Àmọ́tẹ́kùn lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà ọdún 1999 – Malami.

English: The Federal Government has declared ‘Operation Amotekun’ an illegal outfit.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orilẹ̀-èdè Naijiria ti ní ikọ̀ elétò ààbò tuntun ti àwọn gómìnà ẹkùn Gúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà dá sílẹ̀ iyẹn, Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà.

English: This was disclosed in a statement signed by the Special Assistant, Media and Public Relations (Office of the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice), Dr. Umar Jibrilu Gwandu: “The setting up of the paramilitary organization called “Amotekun” is illegal and runs contrary to the provisions of the Nigerian law,” the statement read.
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kàn tí olùbádámọ̀ràn pàtàkì lóri ìròyìn àti ìbára -ẹni sepọ̀, Umar Gwandu sọ pé, Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn dídásílẹ̀ ẹgbẹ́ kìí ṣe èyi to ba òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà mu.

English: The Attorney-General of the Federation Abubakar Malami (SAN) explained,  security is the responsibility of the federal government.
Yoruba: Agbẹjọ́rò àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ Abubakar Malami (SAN) sàlàyé pé, ọ̀rọ̀ ààbò jẹ ojúṣe ìjọba àpapọ níkàn ni.

English: But the Federal Government maintained that “the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 (as amended) has established the Army, Navy and Airforce, including the Police and other numerous paramilitary organisations for the purpose of the defence of Nigeria”.
Yoruba: Àtẹjáde náà ka bayìí pé " ìwé òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà ti ọdún 1999 ti fi idí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé, ọmọ–ogun orí-ilẹ̀, ọmọ–ogun ojú omi, àti ọmọ–ogun ojú ofurufu, ọlọpàá àti àwọn to farapẹ́ nìkàn ló wà fún ètò ààbò Nàíjíríà àti pé ìjọba àpapọ̀ nìkan ni òfin gbáà láàyè láti ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ wọn.

English: According to the government, consequently, no other authority at the state level, whether the executive or legislature has the legal authority over defence.
Yoruba: "Nítorí ìdí èyí kò si Gómìnà yálà ẹyọ kan tàbi lápapọ̀ to ni ẹ̀tọ tàbi agbára láti ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ ilé iṣẹ́ tàbí àjọ kankan to níṣe pẹ̀lú èètò ààbo.

English: --- Imo Governorship Election: Supreme Court declares Uzodinma winner
Yoruba: --- Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ gómínà Imo, Emeka Ihedioha.

English: The Supreme Court in a unanimous Judgment on Tuesday sacked Emeka Ihedioha as Governor of Imo State, declared Hope Uzodinma winner and ordered INEC to issue Uzodinma certificate of return.
Yoruba: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní kí wọ́n yọ gómínà ìpínlẹ̀ Imo , Emeka Ihedioha, kí àjọ elétò ìdìbò sí kéde Hope Uzodinma  olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́  òṣèlú, All Progressive Party (APC) gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà tuntun fún ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: In the Judgment delivered by Justice Kudirat Kekere-Ekun, the court accordingly ordered the INEC to withdraw the Certificate of Return issued to Ihedioha and issue a fresh Certificate of Return to the candidate of the APC on grounds that he won majority of the lawful votes cast at the election.
Yoruba: Nínú ẹjọ́ tí ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́nu méje tí adájọ́ àgbà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Tanko Muhammed darí rẹ̀, ni adájọ́, Kudirat Kekere-Ekun pàsẹ fún àjọ elétò ìdìbò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Independent Electoral Commission (INEC) láti gba ìwé ẹri gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Imo lọ́wọ́ Ihedioha kí wọń sì fún Uzodinma gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà tuntun fun ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: --- Kano Election Appeal: Supreme Court adjourns abruptly
Yoruba: --- Ìdájọ́ ètò ìdìbò ìpínlẹ̀ Kano: Adájọ́ ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga subú lu àìsàn lójijì.

English: The Supreme Court in Abuja, Nigeria has adjourned abruptly when one of the seven justices hearing the appeal in the 2019 Kano State Governorship Election suddenly fell ill during court sitting.
Yoruba: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga tó wà nílùú Àbújá, ti sún ìdájọ́ lórí ètò ìdìbò gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano 2019 síwájú, nítorí ọ̀kan lára adájọ́ méje tó wà nílé-ẹjọ́ náà subú lu àìsàn lójijì lásíkò ti ẹjọ́ ń lọ lọ́wọ́.

English: The Chief Justice of Nigeria, Justice Tanko Mohammad, told the crowded court that one of its justices hearing the case is critically ill shortly after Counsel for Abbah Yusuf of the peoples Democratic party, Gboyega Awomolo adopted his brief and urged the court to allow the appeal.
Yoruba: Adájọ́ àgbà fún ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga náà, Tanko Mohammad, ló kéde yìí lẹ́yìn tí agbẹjọ́rò fún Abbah Yusuf tó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́, peoples Democratic party, Gboyega Awomolo rọ ilé-ẹjọ́ náà láti dá ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún.

English: Justice Tanko Mohammad stated that the court will have to abruptly rise to reconvene shortly on January 14, 2020.
Yoruba: Tanko Mohammad ní ilé-ẹjọ́ nílò láti sún ẹjọ́ náà síwájú di ojó kerìnlá, osù kínní, odún 2020.

English: --- Armed Forces and Remembrance Day: VP Osinbajo eulogises fallen heroes
Yoruba: --- Ìrántí àwọn ológun: Osinbajo gbósùbà fún àwọn tó fẹ̀mí wọn lélẹ̀.

English: The Vice President of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has stated that the diverse people of Nigeria are a nation today because of the sacrifices of our heroes both past and present.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Òsínbàjò ní oriĺẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà jẹ oriĺẹ̀ èdè tó ní ẹ̀yà, àsà àti èdè orísirísi, nítorí ipa tí àwọn akínkanjú kan tó fi ara wọn se ìrúbọ nígbà kan sẹ́yìn àti níbàyìí ti kó.

English: The Vice President stated this in his remark at the 2020 Armed Forces and Remembrance Day Inter-Denominational Church Serve held at the National Christian Centre, Abuja.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi ìsìn ayẹyẹ àyájọ́ ọdún fún àwọn ológun tó subú lójú ogun ti ọdún 2020, ní èyí tí ó wáyé nílé-ìjọ́sìn, National Christian Centre, tó wà nílùú Àbújá.

English: He also reiterated President Muhammadu Buhari commitment to the wellbeing of the armed forces.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ tún sọ pé, ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari kò ní káàrẹ́ láti túbọ́ máa mójútó ìgbáyé-gbádùn ilé-isẹ́ ológun.

English: Call to Serve Delivering the Message titled “The Call to Serve” Church Of Christ In Nations (COCIN) President, Reverend Dr. Dachollom Chumang Datiri said we are all called to serve God and to serve humanity.
Yoruba: Nínú ìwásù tí àkòrí rẹ́ jẹ́ “Ìpè láti sìn" tí oníwàásù ìjọ Church of Christ in Nations (COCIN) Reverend Dr. Dachollom Chumang Datiri sọ pé ọlọ́run pe gbogbo wa lá́ti wa sìn òun àti àwọn ènìyàn.

English: The 1st Reading of the service was taken from the book of Genesis 3-1-19 and read by the Chief of Defence Staff, General Gabriel Olanisakin. While the 2nd reading was taken from the book of John 1:1-19 by the Senate Deputy Majority Leader, Honourable Peter Okpatasai.
Yoruba: Adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun fún ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀gágun Gabriel Olanisakin, ni ó ka ẹ̀kọ́ kíkà àkọ́kọ́ láti Genesis 3-1-19, nígbà tí igbákejì abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà fún ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó kéré jùlọ, Peter Okpatasai, ka ẹ̀kọ́ kejì láti inú, John 1:1-19.

English: Nation Building Chairman Planning Committee, Mrs. Olu Mustapha expressed gratitude to God and all the dignitaries who honoured the invitation and for the commitment to developing the nation.
Yoruba: Alága ètò náà, arábìnrin, Olu Mustapha wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run àti àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì tó wà níbi ayẹyẹ náà fún ìdàgbàsókè wọn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Gubernatorial Election Ruling: Police beefs up security in Sokoto
Yoruba: --- Ètò ìdájọ́ gómìnà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto: Ọlọ́pàá pèsè ààbò tó nípọn.

English: The Sokoto State Police Command says it has deployed no fewer than 1000 conventional and plain clothes Officers and men across Sokoto State.
Yoruba: Ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, ti ní ọlọ́pàá tí kò dín ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, mọ́ èyí tí kò wọsọ ni àwọn ti pín káàkiri gbogbo orígun ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto.

English: The move comes as the Supreme Court of Nigeria is set to hear the Appeal brought before it by the Gubernatorial Candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Alhaji Ahmed Aliyu Sokoto on Monday.
Yoruba: Láti mójútó ìdájọ́ tí ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga yóò da lónìí yìí láàrin gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ náà, Aminu Waziri Tambuwal tó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú, Peoples Democratic Party ( PDP) àti Alhaji Ahmed Aliyu Sokoto , ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú, Progressives Congress (APC) láti tako ìdájọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń se ìtọpipin ètò ìdìbò dá láti fi gbé ìbò tó gbé Aminu Waziri Tambuwal wọlé gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto.

English: The State Commissioner of Police, Mr Ibrahim Kaoje, said the measure was to ensure that peace reigns before and after the hearing.
Yoruba: Kọmísọ́nà ọlọ́pàá fún ìpínlẹ̀ náà, Ibrahim Kaoje, ni Ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá gbé ìgbésẹ̀ náà láti rí i pé ètò ààbò tó péye wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà lásìkò àti lẹ́yìn ìdájọ́ ọ̀hún, tí yóò wáyé lónìí yìí.

English: --- Foreigner are the ones smuggling into Nigeria: The Emir of Yashkira
Yoruba: --- Àwọn àjòjì ló ń se fàyàwọ́ wọnú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà: Emir ti Yashkira.

English: The Emir of Yashkira, in the Baruteen local government area of Kwara state, North Central Nigeria, Alhaji Umar Sariki Sabikpasi II, has thrown his weight behind border closure, stressing that most of the  smuggling activities taking place in his jurisdiction were being perpetrated by non- indigenes.
Yoruba: Emir ti Yashkira, tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Baruteen ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, ni ààrin gbungbun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Alhaji Umar Sariki Sabikpasi II, ti ní ohun ti fi tapá –titan sí ìgbésẹ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa, ó ní púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ìwà fàyàwọ́ tó ń sẹlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ló jẹ́ pé àwọn àjòjì ló ń fàá.̀

English: The Emir stated this in his palace when the Coordinator Joint Border Drill Operations, Comptroller Mohammed Uba Garba took his Campaign and sensitisation programmes to Border Communities in the state.
Yoruba: Emir sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní ààfin rẹ̀ lásìkò tí adarí àwọn ikọ̀ tó ń mójútó ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè Comptroller Mohammed Uba Garba wá sí ààfin emir náà fún ìpolongo àti ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ nípa bí ìjọba se ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa.

English: The monarch noted that the Nigeria Customs Service is almost the heart of the Nation when it comes to revenue generation in the country.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà kò leè fọwọ́rọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ asọ́bodè sẹ́yìn nípa pípa owó sí àpò òsùwọ̀n orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: Healthy Growth The Traditional ruler disclosed that the policy on border closure is for the healthy growth of the Nigerian economy and advised that traditional leaders should always be involved in decision making process as well.
Yoruba: Emir náà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba gbé láti ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa yóò jẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: He also advocated that strict measures be meted out to economic saboteurs and the licensed fuelling stations should be identified and those without license be closed.
Yoruba: Ó wá rọ ìjọba láti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ tó lágbára lórí àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ tó ń fa aago ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yíí sẹ́yìn, kí ìjọba sì tún fi ọwọ́ òfin mú àwọn ilé-isẹ́ tó ń ta epo rọ̀bì ṣùgbọ́n tí wọn kò gba ìwé àsẹ láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ isẹ́ wọn.

English: --- Kaduna Governor orders closure of gas retail shops in residential areas
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà Nasiru El-Rufai ti ilé –ìtajà afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì pa..

English: Governor Nasiru El-Rufai of Kaduna State has ordered the closure of all gas refill stations located within residential areas.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, Nasiru El-Rufai ti pàsẹ pé kí ní kíákíá, ní wàrà-sesà ni kí wọn ti ilé –ìtajà afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì tó wà ní agbègbè ibi tí àwọn ènìyàn kọ́lé wọn sih, pa.

English: The Governor, who gave the order appealed to residents to report such gas outlets to government for immediate action.
Yoruba: Gómìnà tún wá rọ àwọn olùgbé àgbègbè náà láti máa fi ìròyìn náà tó àwọn alásẹ létí lórí irú ìgbésẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.

English: While on a visit to the Saturday’s gas explosion at Sabon Tasha, Kaduna, he said the gas refill stations would be relocated to industrial layouts.
Yoruba: Nasiru El-Rufai sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta lásìkò tí ìjàmbá iná kan sẹlẹ̀ ní àgbègbè Sabon Tasha, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.

English: “It is most unfortunate that this incident has happened, it has further proven that.
Yoruba: Ó ní ìjọba yóò gbé ilé-iṣẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì náà kúrò lọ sí ibi tí wọn pèsè fún àwọn ilé-isẹ́, Nasiru El-Rufai tún sọ pé“Ó seni láànú pé irú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ báyìí tún wáyé.

English: Gas retail is a high risk activity that should not be allowed to be located in residential areas.
Yoruba: Èyí ti fihàn pé afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì léwu fún àwọn ènìyàn, ní èyí tí kò yẹ kí irú ilé-ìtajà bẹ́ẹ̀ wà ní àgbègbè tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé.

English: “We will relocate them; we will give them land in industrial areas where adequate precautions to prevent things like this will be put in place. For now, we have to get all these gas refilling plants within the metropolis and towns relocated and shut down,” he stressed.
Yoruba: “A o ko wọn kúrò níbi tí wọn wà yìí, a ó fún wọn nílẹ̀ tí wọn yóò gbé máa ta afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì, ní èyí tí yóò fi dènà irú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ báyìí.

English: The Governor also paid condolence visit to the family of Professor Simon Mallam who died in the incident and also visited victims of the gas explosion receiving treatment at St Gerald hospital, Kaduna.
Yoruba: "Gómìnà wá bá àwọn ẹbí, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Simon Mallam kẹ́dùn, tí ó kú níbi ìjàmbá iná afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì ná, Ó tún kàn sí àwọn tó farapa níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún, tí wọn ń gba ìtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn, Gerald hospital, tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.

English: He prayed for the souls of those who died and quick recovery of those in hospitals.
Yoruba: Ó tún gbàdúrà fún àwọn tó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún, pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ wọn sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.

English: --- Kwara approves disbursement of N21m to 2019 hajj pilgrims
Yoruba: --- Kwara da mílííọ̀nù mọ́kànlélógún naira padà fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò Hajj.

English: The Kwara State Governor, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRasaq has approved the disbursement of twenty one million naira to all the 2019 hajj pilgrims.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRasaq ti fi mílííọ̀nù mọ́kànlélógún náírà sílẹ̀ fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò tó lọ sí ilẹ̀ mímọ́ Hajj lọ́dún 2019.

English: The Executive Secretary of the State Muslims Pilgrims welfare Board, Alhaji Tunde Jimoh stated this on Monday while speaking with newsmen in Ilorin.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìrìnàjò ilẹ̀ mímọ́ Hajj ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, Alhaji Tunde Jimoh ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Ìlọrin.

English: According to him, the amount is the refund by the Saudi Arabian government for the services not rendered to the pilgrims.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó sẹ sọ, ó ní ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Saudi Arabia ló dá owó náà padà fún wọn, nítorí pé wọn kùnà láti pèsè àwọn ètò tó yẹ kí wọn se fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò lọ́dún náà.

English: Meanwhile, pilgrims from Ilorin West are scheduled to come for their refund on Wednesday this week, those from Asa and Ilorin South on Thursday and pilgrims from Ilorin East and Moro on Friday also this week.
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́Rú ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀ ni àwọn tó ń gbé ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn Ìlọrin yóò gba owó tiwọn, tí àwọn tó ń gbé láti Asà àti ìlà Gúsù Ìlorin yóò gba owó tiwọn lọ́jọ́Bọ̀, tí àwọn tó ń gbé ní ìlà oòrùn Ìlorin àti Mòro yóò gba owó tiwọn ní ọjọ́ Ẹtì, Jimọh yìí.

English: Pilgrims from Kwara South are slated for Monday next week, those from Baruten, Patigi, Edu, Kaiama for Tuesday while non Kwaran Pilgrims are for Wednesday next week.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń gbé láti Gúsù Kwara ní wọn yóò gba owó tiwọn lọ́jọ́ Ajé tó ń bọ̀ yìí, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn tó ń gbé láti Baruten, Patigi, Edu, Kaiama ni wọn yóò gba owó tiwọn lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹ́gun, tí àwọn tí kìí se ọmọ ìlọrin yóò gba owó tiwọn lọ́jọ́Rú tó ń bọ̀.

English: Alhaji Jimoh urged all the 2019 pilgrims to come along with their original e-passports, one photocopy of their e-passport and receipt of payment of Hajj fare.
Yoruba: Alhaji Jimoh wá rọ́ àwọn arìnrìnàjò 2019 ọ̀hún láti wà pẹ̀lú àwọn ìwé ìdánimọ̀  ayélujára, ìwé ìrìnnà àti ẹ̀dà ìwé owó tí wọn fi sanwó ìrìnàjò lọ sí Hajj ti ọdún náà.

English: --- Oyo Governor launches Armed Forces emblem with N3m
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ sèfilọ́lẹ̀ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun pẹ̀lú mílíọ̀nù Mẹ́ta naira.

English: The Governor of Oyo State, Seyi Makinde, has launched the 2020 Armed Forces and Remembrance Day emblem appeal with a N3m donation.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Seyi Makinde ti sèfilọ́lẹ̀ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun ti ọdún 2020 àti àmì ẹ̀yẹ pẹ̀lú ẹ̀bùn owó mílííọ̀nù mẹ́ta náírà.

English: Governor Makinde commended the efforts of those who paid the ultimate price while fighting for the peace and unity of Nigeria, enjoining all citizens to contribute towards supporting the families they left behind.
Yoruba: Mákindé wá gbósùbà fún àwọn ọmọ -ogun orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, tí wọn fi ẹ̀mí wọn lélẹ̀ láti jẹ́ kí àlááfíà àti ìsọ̀kan jọba lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: Governor Makinde stated that the Oyo State government would continue to support the activities of the Nigerian Legion.
Yoruba: Ó wá rọ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti túbọ̀ máa sàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ẹbí tí àwọn olóògbé náà fi sílẹ̀.

English: Especially those viable projects meant for the benefit of the dependants of the fallen heroes.
Yoruba: “Ó yẹ kí á máa sàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ọmọ -ogun tó farapa, àwọn opó àti ọmọ àwọn akínkanjú ọmọ-ogun tí wọn subú lójú ogun.

English: The Governor was represented at the event by the Deputy Governor, Rauf Olaniyan, he raised Funds for Veterans Earlier, the Chairman, Nigerian Legion, Oyo State Command, Michael Fajimi, said that the objective of the Armed Forces and Remembrance Day celebration and emblem launch was to raise funds for veterans who are still alive but incapacitated and for the welfare of widows, children and other dependents of the fallen soldiers.
Yoruba: "Gómìnà Mákindé, ẹni tí igbákejì rẹ̀, Rauf Olaniyan, sojú fún ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ tó jẹ́ ìlà Gúsù, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, sáájú èyí ni, alága ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọmọ- ológun tó ti fẹ̀yìntì, Michael Fajimi, sọ pé, lára ètò síse ìrántí ọmọ -ológun orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ni láti se ìrànwọ́ owó fún àwọn tó farapa lójú ogun, ṣùgbọ́n tí wọn sì wà láyé àti fún àwọn opó àti ọmọ àwon olóògbé tó subú lójú ogun.

English: --- President Buhari restates desire for stability in West Africa
Yoruba: --- A ó mójútó ètò ààbò àti àlàáfíà nílẹ̀ Afrika: Buhari.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has reiterated his desire for stability, peace, progress and prosperity in the entire West Africa.
