Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti ní ohun yóò túbọ̀ tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ètò ààbò, ìdàgbàsókè àti àseyọrí nílẹ̀ Afirika.

English: Responding to Umaro Muhktar Sissoco Embalo, the President-elect of Guinea Bissau, who came to Nigeria on a “thank you visit”.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tí ààrẹ Umaro Muhktar Sissoco Embalo ti orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau sẹ̀sẹ̀ yàn wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀.

English: President Buhari commended the out-going President, José Mário Vaz, himself a candidate in the elections for supporting the emergence of Embalo in the second round of balloting “in the interest of peace and stability.”
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari tún wá gbósùbà fún ààrẹ, José Mário Vaz, tó ń sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń fi ipò sílẹ̀ fún àtìlẹyìn tí o sé fún ààrẹ tuntun ọ̀hún lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.

English: He said history will remember President Mario Vaz for putting National interest above his own, emphasising that he cared for peace within the region.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ pé ìtàn àti orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau kò ní gbàgbé ipa ribiribi tí ààrẹ Jose Mario Vaz kó lásìkò ètò ìdìbò, ní èyí tí ó gba láti jẹ́ kí ìfẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau ju ìfẹ́ ọkàn rẹ̀ lọ.

English: President-elect Embalo, a businessman-turned politician, was Prime Minister of Guinea Bissau under incumbent President Jose Mario Vaz between 2016 and 2018.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Embalo tí ó jẹ́ onísòwò, kí ó tó di olósèlú, ti fi ìgbà kan jẹ́ adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau lábẹ́ àkóso ààrẹ Jose Mario Vaz láàrin ọdún 2016 sí 2018.

English: He was a member of the ruling African Party of Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC) when he founded the Movement for Democratic Alternative (MADEM-G15) on which platform he won the elections.
Yoruba: Ó tún jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú ruling African Party of Independence of Guinea àti Cape Verde (PAIGC)  lásìkò tí ó dá ẹgbẹ́ Movement for Democratic Alternative (MADEM-G15), sílẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó fí díje fún ipò ààrẹ, tí ó sì jáwé olúborí.

English: --- Nigerian government sets 10 year plan to achieve digital literacy
Yoruba: -- Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò ti di ògbóntarìgì nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá.

English: The Nigerian government has said that Nigeria would achieve digital literacy in the next 10 years.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá tí a wà yìí, o dájú pé gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò ti ní ìmọ̀ nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.

English: The Minister of Communication and Digital Economy, Dr. Isa Pantami, stated this at a media parley with journalists, he said this would be possible with the digital economy policies which the present administration is determined to implement.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ètò ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ àti ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé Isa Pantami ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn nílùú Àbújá pé kó tó di ọdún mẹ́wàá sí àsìkò tí a wá yìí, gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò ti di ògbóǹtarìgì nínú ìmọ̀ èrọ ìgbàlódé, nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba yìí ń gbé lórí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ.

English: The Minister said that the digital literacy training would cut across several categories of Nigerians, and would be taken to all corners in the country.
Yoruba: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò jẹ ànfààní ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ.

English: --- Pa Adamu has passed away
Yoruba: --- Pa Adama Aduku di olóògbé.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has condoled with family of the oldest surviving soldier of the Nigerian Army and World War 11 Veteran, Pa Adama Aduku, who passed on at the age of 101, describing him as a soldier’s soldier and an epitome of honour.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti bá ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi kẹ́dùn ikú Adama Aduku Adamu jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ọmọ-ogun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, tó ja ogun àgbáyé kejì,(world war 11), ọmọ ọdún mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rùn ún (101) Adama Aduku kó tó fi ayé sílẹ̀.

English: The President prays that the almighty God will receive the soul of the departed, and comfort his family.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ wá gbàdúrá pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire, kí Ọlọ́run sì tu àwọn ẹbí́ olóògbé náà nínú.

English: --- Police Force promotes 74 officers in Kaduna
Yoruba: --- Ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́rin gba ìgbéga lẹ́nu isẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.

English: The Commissioner of Police, CP, Kaduna State Command, Ali Janga decorated about 74 officers who had just been promoted.
Yoruba: Kọmísọ́nà àwọn ọlọ́pàá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, Ali Janga ti ṣe àwọn ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́rin (74) tí wọ́n sẹ̀sẹ̀ gba oyè ìgbéga lẹ́nu isẹ́, lọ́sọ̀ọ́.

English: The promotion of Ali was part of the Inspector-General of Police’s commitment to motivate personnel and strengthen the fight against crime in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ali ní ìgbéga náà jẹ́ ara akitiyan adarí ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, láti ṣe móríyá fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá tí o ti ṣe gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà lẹ́nu iṣẹ́, nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The Commissioner said the promotion was in line with the police agenda for improving security and stability.
Yoruba: Kọmísọ́nà náà tún sọ pé ìgbéga náà wà lára ìlànà ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti jẹ́ kí ètò ààbò tún fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ síi lorílẹ́ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The CP commended the people of the State and the media for their continuous support to the command, especially in giving prompt information and complaints.
Yoruba: Kọmísọ́nà náà wá gbósùbà fún àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ náà àti akọ̀ròyìn fún àtìlẹyìn wọn fún ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá pàápàá jùlọ fún ìròyìn àti ẹ̀sùn tí wọn fi ń tó wọn létí.

English: --- Amina Mohammed wins Global Citizen Award
Yoruba: --- Amina Mohammed gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ àgbáyé.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has felicitated with United Nations Deputy Secretary General, Amina Mohammed, for winning the World Leader Prize at the inaugural Global Citizen award ceremony held in London.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Mohammadu Buhari ti kí mínísítà àná fún ètò àyíká, Amina Mohammed fún àmì ẹ̀yẹ àgbáyé lórí mímú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn bá àwọn ènìyàn, pàápàá jùlọ fún ipa pàtàkì tí ó ń kó lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nípa bí ó se ń ran àwọn tó kù díẹ̀ kí wọ́n fọwọ́-họrí lọ́wọ́.

English: President Buhari extols the UN Deputy Secretary General for her contributions to global development, and relentless priming of world leaders to work towards achieving the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals and end extreme poverty by 2030.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá gbósùbà fún igbákejì akọ̀wé àgbà fún àjọ àgbáyé UN fún ipa ribi-ribi tí ó ń kó láti mú ìpinnu àjọ àgbáyé wá sí ìmúsẹ, nípa mímú àwọn ènìyàn kúrò nínú ìsẹ́ àti òṣì, kí ó tó di ọdún 2030.

English: President Buhari wishes the United Nations Deputy Secretary General more prosperous years of achievements.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá rọ igbákejì akọ̀wé àgbà náà láti máa káàrẹ́ẹ̀ nípa síse ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ènìyàn lọ́nà àtiyọ wọn kúrò nínú ìṣẹ́.

English: --- 19 people loss of lives in Kogi attack
Yoruba: --- Ènìyàn mọ́kàndínlógún pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned the gruesome murder of 19 people by unknown gunmen in Tawari community of Kogi Local Government Area, Kogi State.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lórí ìwà ìpànìyàn tó wáyé ní agbègbè Tawari ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi, níbi tí àwọn agbébọn kan ti pa àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kàndínlógún.

English: Commenting on the sad incident, President Buhari said: “there is no excuse or justification for killing innocent people by anybody or group, and for whatever motive.’’
Yoruba: Nígbà tí ààrẹ Buhari ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, ó ní: “Kò sí àwáwí tàbí ẹjọ́ kankan fún ẹnìkan tàbí ẹgbẹ́ nípa gbiǵba ẹ̀mí àwọn áláìsẹ̀.

English: “The killings and revenge killings will only aggravate the cycle of violence, creating neither safety nor security for any side.
Yoruba: ’’ “Gbígba ẹ̀mí tábi gbígbẹ̀san nípa gbígba ẹ̀mí máa ń jẹ́ kí ìwà ipá gbilẹ̀ sìí ni, ní èyí tí ó leè se àkóbá fún ètò ààbò.

English: The President called on citizens to always embrace dialogue in settling disputes.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn láti máa yanjú aáwọ̀ wọn ni ìtùbí-ìnùbí dípò síse ara ẹni ní ìjàmbá.

English: --- Support the administration of President Buhari
Yoruba: --- Ẹ sàtìlẹ́yìn fún ìjọba Buhari: Abiola Ajimobi.

English: Former Governor of Oyo State, Abiola Ajimobi, has called on Nigerians to continue to place their trust in the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari.
Yoruba: Gómìnà àná fún ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ Abiola Ajimobi ti rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti túbọ̀ máa sàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba Muhammadu Buhari, kí wọ́n sì ní   ìgbàgbọ́ nínú ìsejọba rẹ̀.

English: He urged Nigerians to cooperate with his team, saying they are capable of ensuring the remarkable economic turn around that all Nigerians hope for.
Yoruba: Ajímọ̀bi ní ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari tí ń se gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà láti rí i pé àtúnse débá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: The former governor gave this charge in a new year message issued by his Spokesman, Mr Bolaji Tunji, where he also charged members of the Oyo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress, APC, to embrace true reconciliation in the interest of the Party and the people of the State.
Yoruba: Ajímòbi sọ̀rọ̀ yìí láti ẹnu agbẹnusọ rẹ̀, Bolaji Tunji, ó tún lo àsìkò náà lati rọ gbogbo ọmọ ẹgbẹ All Progressives Congress, APC, to wa ni ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ láti gba àtúnse tí wọn fẹ́ se nínú ẹgbẹ́ náà láàyè fún ànfààní ẹgbẹ́ àti àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.

English: Ajimobi noted in the statement, “I want to assure all Nigerians that the love of the nation burns brightly in the heart of the President and he is determined to ensure that legacies that would stand the test of time are put in place in the country.”
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí Ajímòbi gbé jáde, ó ní, “Mo fẹ́ fi dá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lójú pé, ìfẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ń gbóná lọ́kàn ààrẹ Buhari, ó sì ti pinnu pé òun yóò fi àpẹẹrẹ rere lélẹ̀ tí àwọn ìran tó ń bọ̀, yóò leè máa ròyìn rẹ̀.

English: He said, “Some people offended me and I offended some people too.
Yoruba: "Ó tún sọ pé, “Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ló ti ṣẹ̀ mí, èmi náà sì ṣẹ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn.

English: But in the spirit of true reconciliation, we should forgive one another and allow the past to end with 2019,” he said.
Yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n kí á leè gba àtúnse láàyè, a gbọdọ̀ dáríjin ara wa, kí a sì jẹ́ kí ohun tí ó ti kọjá lọ, bá ọdún 2019 lọ.

English: --- Minister donates items to 120 Babies of the year
Yoruba: --- Mínísítà fún àwọn ọmọ ọgọ́fà tí wọ́n bí lọ́jọ́ ọdún tuntun lẹ́bùn.

English: The Minister of State in the Nigerian Federal capital territory administration, FCTA , Dr. Ramatu Tijjani Aliyu, has donated baby items and cash to 120 babies delivered in selected Primary Health Care Centres across the six Area Councils of the territory, to celebrate the New Year.
Yoruba: Minisita ìpínlẹ̀ fún, FCTA Nigerian Federal capital territory administration, Ramatu Tijjani Aliyu, ti fi ẹ̀bùn orísirísi àti owo fun awọn ọmọ ọgọ́fà ti wọn bi lasiko ọdún tuntun yìí ni àwọn ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tó wà ní ni ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́fẹ́ẹ̀fà tó wà nílùú Àbújá.

English: The minister who was represented by the Acting Executive Secretary of Primary Health Care Centre, Dr. Iwot Ndaeyo also tasked mothers on early training of their children, just as she emphasised that children are gifts from God.
Yoruba: Mínísítà ti adelé akọ̀wé àgbà fún ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé sojú rẹ̀, Iwot Ndaeyo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òbí fún ìtọ́jú ọmọ wọn, nígbà tí ó sì ń tẹnumọ pé ẹ̀bùn láti ọ̀dọ̀ Ọlọ́run ni ọmọ.

English: Aliyu used the occasion to remind mothers of the need to ensure that their babies complete the routine immunization before the age of two years, just as she called on them to keep the immunization card safe.
Yoruba: Aliyu wá lo àsìkò náà láti fi ran àwọn òbí létí nípa gbígba abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára fún àwọn ọmọ lóòrè-kóòrè, kí wọn tó pé ọmọ ọdún méjì, kí wọn sì ri i pé wọn tọ́jú káàdì ọ̀hún.

English: The ministerial team also visited Old Kutunku Primary Health Care Centre in Gwagwalada Area Council, Kunchigoro Primary Health Care Centre in Abuja Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC), Ushafa Primary Health Care in Bwari Area Council, Dabi Bako Primary Health Care in Kwali Area Council and New Township Clinic in Abaji Area CounIbrahimd
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ mínísítà ọ̀hún tún lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé ti Kutunku àtijọ́ tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Gwagwalada, ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé ti Kunchigoro tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Àbújá Municipal Area Council (AMAC), ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé ti Ushafa tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Bwari, ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé ti Dabi Bako tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Kwali àti ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Abaji.

English: --- New Year: President Buhari felicitates with Nigerians, highlights successes
Yoruba: --- Ọdún 2020: Ààrẹ Buhari bá Nàíjíríà yọ̀, ṣàlàyé nípa àṣeyọrí rẹ̀.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has felicitated with all Nigerians as they celebrate the beginning of another year.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ àyájọ́ ọdún tuntun 2020;

English: In a special letter to the entire citizenry on Wednesday, January 1, 2020, he noted with satisfaction the agricultural transformation the nation has witnessed under his leadership.
Yoruba: Nínú ìwé àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ààrẹ fi ránsẹ́ sí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, lọ́jọ́ kínní, ọdún 2020, pé àtúnṣe ńlá ló ti dé bá iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí lásìkò ìjọba rẹ̀.

English: He said: “As we have sat down to celebrate with friends and family over this holiday season, for the first time in a generation our food plates have not all been filled with imports of products we know can easily be produced here at home.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ní: “Bí a ṣe ń jẹ tàbí mu pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ àti ẹbí wa nínú àsìkò ìsinmi yìí, tí tábìlì ouńjẹ wa kún fún oúnjẹ tí à ń pèsè fúnra wa, fún ìgbà àkọkọ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, láìjẹ́ pé a kó àwọn ouńjẹ yìí wá láti òkè –òkun.

English: The revolution in agriculture is already a reality in all corners of the country.
Yoruba: Èyí jásí pé àyípadà àti àtúnse ti débá isẹ́ ọ̀gbìn ni gbogbo orígun mẹ́rẹ̀ẹ̀rin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: New agreements with Morocco, Russia and others will help us access on attractive terms the inputs we need to accelerate the transformation in farming that is taking place.
Yoruba: A tún ti tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn mííràn pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Morocco, Russia àti àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mííràn, láti ràn wá lọ́wọ́ nípa isẹ́ ọ̀gbìn lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: The president also said: “Already, we are making key infrastructure investments to enhance our ease of doing business.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ètò ìrìnnà lórílẹ̀ édé yìí: “Lórí ètò ìrìnnà, a ti gbìyànjú láti se àseyọrí lórí rẹ̀ bí i afárá kejì ti Niger,

English: On transportation, we are making significant progress on key roads such as the Second Niger Bridge, Lagos – Ibadan Expressway and the Abuja – Kano highway.
Yoruba: Ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ tó wà ní Lagos – Ìbàdàn àti èyí tó wà ní ìlú Àbújá sí Kánò.

English: 2020 will also see tangible progress on the Lagos to Kano Rail line.
Yoruba: A ó tún gbé ìgbésẹ̀ lọ́dún 2020 yìí láti se isẹ́ lórí ojú ìrìnnà ọkọ̀ ojú irin ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó sí Kánò.

English: Work is going on the Apapa-Oworonshoki Express way.
Yoruba: isẹ́ ti lọ lójú pópó ti Àpápá-Òwòròǹshòkí.

English: Abuja and Port Harcourt have new international airport terminals, as will Kano and Lagos in 2020.
Yoruba: Àbújá àti Port Harcourt ti ní ibùdó ọkọ̀ ojú òfurufú tuntun, bákan náà ni á ò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti se èyí ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti Kánò lọ́dún 2020.

English: When completed, all these projects will positively impact business operations in the country.
Yoruba: Tí a bá parí àwọn isẹ́ àkànse yìí, yòó tún jẹ́ kí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè gbóunjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́ -gbàwobọ̀.

English: “Power has been a problem for a generation.
Yoruba: “Wàhálà lórí ìná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ti wà láti ìgbà ìwásẹ̀.

English: We know we need to pick up the pace of progress. We have solutions to help separate parts of the value chain to work better together.
Yoruba: A ti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti bá àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ náà kàn sọ̀rọ̀ láti wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro ọ̀hún.

English: Poverty Alleviation President Buhari restated his commitment towards lifting 100 million Nigerians out of poverty.
Yoruba: "Ààrẹ Buhari tún sàlàyé lórí ìpinnu rẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ìsẹ́ àti òṣì lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: “During my Democracy Day speech on June 12, 2019, I promised to lay the enduring foundations for taking a hundred million Nigerians out of mass poverty over the next 10 years.
Yoruba: “Lásìkò àjọ̀dún ètò ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa, mo sèlérí pé ọgọ́rùn ún mílíọ̀nù ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yii ni maa yọ kuro ninu ìsẹ́ ati òṣì láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá.

English: We shall continue reforms in education, health care and water sanitation.
Yoruba: A oò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti ṣe àwọn àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí nípa ètò ẹ̀kọ́, ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé àti omi.

English: I will continue to work with State and Local Governments to make sure that these partnerships deliver as they should.
Yoruba: A ó túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ̀pọ́ pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ìbílẹ̀.

English: Workers will have a living wage and pensioners will be looked after.
Yoruba: Owó osù àwọn òsìsẹ́ yóò se wọ́n ní ànfààní, a ó sì tún mójútó àwọn òsìsẹ́ tó ti fẹ̀yìntì lẹ́nu isẹ́ wọn.

English: We are steadily clearing pensions and benefits arrears neglected for so long.
Yoruba: A ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa san àwọn owó tí wọn jẹ àwọn òsìsẹ́ fẹ̀yìntì fún ìgbà pípẹ́ báyìí.

English: --- 2020 will usher in peace, economic growth – Senate President
Yoruba: --- Ọdún 2020: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ni ọrọ̀ ajé Nàíjíríà yóò búrẹ́kẹ́ síi.

English: President of the Nigerian Senate Dr. Ahmad Lawan, believes the year 2020 will usher in robust peace and economic growth for the benefit of all Nigerians.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Ahmad Lawan ti ńi òun nígbàgbọ́ pé ọdún 2020 yóò tún jẹ́ kí ìsọ̀kan àti ìdàgbàsókè fẹsẹ múlẹ̀ síi lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: In his New Year message, Dr. Lawan congratulated Nigerians on witnessing the end of 2019 and the beginning of the year 2020.
Yoruba: Nínú ìròyìn ọdún tuntun tí abẹnugan ọ̀hún gbé jáde láti kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fún ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 2020.

English: He hailed the resilience of Nigerians in their commitment to the unity and prosperity of the country and support for the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan gbósùbà fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fún ẹ̀mí ìsọ̀kan àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀hún àti àtìlẹ́yìn wọn fún ìjọba Muhammadu Buhari.

English: The Senate President assured Nigerians that National Assembly will continue to do its best to make things better for the people through enactment of people-oriented legislations.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan wá fi dá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lójú pé, ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa sòfin tí yóò mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: Senator Lawan said the National Assembly will endeavour to sustain the harmonious working relationship with other arms of government for the smooth administration of the country and benefit of the people.
Yoruba: Asòfin Lawan tún ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba àpapọ̀ kí ìbásepọ̀ wọn tún leè gún régé fún ànfààní gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The President of the Senate wished every Nigerian at home and abroad a happy and prosperous 2020.
Yoruba: Abẹnuga wá kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nílé, lóko àti lájò kú ọdún tuntun.

English: --- New Year: Speaker felicitates with Nigerians, advocates unity
Yoruba: --- Ọdún tuntun: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú bá Nàíjíríà yọ̀, ó pè fún ẹ̀mí ìsọkan.

English: The Speaker of the Nigerian House of Representatives Mr. Femi Gbajabiamila has felicitated with Nigerians for marking the beginning of the New Year, 2020.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Fẹmi Gbajabiamila ti bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ ayọ̀ ọdún 2020.

English: Mr. Gbajabiamila who noted that 2019 was remarkable in Nigeria’s history having witnessed the general elections peacefully, believes that 2020 would be better for the citizens.
Yoruba: Gbajabiamila  ní  ọpọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan ribi-ribi ló sẹlẹ̀ ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lọ́dún 2019 , lára rẹ̀ ni ètò ìdìbò tó wáyé ni ìrọwọ́-ìrọsẹ̀, ó ní òun nígbàgbọ́ pé ọdún 2020 yóò dára fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The Speaker in his New Year message through his Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, said God has been faithful to Nigerians in the outgoing year and called for more unity of purpose among the citizens.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí láti ẹnu olùrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ fún ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Lanre Lasisi, ó wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti gba ẹ̀mí ìsọ̀kan láàyè.

English: We cannot relent in our prayers for continuous peaceful coexistence among us. Let this 2020 be a year of more prospects for the citizens.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé"A kò gbọdọ̀ dákẹ́ àdúrà wa pàápàá jùlọ fún ìsọ̀kan àti ìbágbépọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: As an optimist, I have a strong belief that the year 2020 will be better for the country in all ramifications.
Yoruba: Kí Ọdún 2020 jẹ́ ọdún àseyọrí fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: While wishing Nigerians a prosperous New Year, Speaker Gbajabiamila pledged that the House will continue to provide legislations and legislative support for the welfare of citizens.
Yoruba: "Abẹnugan Gbàjàbíàmílà tún sọ pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa ṣòfin tí yóò túbọ̀ mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Benue Governor signs 2020 budget
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Benue bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.

English: Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue has signed the state’s N189.43 billion 2020 budget into law.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Benue, Samuel Ortom ti tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní biliọnu mọ́kàndínláàdọ́wàá. (N189.43 billion) láti sọọ́ di òfin.

English: Ortom while signing the budget 2020 tagged “Advancement, Growth and Development” on Monday in Makurdi, pledged that the government would strive to implement the fiscal policy.
Yoruba: Lásìkò tí Ortom ń tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ọ̀hún tí ó pè ní “Ìtẹ̀síwájú, Ìdàgbàsókè àti ìmúgbòòrò" lọ́jọ́ Ajé ni Makurdi, ó sèlérí láti jẹ́ ḱi gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ nínú ìsejọba rẹ̀.

English: Ortom had on Nov. 12, 2019, presented the 2020 budget estimates to the state House of Assembly for approval.
Yoruba: Ortom gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná lọ síwájú ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà ní ọjọ́ kejìlá, Osù kọkànlá.

English: According to him, the 2020 budget will promote education, healthcare delivery and other infrastructures for growth and development of the people.
Yoruba: Ortom ní ètò ìsúná náà yóò mú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn àwọn ènìyàn àti ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ẹ̀kọ́, ètò ìlera, omi àti àwọn ohun amáyédẹrùn.

English: --- Osun Governor signs 2020 appropriation bill into law
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.

English: Governor Gboyega Oyetola of Osun, on Monday, signed the 2020 budget of N119.5 billion into law, promising that the budget would be fully implemented.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun Gboyega Oyetọla ti bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní díẹ̀ ní bílíọ̀nù mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́fà (N119.5 billion), ní èyí tí ó sèlérí láì mú ètò ìsúná náà lò.

English: The governor signed the budget in his office in Osogbo shortly after it was formally presented to him by the Speaker of the state House of Assembly, Mr Timothy Owoeye.
Yoruba: Gómìnà tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná náà láti sọọ́ di òfin lẹ́yìn tí abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun, Timothy Owóẹ̀yẹ gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná náà gbé fún un.

English: The appropriation bill was passed into law by the Assembly on Dec. 24.
Yoruba: Ọjọ́ kẹ́rìnlélógún, oṣú kejìlá, ọdún yìí ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú náà fẹnukò lórí ètò ìsúná náà.

English: Oyetola, who described the size of the budget as the most realistic, said the government would stop at nothing to ensure its full implementation.
Yoruba: Oyetola ní, ohun jẹ́ kí ètò ìṣúná náà wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ìpínlẹ̀ náà se rí lásìkò yìí, lọ́nà àtimú ètò ìsúná náà wá sí ìmúsẹ.

English: The governor, who promised to continue to do things that would make life more meaningful, worthwhile and abundant for the people of the state, assured them of better days in 2020 and beyond.
Yoruba: Gómìnà Oyetola wá sèlérí láti mójútó àwọn ohun tí yóò mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ìpínlẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí àwọn olùgbé ìpínlẹ̀ náà yóò leè jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀ lọ́dún 2020.

English: He said that the state would do everything possible to bring about the desired development across all the sectors, as captured by the budget.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba yóò gbìyànjú láti mú ètò ìdàgbàsókè bá gbogbo ẹka tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: --- Nigerian Government pays for January 2020 School Feeding Programme
Yoruba: --- Ìjọba Nàíjíríà ti sanwó oúnjẹ àwọn ọmọ ilé –ìwé fún ọdún 2020.

English: The Nigerian Government has proactively paid suppliers of foodstuff and cooks under the Home Grown School Feeding Programme for January 2020 to ensure that feeding the 9.9 million pupils in the participating States and the FCT starts immediately schools resume in the next two weeks.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti san owó oúnjẹ tí àwọn ọmọ ilé-iwé yóò máa jẹ ní osù kinni,ọdún 2020 fún àwọn agbasẹ́se, eléyìí wà lára ètò tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ yà sílẹ̀ láti máa fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí iye wọ́n lé ní miliọnu mẹ́sàn án tó wà ní jákè-jádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti ìpínlẹ̀ FCT.

English: The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq who announced this in Abuja, explained that the payment covered the cost of feeding pupils in the 33 participating states.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ètò ọmọnìyàn, àjálù àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq ló kéde yìí nílùú Àbújá pé, ìjọba ti san owó tí yóò pèsè ouńjẹ fún àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ̀n lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The Minister disclosed that the funds were released in December to give the suppliers and cooks adequate time to procure and stock foodstuff to ensure that pupils eat their meals timely.
Yoruba: Mínísítà tún sọ pe ijọba apapọ san owo naa ni osu kejila, ọdun yii fun awọn agbasẹse ti yoo pese ounjẹ ati eroja ounjẹ fun awọn akẹkọọ ọhun.

English: Nutritional Quality The Minister warned that the Government would not accept any drop in the nutritional quality of the meals given to the children.
Yoruba: Minista wá kìlọ̀ pé ìjọba kò ní fàyè gba ounjẹ ti eroja rẹ ko ba dara tó tàbí tí kò ní àwọn ohun a-fún-ara-lóore fun àwọn ọmọ ilé –iwé náà.

English: --- Nigerian President presides over security briefing
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń se ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí àjọ elétò ààbò.

English: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari is currently presiding over a security briefing with Service Chiefs at the Presidential Villa in Abuja.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ń se ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí ilé –isẹ́ elétò ààbò lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ báyìí nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá.

English: --- Youth Council declares 3-day fasting for Nigeria’s unity
Yoruba: --- Ẹ jẹ́ ká wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà: NYCN.

English: The National Youth Council of Nigeria (NYCN) has declared a three-day fasting and prayer for the unity, peace and progress of Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, (The National Youth Council of Nigeria NYCN) ti rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti wà nínú àwẹ̀ àti àdúrà ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́ta fún ìsọ̀kan, àlàáfíà àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: A statement signed by the NYCN National President, Mr Solomon Adodo, in Abuja said that the prayer session would hold from Jan. 1 to Jan. 3, 2020.
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà, Solomon Adodo gbé jáde nílùú Àbújá, pé kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà wà nínú àdúrà àti àwẹ̀ ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́ta láti ọjọ̀ kínní di ọjọ́ kẹta osù kínní,( Jan.1 to Jan) ọdún 2020.

English: Adodo urged youths well meaning Nigerians and religious leaders to participate in the three-day exercise.
Yoruba: Adodo tún wá rọ wọn láti jáwọ́ nínú ẹ̀sẹ̀, kí wọn sì wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run.

English: He also advised them to turn away from all misdeeds and truly seek God’s face.
Yoruba: “Gbogbo àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí wọn wá ojú rere ọlọ́run fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè wọn, ní ìdàgbàsókè ti dé bá.

English: “We strongly believe that Nigeria’s problems can be addressed if we sincerely seek the help of God, while assiduously working to address same.
Yoruba: “A ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé, tí a bá wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run nípa ìṣòro tó ń dójúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ó dájú pé ìṣòro náà yóò di pẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: According to him, while Christians are expected to gather in their respective churches during the fasting and prayer period, Muslims will meet at mosques within their areas to pray together and break their fast.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó se sọ, ó ní kí àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn kristi péjọ nílé ìjọ́sìn wọn fún àdúrà lásìkò àwẹ̀, kí àwọn mùsùlùmí náà péjọ ní mọ́sálásí láti gbàdúrà lásìkó àwẹ̀ tíwọn náà.

English: --- Clamp down on rebels and terrorists in Nigeria: Tukur Buratai
Yoruba: --- Ẹ pa ọlọ̀tẹ̀ àti àwọn alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn run lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà: Tukur Buratai.

English: The Chief of Army Staff, Lt.-Gen. Tukur Buratai, has charged troops of Operation Lafiya Dole (OPLD) deployed at Madagali in Adamawa not to give terrorists any breathing space.
Yoruba: Adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Lt.-Gen.Tukur Buratai ti rọ àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ -ogun Operation Lafiya Dole (OPLD) tí wọ́n ń kó lọ sí Madagali ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa láti máa fún àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ní ìsinmi rárá.

English: Buratai, while addressing the troops during a visit on Sunday, urged them to maintain the current tempo of onslaught against the insurgents.
Yoruba: Buratai, sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń kàn sí ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun náà lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, ó wá rọ wọn láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ni agbègbè náà, kí wọn máa sì rẹ̀wẹ̀sì rárá nínú ojúse wọn.

English: Buratai said that government would provide the needed supports to enable them prosecute the war against insurgency and other criminal activities in the country.
Yoruba: Buratai tún ní ìjọba ti sèlérí láti sàtìlẹyìn fún wọn, ní èyí tí yóò fi leè ràn lọ́wọ́ láti borí ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ tó ń da omi àlàáfíà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí rú.

English: He commended the troops for their gallantry in dealing with the boko haram and Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists in the region.
Yoruba: Ó tún wá gbósùbà fún ikọ̀ náà fún gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹfà tí wọn se láti gbógun ti ikọ̀ Boko Haram àti àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí, Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) ní ẹkùn náà.

English: “I am glad to be here with you because this is one of the areas that have been quite strategic in the operation of Operation Lafiya Dole (OPLD).
Yoruba: “Inú mi dún ùn láti wà níbí yìí, nítorí àgbègbè yìí gan ni mo mọ̀ pé ó léwu púpọ̀ fún ikọ̀ Operation Lafiya Dole (OPLD) láti se isẹ́ wọn.

English: “You have done great and I want to commend you for standing firm against all the criminals whatever name they called themselves whether Boko Haram, ISWAP or bandits.
Yoruba: “Ẹ ti se gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà láti gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn,ikọ̀ Boko Haram àti ISWAP.

English: “Do not give them any breathing space.
Yoruba: “Ẹ máa se fún wọn ní ìsinmi rárá.

English: That means you must go out at all times, day and night, whether rain or sun shine and make sure you deal with them.
Yoruba: Èyí ni pé ẹ ó máa gbógun tì wọ́n yálà ní òwúrọ̀, ọ̀sán àti àsálẹ́, nígbà òjò tábi nínú òòrùn.

English: --- I promises nonpartisan leadership: Ahmed Lawan.
Yoruba: --- Èmi ò ní yọ ẹnìkankan sílẹ̀ níbi ìsàkoso mi: Ahmed Lawan.

English: The President of the Senate, Dr Ahmed Lawan, has pledged to run non-partisan leadership in the National Assembly.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Ahmed Lawan ti sèlérí láti máa fa orí apá kan, dá apá kan sí níbi ìsàkoso rẹ̀.

English: Lawan stated this on Saturday in Damaturu at the ‘Grand Reception’ ceremony to honour him and Minister of State for Works and Housing, Mr Abubakar Aliyu.
Yoruba: Lawan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta ni Damaturu níbi ayẹyẹ láti fi se àyẹ́sí fún abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún isẹ́ àkànse àti ilé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Abubakar Aliyu.

English: Lawan also said “I can take it upon myself to run a non-partisan Senate, where party does not determine what we do.
Yoruba: Lawan tún sọ pe “Mo ti pinnu láti se ìsàkóso mi, ní èyí tí yóò kó gbogbo ọmọ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin mọ́ra, ní èyí tí ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú kò ní leè nípa lórí ohun tí a bá se.

English: What we do could be determined by the interest of Nigeria.
Yoruba: Gbogbo ohun tí a bá fẹ́ se ni ó gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀.

English: “Every Nigerian, regardless of his political party, wants to see an economy that works and also wants to live in peace,” he said.
Yoruba: “Gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, yálà ó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú kan tàbí kò sí níbẹ̀, ló fẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí".

English: Lawan appealed for the support of Nigerians to the lawmakers to enable them achieve success.
Yoruba: Lawan wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti se àtìlẹyìn fún ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórí àseyọrí wọn.

English: Lawan commended his colleagues for their cooperation and being focused in discharging their duties.
Yoruba: Ó tún wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fún àtìlẹyìn tí wọn ń se fún un.

English: Harmonious Relationship Earlier in his speech, Gov. Maimala Buni of Yobe, commended Lawan for creating harmonious relationship between the legislative and executive arms of government.
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Yobe, Maimala Buni, ó gbósùbà fún abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fún ìbásepọ̀ tó múná-dóko tó wà láàrin ọmọ ẹgbẹ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti ìjọba àpapọ̀.

English: --- Adamawa Governor commends army for restoring peace
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun fún ìpèsè àlàáfíà.

English: Governor Ahmadu Fintiri of Adamawa State has commended the Nigerian Army for tackling the activities of Boko Haram terrorists in the north east and restoration of peace in Adamawa state.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa, Fintiri ti gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti gbógún ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram tó ń da omi àlà́afíà ìpínlẹ̀ náà láàmú pàápàá jùlọ ní ìwọ oòrùn Àríwá tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa láti pèsè ètò àlà́afíà níbẹ̀.

English: Fintiri, who was represented by his deputy, Chief Seth Crowther, gave the commendation during the inauguration of multi-million Naira projects in Gibson Jalo Cantonment on Saturday in Yola.
Yoruba: Fintiri ẹni tí igbákejì rẹ̀, oloye Seth Crowther sojú fún, ló gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun náà lásìkò tí wọn ń se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ isẹ́ àkànse tí owó rẹ̀ lé ní ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún mílíọ́nù fún ibùdó àwọn ọmọ ológun ọ̀hún, ní Gibson Jalo, tó wà ní Yola, lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta.

English: He said that concerted efforts had been made to review and improve the security structure of the state through the provision of vehicles, motorcycles, kits as well as other administrative and logistic supports to ensure effective performance by the personnel.
Yoruba: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ìgbésẹ̀ ń lọ lọ́wọ́ láti ṣe àtúnse sí ètò ààbò ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà, nípa pípèsè àwọn ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, kíkọ́ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ fún àwon ọmọ ilé –ìwé àti àwọn irinsẹ́ tí yóò leè ran àwọn àjọ elétò ààbò lọ́wọ́ láti fòpin sí ìwà ìdúnkookò mọ́ni, tí yóò sì tún fi ọkàn àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ náà balẹ̀.

English: The Chief of Army Staff, Lt.-Gen. Tukur Buratai, said that the projects were part of efforts aimed at ensuring the welfare of officers and soldiers of Nigerian Army as well as their families.
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tirẹ̀ adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Lt.-Gen. Tukur Buratai, náà sọ pé isẹ́ àkànse náà wà lára ètò láti mú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn bá gbogbo ọmọ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè yìí àti ẹbí wọn.

English: --- Sokoto Governor signs 2020 Budget of N202.4bn
Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto bọwọlu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.

English: The Sokoto State Governor, Aminu Waziri Tambuwal, has signed the 2020 appropriation of N202.4 billion as passed by the State House of Assembly into law.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, Aminu Waziri Tambuwal ti bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúnáọdún2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní méjìlènígba biliọnu naira (N202.4 billion) tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà fẹnukò lé lórí láti sọọ́ di òfin.

English: Appending his signature to the document, Governor Tambuwal gave kudos to the assembly members, majority of whom belong to the opposition political party- All Progressive Congress (APC), for their patriotism and unflinching commitment to the collective good of the people of the state.
Yoruba: Lásìkò tí gómìnà náà ń tọwọ́bọ ìwé àbadòfin fún ètò ìsúná náà, Tambuwal wá gbósùbà fún ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà, tí púpọ̀ nínú wọn jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ alátakò- All Progressive Congress (APC), fún àtìlẹyìn wọn fún ìlọsíwájú ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: “The assembly despite being controlled by the APC which is in the majority has rallied round the government and supported it in the interest of serving the people of the state,” the Governor said.
Yoruba: Gomina Tambuwal tún sọ pé "Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ alátakò APC ló pọ̀jù nílé ìgbìmò asojú ìpínlẹ̀ yìí, síbẹ̀ wọ́n tún ń sàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba láti rí i pé wọ́n se ojúṣe wọn fún ìlọsíwájú ìpínlẹ̀ yìí ".

English: Financial Constraints Presenting the budget bill to the Governor at the council chamber of Government House, Sokoto, the Speaker of the Sokoto State House of Assembly, (SOHA), Mr Aminu Muhammad Achida, noted that the Assembly was aware of the achievements of the administration despite financial constraints.
Yoruba: "Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, Aminu Muhammad Achida wá gbósùbà fún ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà fún gbogbo akitiyan wọn láti rí i pé wọ́n se àseyọrí ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n ní ìjákulẹ̀ owó.

English: --- Don’t let terrorists divide the country – President Buhari
Yoruba: --- Ẹ máa jẹ́ kí àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ pín Nàíjíríà yẹ́lẹ-yẹ̀lẹ – Ààrẹ Buhari.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has appealed to Nigerians not to let terrorists divide the country along religious lines.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti rọ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti máa jẹ́ kí ̀àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ pín orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yẹlẹ-yẹlẹ nitori ẹsin.

English: President Buhari said: “I am profoundly saddened and shocked by the death of innocent hostages in the hands of remorseless, godless, callous gangs of mass murderers that have given Islam a bad name through their atrocities
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari tún sọ pé: “Inú mi bàjẹ́ nípa ikú àwọn omọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí tí wọ́n kú sí ibi ìhámọ́ láti ọwọ́ àwọn alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn, àwọn apanìyàn tí wọ́n ń ba orúkọ ẹ̀sìn mùsùlùmí jẹ́ nípa ìwà burúkú wọn.

English: “We should, under no circumstance, let the terrorists divide us by turning Christians against Muslims because these barbaric killers don’t represent Islam and millions of other law-abiding Muslims around the world.
Yoruba: “Lábẹ́ bó ti wù kórí, a ò gbọdọ̀ gba àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ láàyè láti da omi àlááfíà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí rú nípa dídá ìjà sílẹ̀ láàrin àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí àti ìgbàgbọ́, nítorí àwọn apànìyàn yìí kì í se ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí rárá.

English: “As a President, the collective security of all Nigerians is my major preoccupation and the death of an innocent Christian or Muslim distresses me.’’
Yoruba: “Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ojúṣe mi ni láti mójútó ètò ààbò gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, nítorí náà ikú àwọn aláìsẹ̀ yálà mùsùlùmí tàbí onígbàgbọ́ máa ń bà mí nínú jẹ́.

English: The President said the terrorists have no clearly defined agenda except the pursuit of evil through indiscriminate murder of innocent people, contrary to the teachings of Islam, which prohibits massacre.
Yoruba: ’’Ààrẹ tún sọ pé ohun tí àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ní lọ́kàn ni láti máa ṣe iṣẹ́ ibi wọn, láti máa ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ àwọn aláìsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó lòdì sí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́ ẹ̀sìn mùsùlùmí àti ìgbàgbọ́.

English: --- Nigeria Inaugurates Ministerial Taskforce on power
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà yan ìgbìmọ̀ alámójútó fún iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.

English: A Ministerial Taskforce on Power has been inaugurated in Nigeria as a way of achieving the fight for increased and sustainable power supply in the country.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ alámójútó lábẹ́ ìsàkoso mínísítà ilé-isẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ni ìjọba ti yàn láti máa mójútó iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ní èròǹgbà láti rí i pé àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí bá iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.

English: The Minister of Power, Sale Mamman who inaugurated the Taskforce in Abuja, said the setting up of the Taskforce was as a result of the Government’s plan to accelerate the pace of reforms in the sector and increase power output and availability in the short and long term.
Yoruba: Lasiko ti Sale Mamman to jẹ minisita fun iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà n se ifilọlẹ ìgbìmọ̀ naa , ó rọ̀ wọ́n lati mojuto ọna ti atunse yoo se lee ba iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ní èyí tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yoo se maa jẹ̀gbádùn iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ọ̀hún.

English: Mamman pointed out that that the Ministerial Taskforce on Power would serve as an Advisory Team on Policies and Innovative Technologies.
Yoruba: Mamman tún sọ pé ìgbìmọ̀ náà ni yoo tun jẹ olugbanimọran lori eto ilana ati imọ ẹrọ tuntun lori iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.

English: He explained that the Committee which has two year tenure was also saddled with the responsibility of developing, planning and driving forward the reform plan of the Nigerian Government in the power sector.
Yoruba: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ọdún méjì ni ìgbìmọ̀ náà, ní láti fi isé wọn, lára ojúṣe wọn sì ni láti sètò ìlànà, tí yóò mú àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí nípa iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ní èyí tí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò máa tẹ̀lé.

English: The Chairman of the Committee, Profesor Abubakar Sani Sambo.
Yoruba: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Abubakar Sani Sambo, ni alága ìgbìmọ̀ náà.

English: --- President Buhari signs 2020 Budget
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari bọwọ́lu ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.

English: Nigeria’s President Muhammadu Buhari on Tuesday signed the 2020 Appropriation Bill of N10.594 trillion into law.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià Muhammadu Buhari ti tọwọ́bọ ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹgun, lati sọ́ di òfin, ní èyí tí iye rẹ̀ lé ní tiriọnu mẹ́wàá (N10.594).

English: The National Assembly had, on December 5, passed the 2020 Appropriation Bill into law, authorizing the federal government to spend over N10.594 trillion for next year.
Yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ karùn ún, osù kejìlá ọdún yìí, ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin parí ìjíròrò wọn lórí ètò àbádòfin ìsúná láti sọọ́ di òfin, ní èyí tí wọn sì fẹnukò pé kí ìjọba àpapọ̀ kò gbọdọ̀ ná ju tírílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ló.

English: This followed President Buhari’s presentation of the 2020 Budget estimates N10.33 trillion to a joint session of the National Assembly on October 8, 2019.
Yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ kẹwàá osù kẹjọ, ọdún 2020 ní ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià Muhammadu Buhari gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná wá sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin.

English: The passage of the budget and its signing within 2019 has returned Nigeria to the January to December Budget Cycle.
Yoruba: Bí ààrẹ Buhari ṣe tètè bọwọ́lu ètò ìṣúná 2019 ọ̀hún, ni yóò tún jẹ́ kí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià tún padà sí osù kínní sí osù kejìlá tí ó jẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún, tí ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià máa ń bọwọ́lu ètò ìsúná ọ̀hún.

English: Speaking at the brief ceremony, the Speaker of the House of Representatives noted that there was an increase of N263.95 billion over the proposal he submitted to the legislature.
Yoruba: Lásìkò tí ayẹyẹ ètò ọ̀hún, ààrẹ ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti fi owó tó lé ní igba bílíọ̀nù (N263.95 billion) kún ìwé ìsúná tí òun gbé wá sílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin.

English: --- Senate reaffirms commitment to poverty alleviation
Yoruba: --- Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò gbogun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́.

English: Nigerian Senate has reaffirmed its commitment to fighting poverty to ensure a better living standard for the citizenry.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti ní àwọn kò ní kàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́, kí ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn leè bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: President of the Senate Dr. Ahmad Lawan gave this latest assurance at a news briefing held on Monday in Abuja.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin Ahmad Lawan ló sọ̀rọ̀ ìdánilòjù yìí, lọ́jọ́ Ajé lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá.

English: Lawal explained that the 9th Senate would enhance legislation to tackle challenges of poverty, disease, insecurity, corruption among others, which he described as the common enemies of the country.
Yoruba: Lawal, tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ kẹsàn án yóò sètò òfin tí yóò gbógun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́, àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn, ìwà ọ̀daràn, ìwà ìbajẹ́, ní èyí tí abẹnugan náà sàpèjúwe wọn, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀tá ìlú.

English: He further explained that the Senate gave expeditious passage to the 2020 budget in order to return the nation’s budget circle to the desirable January and December period for adequate planning and implementation.
Yoruba: Ó tún sọ pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tètè se isẹ́ lórí ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020, tí ààrẹ Buhari gbé wá síwájú wọn, kí o lè bá ìgbà àti àkókò (January and December) tí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà máa ṣètò lórí ìṣúná ọdọọdún wọn.

English: Senator Lawan gave assurance to Nigerians that the shortcomings identified in the privatisation of the nation’s assets such as in the power sector, would be adequately addressed for maximum benefit.
Yoruba: Asòfin Lawan, ní gbogbo kùdìẹ̀-kudiẹ tó wá bí wọn se ta gbogbo ohun ìní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, pàápàá jùlọ nípa iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ni àwọn yóò mójútó.

English: The president of the senate appealed to newsmen for balanced and more patriotic reportage that could fast track national development.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tún rọ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti máa fárí apá kan, dá apá kan sí, nínú ìròyìn wọn, ṣùgbọ́n kí wọn máa kọ ìròyìn tí ó leè mú ìdàgbàsókè bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The senate minority Leader, Senator Eyinanya Abaribe said the Senate would not relent in ensuring robust debate on issues of national interest.
Yoruba: Adarí ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó kéré jùlọ nílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, asòfin Eyinanya Abaribe tún fi dá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lójú pé, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ ni àwọn asòfin wà, síbẹ̀.

English: The present Senate would not be divided along party lines, adding that they would ensure legislation to improve the life of all citizens.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní jẹ́ kí ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ náà da àárín wọn rú, láti máa se òfin tí yóò mú ìgbáyé –gbádùn bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ édé Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Boris Johnson is now the Prime Minister of UK
Yoruba: --- Boris Johnson di adarí́ ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè United Kingdom, UK.

English: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has congratulated Prime Minister Boris Johnson on his resounding election victory in the United Kingdom general election.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti kí adarí ìjọba tuntun fún orílẹ̀ èdè United Kingdom, Boris Johnson kú orí –ire bó se jáwé olúborí nínú ètò ìdìbò tí wọ́n dì kọjá lórílẹ̀ èdè náà.

English: The President notes that Britain has been a reliable and historically unique ally of Nigeria, and has particularly supported this administration’s efforts at improving security and recovering stolen assets held in the UK.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari ní orílẹ̀ èdè Britain ti ń se gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹ́fà láti fi ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, pàápàá jùlọ lórí ètò ààbò àti bí wọ́n se ń ran orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lọ́wọ́ láti dá àwọn owó àti ohun ìní tí wọ́n jí kó lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè UK padà wá sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: President Buhari looks forward to continue working with the Prime Minister to forge a stronger Nigeria-UK relationship, especially in the area of trade and economic partnerships which greatly benefits the citizens of both countries.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari ni òun fojúsọ́nà láti bá adarí ìjọba tuntun náà sisẹ́ papọ̀, ní èyí tí ìbásepọ̀ tó wà láàrin orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà, pàápàá jùlọ nípa bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé, yóò se túbọ̀ ní ìdàgbàsókè síi.

English: --- Nigeria to stop importation of Petrol by 2023
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà yóò jáwọ́ láti máa ra epo rọ̀bì láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lọ́dun 2023.

English: The Nigerian Government has said it will stop the importation of petrol into the country by 2023.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní òhun yóò jáwọ́ láti máa ra epo rọ̀bì láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lọ́dún 2023.

English: The Group Managing Director of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC), Mele Kyari made this known during the signing ceremony of the Condensate refinery strategy programme Front End Engineering Design.
Yoruba: Adarí ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó epo rọ̀bì lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà , (Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation ,NNPC), Mele Kyari ló sọ eléyìí di mímọ̀ láṣìkò tó ń tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn nípa ìdásílẹ̀ ibi tí wọn yóò gbé máa tún epo rọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The strategy is expected to eliminate the importation of petroleum products importation in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ètò náà ni wọ́n ní ìrètí pé yóò fòpin ṣí rira epo láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.

English: In 2017, the Federal Government planned to stop the importation of fuel by 2019 with the approval of a new National Oil Policy by the Federal Executive Council.
Yoruba: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé lọ́dún 2017, ni ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti sèpinnu láti fòpin ṣí ríra epo rọ̀bì láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lọ́dún 2019.

English: --- President Buhari returns home after peace summit in Egypt
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari padà sí Nàíjíríà lẹ́yìn ìpàdé àpérò àlàáfíà lórílẹ̀ èdè Egypt.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has return to Abuja after participating in the Forum for Peace and Development in Africa, which took place in Egypt December 11 and 12.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti padà sí ìlú Àbújá lẹ́yìn ìpàdé àpérò àlàáfíà àti ìdàgbàsókè Afirika, ní èyí tí ó wáyé ní ọjọ́ kọkànlá àti ìkejìlá, oṣù kejìlá lórílẹ̀ èdè Egypt.

English: The President’s aircraft touched down at the Presidential wing of the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja, at about 13.30 GMT.
Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ òfurufu ààrẹ balẹ̀ sí pápá ofurufu ààrẹ, Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, tó wà nílùú Àbújá, ní aago 13.30 GMT.

English: He was received by the Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Mohammed Bello and security chiefs among others.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory, Mohammed Bello àti àwọn adarí elétò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ló tẹ́wọ́gba ààrẹ ní pápá òfurufu ọ̀hún.

English: The Forum, which was the first of its kind platform in Africa was aimed at addressing the interconnections between peace and development in Africa while promoting Africa-led solutions through strengthening policies and practices.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé ọ̀hún ló dá lórí ọ̀nà tí ilẹ̀ Afirika yóò ṣe gbà mójútó ètò àlááfíà àti ìdàgbàsókè, ìpàdé àpérò yìí ló tún jẹ́ àkọ́kọ́ irú rẹ̀ nílẹ̀ Afirika.

English: While in Egypt, the President held bilateral talks with his Egyptian counterpart Abdelfattah el-Sisi where both leaders pledged to collaborate to eradicate the menace of terrorism in parts of Africa.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari àti ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Egypt, Abdelfattah el-Sisi, tún jọ jíròrò láti gbógun tí ìwà ọ̀daràn àti ọlọ̀tẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè wọn.

English: The president’s entourage included the Minister of Defence, Gen. Bashir Magashi (Rtd); Minister of State, Foreign Affairs, Amb. Zubairu Dada; National Security Adviser, Maj.-Gen. Babagana Monguno (Rtd); and the Director-General, National Intelligence Agency, Amb. Ahmed Abubakar.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó tẹ̀lé ààrẹ ni mínísítà fún ètò ààbò, Gen.Bashir Magashi (Rtd); Mínísítà fún ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè fún ìpínlẹ̀, Amb.Zubairu Dada; Olùgbani-nímọ̀ràn lórí ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, Maj.-Gen. Babagana Monguno (Rtd); àti alákòsóo ilé-isẹ́, tó ń ṣe ìtọpinpin lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, (National Intelligence Agency), Amb. Ahmed Abubakar.

English: --- Attorney General orders DSS off Sowore’s case
Yoruba: --- Ẹ jáwọ́ lórí ẹ̀sun Sowore: AGF Abubakar.

English: The Attorney General of the Federation, Justice Abubakar Malami has ordered the Department of State Services (DSS) to hands off the trial of Omoyele Sowore.
Yoruba: Adájọ́ àgbà lórílẹ̀ èdè Náíjíríà (Attorney General of the Federation), Justice Abubakar Malami ti pàsẹ fún ilé-isẹ́ ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ (Department of State Services, DSS) láti jáwọ́ lórí ẹ̀sun Omoyẹle Sowore ní kíákíá.

English: --- Court affirms Magu as EFCC Chair
Yoruba: --- ilé -ẹjọ́ ní Magu le di alága àjọ EFCC.

English: Justice Ijeoma Ojukwu of the Federal High Court, Abuja has dismissed the suits challenging the stay of Ibrahim Mustapha Magu as Acting Chairman of Economic and Financial Crimes Commission EFCC.
Yoruba: Adájọ́ ilé ẹjọ́ gíga lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tó wà nílùú Àbújá, Justice Ijeoma Ojukwu, ti yí ẹjọ́ tó wà níwájú rẹ̀ dànù bí omi-ìsanwọ́ láti máa jẹ́ kí Ibrahim Mustapha Magu adelé àjọ tó ń gbógun ti ìwà síṣe owó ìlú kúmọ-kumọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, EFCC di alága àjọ náà, pé ẹjọ́ ọ̀hụn kò lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀.

English: The suits were contesting the legality of Magu’s position as EFCC acting Chairman after the refusal of the 8th Senate under the leadership of Bukola Saraki to confirm him as substantive chair of the premier anti-graft agency.
Yoruba: Ìpẹ̀jọ́ náà ló wáyé làsíkó tí ilé ìgbìmọ asòfin kẹjọ lábẹ́ abẹnugan, Bùkọ́lá Sàràkí nígbà tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ náà fàáké kọ́rí pé wọn kò ní jẹ́ kí adelé ọ̀hún di alága àjọ EFCC.

English: But in her judgment, Justice Ojukwu dismissed the suits in their entirety.
Yoruba: Nínú ìdájọ́ rẹ̀, adájọ́ Ojukwu ní, “Ẹjọ́ yìí kò ní ẹ̀rí láti gbe ẹ̀sùn rẹ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀ nítorí náà, ilé-ẹjọ́ da ẹjọ́ náà nú.

English: The trial judge noted that the lacuna in the law literally handed President Muhammadu Buhari, the “proverbial yam and the knife to do as he pleases, being that there is no specific time stipulated for acting capacity.”
Yoruba: "Adájọ́ náà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, ni “ọ̀bẹ àti iṣu lọ́wọ́, tí ó sì ní agbára láti fi ṣe ohun tí ó bá wùú, nítorí náà, òfin kò sọọ́ nípàtó iye àkókò tàbí àsìkò tí ààrẹ leè fi yan adelé sórí ipò.

English: Additionally, the judge noted that despite the fact that plaintiff is a legal practitioner and a Nigerian, he lacked the locus standi to challenge Magu’s stay in office as the acting chairman of EFCC.
Yoruba: "Adájọ́ Ojukwu tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ilé ìgbìmọ asòfin kò ní agbára lábẹ́ òfin láti sọ adelé si alága nípa ti alága àjọ EFCC.

English: --- Without National identity registration platform, there is no chance to write Jamb exam
Yoruba: --- Láìsí káàdì ìdánimọ̀, kò sí àǹfààní láti jókòó fún ìdánwò ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga-Jamb.

English: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB has deployed a total number of 1800 members of staff to test run the new registration process under the joint platform of JAMB and the National Identity Management Commission, using the National Identification Number, NIN.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń mọjútó ìdánwò lọ ṣí ilé- ẹ̀kọ́ gíga lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà,The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB ,ti yan ẹgbẹ̀sán (1800)àwọn òsìsẹ́  wọn láti lọ ṣe àyẹ̀wò fínní-fínní lóri bí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ń gbáradì fún ìdánwò yóò se máa lo káádì ìdánimọ̀ wọn nínú àtẹ ìforúkọsílẹ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé  ti  àjọ JAMB àti ilé-isẹ́ tó ń pèsè káàdì ìdánimọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ,National Identity Management Commission,jọ ṣe agbátẹrù rẹ̀.

English: The board said the members of staff were deployed across Nigeria to for trial registration, following its determination to have a seamless registration exercise for candidates desirous of sitting for the 2020 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination.
Yoruba: Ajọ JAMB  ní  àwọn òsìsẹ́  tí àwọn yàn náà yóò lọ káàkiri gbogbo  orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti se àyẹ̀wò náà , ní èyí tí yóò se leè rọ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ to fẹ  ṣe ìdánwò si ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga, Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination, ti ọdun 2020 náà lọ́rùn.

English: The members of staff deployed would be involved in assessing the workability of the new registration regime and identify the success rate and possible challenges so as to improve on them for a hitch free exercise.
Yoruba: Àwọn òsìsẹ́ náà yóò wo àséyọrí àti ìpèníjà tí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ náà le dojúkọ àti ọ̀nà tí wọn leè gbà láti wá ojútùú sí irú ìpèníjà ọ̀hún.

English: --- Taraba State House of Assembly speaker resigns
Yoruba: --- Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ìpínlẹ̀ Taraba kọ̀wé fipò sílẹ̀.

English: The Speaker, Taraba State House of Assembly, Mr Abel Peter Diah, on Sunday evening resigned amidst alleged plots by the state governor, Darius Ishaku to impeach him and other principal officers of the House.
Yoruba: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ìpínlẹ̀ Taraba, Taraba, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Abel Peter Diah, ló fárígá pé òun kò se abẹnugan mọ́ lọ́jọ́ Àìkú yìí.

English: In a phone call on Sunday evening, Diah said that he had decided to “resign as the speaker of the Taraba State House of Assembly for personal reasons.”
Yoruba: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé awuye-wuye ti ń lọ lọ́wọ́ pé gomina ìpínlẹ̀ náà, Darius Ishaku ti ń gbèrò láti yọ òun àti akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ nípò bi í jìgá.

English: Diah appreciated the members for giving him the chance to serve them in the capacity and urged to continue to work for the interest of Taraba State rather than personal reasons.
Yoruba: Lórí ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ lásàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú ló ti sọ pé ohun ti pinnu “láti kọ̀wé fipò sílẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bi abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ìpínlẹ̀ Taraba fún ìdí kan tàbí ìdí kejì.

English: Tension had continued to mount over the weekend with alleged plans by Governor Darius Ishaku to mobilise and impeach the speaker following alleged moves by the House to impeach the governor a few weeks ago.
Yoruba: "Diah wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fun ìfọẃọsowọ́pọ̀ wọn lásìkò tó ń darí wọn, ó tún wá rọ̀ wọ́n láti túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí ìtẹ̀síwájú yóò ṣe débá ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: --- Come and enter free train ride on Lagos-Ibadan rail
Yoruba: --- Ẹ wá wọkọ̀ ojú-irin ọ̀fẹ́ láti Èkó lọ sí Ìbàdàn.

English: Nigerian Government has commenced free train ride on Lagos-Ibadan standard guage rail line.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíj́́ríà ti ní àwọn yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ọkọ̀ ojú irin ọ̀fẹ́ tí yóò máa gbé àwọn arìnrìnàjò láti Eko lọ sí Ìbàdàn lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.

English: This followed the test-run from Iju in Lagos to Ibadan where the standard gauge rail line terminates.
Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ ojú irin yìí yóò máa gbéra láti Iju nílùú Eko tí yóò si máa balẹ̀ sí ìlú Ìbàdàn.

English: Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi who flagged off the train service.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ètò ìrìnnà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Rotimi Amaechi ni ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ètò ọkọ̀ ojú irin náà.

English: Amaechi said the the free ride would last till March 2020.
Yoruba: Amaechi ní ọkọ̀ ojú irin ọ̀fẹ́ náà yóò parí ní osù kẹta ọdún, 2020.

English: Amaechi explained that the free train ride would commence from Iju to Ibaban by 2nd to 19th December, 2019 while from Agege to Ibadan would start from 21st.
Yoruba: Amaechi ni ètò ọkọ̀ ojú irin ọ̀fẹ́ naa yóò bẹrẹ ni ọjọ́ kejì sí ọjọ́ kọ́kàndínlógún , oṣ̀u kéjìlá, ọdun, 2019 nígbà tí èyí tí yóò máa gberá láti Agege sí ìlú Ìbàdàn ńi ọjọ́ kọ́kànlélógún.

English: --- Dino Melaye has lost the Kogi West Senatorial District Election
Yoruba: --- Dino Melaye fìdìí rẹmi nínú ètò ìdìbò asòfin ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.

English: The candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Senator Smart Adeyemi, has won the Kogi West senatorial district election.
Yoruba: Olùdíje fún ipò asòfin àgbà nínú ẹgbẹ́, All Progressives Congress (APC),asòfin  Smart Adeyemi,ni ó jáwé olúborí nínú ètò ìdìbò asòfin tó wáyé ní apá ilà Gúsù ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.

English: The Returning Officer of the election, Professor Olajide Lawal, announced this on Saturday at the collation centre in Kogi State.
Yoruba: Olùdarí ètò ìdìbò ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Olajide Lawal, ni ó kéde àbájáde ètò ìdìbò náà lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta ni ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.

English: According to him, Senator Adeyemi polled a total of 88,373 votes to beat Senator Dino Melaye of the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) who scored 62,133 votes.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àbájáde ètò ìdìbò náà l se lọ, Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ọlajide  ni asofin   Smart Adeyemi ni iye  ibo 88,373 láti fìdìí ẹnìkejì rẹ̀  Dino Melaye láti inú ẹgbẹ́  òsèlú People’s Democratic Party (PDP) janlẹ̀ nígbà tí òun ní iye ìbò  62,133.

English: Ambassador Rufus Aiyenigba of the Social Democratic Party (SDP) came third in the poll with 659 votes and was trailed by John Olabode and Adeyemi Taiwo of the African Democratic Congress (ADC) and Nigeria Elements Progressive Party (NEPP who) garnered 262 and 119 votes respectively.
Yoruba: Ambassador Rufus Aiyenigba to jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ  Social Democratic Party (SDP) ni o gbe ipo kẹta nigba ti o ni iye ìbò  659 ,John Olabode àti Adeyemi Taiwo tí wọn jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ African Democratic Congress (ADC) àti Nigeria Elements Progressive Party (NEPP ) ni iye ìbò  262 ati 119 bákan náà.

English: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) declared the APC candidate Smart Adeyemi,  as the winner of the keenly contested election two weeks after the people of the senatorial district went to the poll.
Yoruba: Àjọ elétò ìdìbò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) ti kéde pé olùdíje fún ipò asòfin àgbà Smart Adeyemi, tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ APC ló jáwé olúborí fún ipò asòfin àgbà.

English: --- ASUU will soon embark on strike
Yoruba: --- ASUU le bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìyansẹ́nlódì láìpẹ́.

English: The Nigerian House of Representatives is to intervene in the conflict between government and Academic Staff Union of Universities, ASUU, on the IPPIS issue.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà , ti ní tí àwọn kò bá tètè dá sí wàhálà tó ń sẹlẹ̀ láàrin ẹgbẹ́ olùkọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) àti ìjọba àpapọ̀, pé kí ìjọba máa fi àwọn olùkọ́ fáfitì sínú ètò ìlànà IPPIS.

English: In a motion of urgent public importance on the urgent need for the House to intervene in the crisis, Mr. Abbas Tajuddeen from Kaduna State.
Yoruba: Abbas Tajuddeen tó ń sojú fún ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, tó tún jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin nílùú Àbújá ló pe àkíyèsí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin láti dá sí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.

English: Tajuddeen described the IPPIS as a good policy that recorded great success.
Yoruba: Tajudeen ní ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ fẹ́ gbé yìí dára púpọ̀.

English: The lawmaker, stated that if the government refused to back down on the ASUU’s demands, the union may embark on another strike which would jeopardize the current peace being enjoyed by universities in the country.
Yoruba: Ó ní “Bí ẹgbẹ́ ASUU se ń fáríga láti ḿaa tẹ̀lé ètò ìlànà ti ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀ là sílẹ̀ nípa sísan owó osù wọn, leè fa ìyansẹ́lódì, ní èyí ti ́ó leè tún dákún ìsoro tó ń kojú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti òbí wọn.

English: The Federal Government had said it had received the nominal roll of about 41 universities as part of moves to capture university workers, despite ASUU’s opposition.
Yoruba: "Àmọ́sá, ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti ní àwọn fásitì mọ́kànlélógójì ni wọ́n ti forúkọ sílẹ̀ sínú ètò ìlànà yìí, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ ASUU sì kọ etí ikún láti tẹ̀lé ètò ìlànà ọ̀hún.

English: --- President Buhari condemns violence in Cross River State
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari bẹnu àtẹ lu wàhálà tó sẹlẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River.

English: Nigeria’s President, Muhammadu Buhari has strongly condemned the on-going violence in the Boki Local Government Area of Cross River State, which has in the past 24 hours led to a yet to be ascertained number of deaths and arson attacks.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ,Muhammadu Buhari ti bu ẹnu àtẹ lu wàhálà tó ń sẹlẹ̀ ní ìjọba Boki tó wà ní agbègbè ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River, ní èyí tí ó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní wákàtí mẹrinlelogun sẹ́yìn sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n kò leè sọ iye ẹ̀mí tí wọ́n ti pàdánù báyìí nínú ìkọlù náà.

English: In a statement he issued on Wednesday night, Senior Special Assistant to tge President on Media and Publicity, Garba Shehu said:
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí olùrànlọ́wọ́ ààrẹ fún ìròyìn àti ìkédè Garba Shehu gbé jáde lọ́jọ̀Rú pé:

English: “So far, there have been claims and counter claims as who restarted the killings and arson between neighbouring Nsadop and the Boje communities.
Yoruba: “Ní báyìí ìpànìyàn àti ilé sísun ń lọ́wọ́ ní agbègbè Nsadop àti Boje.

English: While the origin of the mayhem is still unclear.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ní a ó tíì mọ ohun tó fa ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ burúku yìí.

English: President Buhari notes that no dispute or grievance is worth the violent snatching away of another person’s life.
Yoruba: Àmọ́sá, ààrẹ Buhari fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí pé, kò sí irú ìbínú tó yẹ kí ènìyàn gba ẹ̀mí ẹnìkejì rẹ̀.

English: Nigerians must learn to live peacefully with each other and seek less brutish means of resolving conflicts.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà gbọ́dọ̀ máa kọ́ bí wọn se ń gbé ní ìrẹ́pọ̀ àti àlááfíà.

English: Our country does not need another war.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà kò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ogun abẹ́lé.

English: “President Buhari understands that our security agencies are already intervening to bring an end to the crisis.
Yoruba: “Ààrẹ Buhari mọ̀ pé àwọn agbófinró àti ẹ̀sọ́ aláàbò ti ń yanjú isoro náà, ní èyí tí yóò mú kí àlàáfíà tètè pàdà sí agbègbè naa.

English: He also makes an urgent call on the Cross River State government and the Boki local government authorities to immediately look into the crisis and take action to ensure that this unfortunate situation is resolved.”
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún ti bá gómìnà ipinlẹ River àti alásẹ ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Boki sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìpè láti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ bí wọn yóò se leè tètè yanjú wàhálà náà kíákíá.

English: --- Nigeria condoles with Kenya and DR Congo over natural disasters
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà bá orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya ati DR Congo kẹ́dùn ìjàm̀bá omíyalé.

English: The Nigeria leader, Predsident Muhammadu Buhari expressed sadness over the loss of lives, the economic and social disruptions caused by these natural disasters in DR Congo.
Yoruba: Àarẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti bá orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya àti DR Congo kẹ́dùn ìjàm̀bá omíyalé ati ilẹ riri tó ṣe ìjàm̀bá lórílẹ̀ èdè náà.

English: Buhari noted that “emergency management response is one of Africa’s biggest challenges of development, and we should work together to find a common strategy to minimise the human and economic impacts of these catastrophes.”
Yoruba: Nínú ìwẹ́ àtẹ̀jáde tí àarẹ Muhammadu Buhari kọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà, ààrẹ ni": “orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ba ẹyin ati àwọn ènìyàn ti ìjàm̀bá omíyalé àti ilẹ̀ rírì náà sẹlẹ̀ sí kẹ́dùn púpọ̀"

English: The President told the leaders of Kenya and the Democratic Republic of Congo that the hearts and prayers of all Nigerians are with those affected by the natural disaster.
Yoruba: Àarẹ tún sọ fún àwọn adarí orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya àti the Democratic Republic of Congo pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò fi wọ́n sọ́kàn láti máa gbàdúrà fún wọn.

English: --- President Buhari pledges to punish killers of Achejuh Abuh
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ Buhari màá fímu àwọ́n tó pa Achejuh Abuh jófin

English: Madam Achejuh Abuh, Woman Leader of the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) in Wada/Aro campaign council has been murdered in the just concluded gubernatorial election in Kogi State.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin Achejuh Abuh tó jẹ́ ògbóǹtarìgì adarí àwọ́n obìnrin fún ẹgbẹ́ oselu People’s Democratic Party (PDP) ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Wada/ Aro, tí àwọ́n oníjàm̀bá àti ọ̀daràn kan dáná sun nínú ilé rẹ̀ lásìkò ètò ìdìbò gómìnà tó wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.

English: --- Repair the Universal Healthcare system in the country: Buhari
Yoruba: --- Ẹ se àtúnṣe si gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí: Buhari.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has pledged that his administration would ensure that all Nigerians have access to affordable, efficient and equitable healthcare services without the risk of impoverishment.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti pàsẹ fún gbogbo àwọn àjọ tàbí ilé-isẹ́ ìjọba tó ń mójútó gbogbo ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tó wà jákè –jádò orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, pé kí wọ́n tètè wá wọ̀rọ̀kọ̀ fi sàd́a láti mu àtúnse dé bá wọn ní kíákíá.

English: Receiving the report on ‘‘Funding Universal Healthcare Delivery in Nigeria’’ by the Senior Executive Course 41 of the National Institute for Policy and Strategic Studies (NIPSS), Kuru, President Buhari directed relevant agencies of government to review the submission and ensure its integration into ongoing policies and programmes.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń tẹ́wọ́ gba àbájáde ìròyìn lórí: “Ètò ìnáwó lórí àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà" ní èyí tí adarí ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ ètò ìlànà àti iṣẹ́ ìjìnlẹ̀ ọpọlọ (National Institute for Policy and Strategic Studies, NIPSS), Kúrú, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Habu Galadima gbe fún un, nílùú Àbújá.

English: The President recalled that in late 2018 he had approved the study theme for the 2019 Senior Executive Course because of his desire to address the challenges in the country’s health delivery system and improve the wellbeing of the citizens.
Yoruba: Ní ìparí ọdún 2018 ni ààrẹ ti bọwọ́lu ìwádìí lórí ètò àtúnse sí ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fun ọdún 2019 láti wá ojútùú sí àwọn ìpèníjà tó ń dojúkọ ètò ìlera, ní ọ̀nà àti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ìlera lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: ”I assure you that the Ministry of Health and all relevant agencies will be directed to review this submission and ensure its integration into our ongoing policies and programmes,” the President said.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún fi dá ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ náà lójú pé gbogbo àwọn ilé-isẹ́ tàbí àjọ ìjọba tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera alábọ́dé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò ṣe àmúlò ètò àtúnse tó wà nínú àbájáde ìwé náà.

English: --- Senate passes Tax system reforms Bill
Yoruba: --- Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fẹnukò lórí àtúnse sí owó -orí sísan lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: The Senate has passed the Finance Bill, 2019, which seeks an amendment to Nigeria’s tax laws.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti gba àbá ìjọba àpapọ̀ wọlé nípa ṣíse àtúnse sí owó –orí sísan lórílẹ̀ èdè yii.

English: Presenting the report, Chairman of the Committee, Senator Olamilekan Adeola, said the Bill specifically seeks to amend tax provisions and make them more responsive to the tax policies of the Nigerian Government, among other things.
Yoruba: Asòfin Olamilekan Adeola, tó jẹ́ alága ìgbìmọ̀ náà, ní tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ bá ti bu ọwọ́ lu àtúnse sí owó- orí náà ńipa sísọ ọ́ di òfin, yóò pèsè àwujọ tó dára fún àwọn tó bá fẹ́ dá isẹ́ sílẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, àti pé yóò tún jẹ́ kí àwọn ilé-isẹ́ olókoòwò kékèkèé tún búrẹkẹ̀ sii.

English: In his concluding remarks after the clause-by-clause consideration, the Senate Presiden, Dr. Ahmad Lawan, said the bill’s passage by the Senate was intended “to ensure that we (National Assembly) streamline the tax system in Nigeria and get revenue for government to provide services and infrastructure to the citizens of this country.”
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tirẹ̀, abẹnugan fún Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Ahmad Lawan, ní àtúnse sí òfin owó- orí yóò tún jẹ́ kí owó tó ń wọlé sí àpò òṣùwọ̀n orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tún pọ̀ síi, ní èyí tí ìjọba yóò máa lo láti leè pèsè àwọn ohun amáyédẹrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Information Minister has expressed deep shock and sadness over the death of Alex Akinyele
Yoruba: --- Mínísítà fún ìròyìn fẹ̀dùn ọkàn rẹ hàn lórí ikú olóògbé olóyè Alex Akinyele

English: Nigeria’s Minister of Information and Culture, Mr. Lai Mohammed, has expressed deep shock and sadness over the death of a former Minister of Information, Chief Alex Akinyele.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àsà lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà, Lai Mohammed ti fẹ̀dùn ọkàn rẹ hàn lórí ikú olóògbé olóyè Alex Akinyele, tí ó jẹ́ mínísítà àná fún ìròyìn lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: In a statement issued in Abuja on Friday, Mohammed called the death of Chief Akinyele a monumental loss to his family, the people of Ondo State and Nigeria in general.
Yoruba: Nínú àtèjáde kàn tí Mínísítà gbé jáde lọ́jọ́ Etí pé ikú olóyè Alex Akinyẹle jẹ́ àdánù mále-gbàgbé fún ẹbí, gbogbo àwon omo ìpínlè Ondo àti orílè èdè Nàíjíríà lápapọ̀.

English: The Minister described the late Chief Akinyele as an astute administrator and a highly-respected public relations practitioner.
Yoruba: Mínísítà sápéjùwe olóògbé Alex Akinyele gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùfokànsìn àti ẹni tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ orílè èdè Nàíjíríà púpọ̀.

English: He said Chief Akinyele’s tenure as Minister of Information, and later as the Chairman of the defunct National Sports Commission.
Yoruba: Olóògbé Akínyẹlé ti jẹ́ mínísítà fún ìròyìn lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà àti alága àjọ tó ń sàmójútó eré ìdárayá lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà tẹ́lẹ̀rí nígbà ayé rẹ̀.

English: He prayed to God for the repose of Chief Akinyele’s soul.
Yoruba: Mínísítà wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.

English: --- Nigeria seeks funds from US for infrastructure development
Yoruba: --- Nàíjíríà yóò yàá ọgọ́ta biliọnu dọla fún ìdàgbàsókè ohun amáyédẹrun láti ilẹ̀ Amẹrika.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has expressed the willingness of the Nigerian government to mobilise additional capital from development finance institutions for the upgrade of critical infrastructure in the country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílè èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti ní kàkà kéku máa jẹ sèsé yóò fi sàwàdànù ni, òun yóò wá wọ̀rọ̀kọ̀ fi sàdá láti wá owó tí yóò lò fún ìdàgbàsókè ohun amáyédẹrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: President Buhari met the U.S Treasury Secretary, Steven Mnuchin in Riyadh and they had positive discussions on investments in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń sèpàdé pẹ̀lú akọ̀wé owó fún orílẹ̀ èdè Amerika, Steven Mnuchin ni Riyadh lórí bí ìdàgbàsókè yóò ṣe dé bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, nípa ṣíṣe ètò ìrànwọ́ owó fún orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: The organization is the United States International Development Finance Corporation (USIDFC), the corporation provides $60 billion for investments in developing nations.
Yoruba: Àjọ orílẹ̀ èdè Amerika tó ń rí sí pípèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ owó tí wọn ń pè ní United States International Development Finance Corporation (USIDFC) ti ya ọgọ́ta bílíọ́nù dọ́là sọ́tọ̀ fún ìdàgbàsókè ohun amáyédẹrùn fún àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí ó kù díẹ̀ kí wọn fọwọ́ họrí.

English: --- Mobolaji Johnson is dead
Yoruba: --- Mobọ́lájí Johnson di olóògbé.

English: Lagos State Governor Mr. Babajide Sanwo-Olu has expressed sadness over the death of the first Military Governor of the State, Brigadier-General Mobolaji Johnson.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó Babajide Sanwo-olu ti fi ẹ̀dùn ọkàn rẹ̀ hàn lórí ikú olóògbé ajagunfẹ̀yìntì, Mobólájí Johnson tí ó jẹ́ gómìnà ológun àkọ́kọ́ fún ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

English: Sanwo-Olu described the late General Johnson as a complete gentleman and officer, a dedicated ‘Lagosians’.
Yoruba: Sanwo-Olu sàpèjúwe olóògbé Mobólájí Johnson gẹ́gẹ́ bí onírẹ̀lẹ̀ òṣìṣẹ́ ológun, tí ó sì tún ní ìfẹ́ ìlú Èkó lọ́kàn.

English: Late General Johnson contributed immensely to the development of Lagos State in particular and the nation in general.
Yoruba: Olóògbé Mobólájí Johnson kó ipa pàtàkì fún ìdàgbàsókè ìlú Èkó àti lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lápapọ̀.

English: Governor Sanwo-Olu recalled General Johnson’s time as the first Military Governor of Lagos State from May 1967 to July 1975, when the late administrator brought visible infrastructural development to the State.
Yoruba: Sanwo –Olu tún tẹ̀síwájú pé nígbà tí olóògbé Mobólájí Johnson jẹ gómìnà àkọ́kọ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó lásìkò ìjọba ológun láàrin osùn Karùn-ún ọdún 1967 sí osù keje ,ọdún 1975 ni ètò ìdàgbàsókè wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: The Governor reminded ‘Lagosians’ that the best way to immortalise the deceased is to ensure that good governance spreads to every facet of the society.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ‘Lagosians’ pé ọ̀nà láti fi ẹ̀mí ìmoore hàn sí olóògbé náà ní láti jẹ́ kí ètò ìsèjọba rere tàn yíká ní àgbègbè àti àwùjọ wa.

English: Mobolaji Johnson died at 83 in Lagos after a brief illness.
Yoruba: Olóògbé Mobólájí Johnson jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè lẹ́yìn àìsàn díẹ̀, ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rin (83) ni olóògbé náà, kí ó tó jáde láye.

English: --- Nigeria targets 100m citizens in primary healthcare in 10 years
Yoruba: --- Ọgọ́rùn ún miliọnu ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò jẹ̀gbádùn ètò ìlera alábọ́dé.

English: Nigeria is working to reach 100million citizens through at least 10,000 revitalized Primary Healthcare Centres, PHCs, through a phased approach in the next 10 years.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní kàkà kéku máa jẹ sèsé yóò fi sàwàdànù ni, nípa síse àtúnse sí àwọn ilé- ìwòsàn tó pèsè ètò ìlera alábọ́dé ẹ̀gbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá ti awọn ọgọ́rùn ún miliọnu ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò fi leè jẹ̀gbádùn ètò-ìlera alábọ́dé láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá.

English: This was contained in a presentation made by the Federal Ministry of Health on Tuesday at the meeting of the National Economic Council, NEC, presided over by Vice President Yemi Osinbajo.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń rí sí ètò ìlera lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹgun níbi ìpàdé tí ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ọrọ̀ ajé se, nílùú Àbújá , ní èyí ti ́igbákejì ààrẹ , Yẹmi Osinbajo darí rẹ̀.

English: Governor of Anambra, Willy Obiano, who briefed State House correspondents after the meeting, said that “despite the progress, there is still work to be done to sustain the current polio gains and stop the transmission of Circulating Vaccine Derived Polio Viruses.”
Yoruba: Nígbà tí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Anambra, Willy Obiano ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn ilé-isẹ́ ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́yìn ìpàdé pé “Bí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ṣe ṣe àṣeyọrí lórí ààrùn rọmọ lápá-rọmọ lẹ́sẹ̀, síbẹ̀ isẹ́ sì pọ̀ láti ṣe nípa fífi òpin sí ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn ọ̀hún.

English: Requests to NEC Obiano said that the ministry requested the NEC to intervene to ensure that Nigeria sustains the achievements it has made in healthcare provision.
Yoruba: "Obiano sọ pé àjọ ọ̀hún wá ń bẹ̀bẹ̀ fún ètò ìrànwọ́ lọ́wọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé láti pèsè owó ìrànwọ́ kí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà leè tẹ̀síwájú nínú àwọn àṣeyọrí tí ó ti se nípa pípèsè ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: --- Golden Eaglets Victory: President Buhari tasks Nigerians on resilience
Yoruba: --- E máse fààyè gba ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì okàn- Ààre Buhari gba àwon omo orílè-èdè Nàíjíríà níyànjú.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has applauded the performance of the Golden Eaglets on Tuesday in their second game at the ongoing FIFA Under 17 World Cup in Brazil, which saw them winning 3-2 after they had trailed Ecuador by 1-2, fifteen minutes to the end of the match.
Yoruba: Ààre Muhammadu Buhari gbósùbà káre láí fún ikọ̀ agbábóòlù Nàíjíríà, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn kòju mẹ́tàdínlógún lọ (Golden Eaglets) fún iṣẹ takun-takun wọn, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ náà gbo ewúro ìyà sójú ikọ̀ akaẹgbẹ́ won láti orílẹ̀-èdè Ecuador lánàá ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́gun (Tuesday), nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbáyé tàwọn ọ̀dọ́ tọ́jọ́ orí wọn kòju mẹ́tàdínlógún lọ tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Brazil (FIFA Under 17 World Cup in Brazil).

English: He therefore, recommended the can-do spirit displayed by the young boys to Nigerians, urging them to display such in all areas of endeavour, and in national development.
Yoruba: "Ààrẹ wá lo ìwà akínkanjú àwọn ọ̀dọ́ náà láti fi gba àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà níyànjú láti mú ìwà náà lò nínú gbogbo ohun tí wọn bá ń dáwọ́ lé, pàápàá jùlo fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà.

English: --- Augustina Okechukwu, laid to rest in Enugu
Yoruba: --- Wón tẹ́ Olóògbé Augustina Okechukwu sáfẹ́fẹ́ rere nílùú Enugu.

English: Mrs Augustina Okechukwu, wife of the Director-General of Voice of Nigeria (VON), Mr Osita Okechukwu, was on Saturday laid to rest at her country home, Eke in Udi Local Government Area of Enugu State.
Yoruba: Olóògbé Augustina Okechukwu, ayaaba olùdarí àgbà ilé-iṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn Voice of Nigeria (VON), ọ̀gbẹ́ni Osita Okechukwu, ti wọ ilẹ̀ sùn báyìí nílùú rẹ̀ tín ṣe Eke, níjọba ìbílẹ̀ Udi Local Government nípínlè Enugu, lọ́jọ́ àbáméta (Saturday).

English: Preaching a sermon at the funeral mass at St. Paul’s Catholic Church, Eke, a cleric, Rev. Fr. Nnamdi Nwankwo, enjoined Christians to live selfless lives meant to uplift the living conditions of others around them.
Yoruba: Lásìkò ìwàásù nílé ìjọ́sìn St.Paul’s Catholic Church, nílùú Eke, òjíṣé olúwa alàgbà Nnamdi Nwankwo, nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀, Ó rọ àwon onígbàgbó láti gbé ìgbéayé tí yóò mú ayérorùn fún àwon tí ó wà láyìíká won gbogbo, kí won sì tún jẹ́ olùfokán sín nílé Olúwa.

English: In his remarks, husband of the deceased and DG of VON, Mr Okechukwu thanked Nigerians from all walks of life for showing his family great love during the period of mourning.
