English: Publishers from Nassau gather at the airport to welcome their fellow brothers and sisters who were evacuated from Great Abaco Island The United States branch reports that of the 1,742 publishers in the Bahamas only one sister experienced a minor injury.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde láti Nassau wá kí àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wọn tí wọ́n kó kúrò ní erékùṣù Great Abaco káàbọ̀ ní pápákọ̀ òfuurufú Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé lára àwọn akéde tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún méje àti méjìlélógójì (1,742) tó wà ní Bahamas, arábìnrin kan ṣoṣo ló kàn fara pa díẹ̀.

English: As of this report, a total of 48 homes of Witnesses sustained damage and 8 homes were destroyed.
Yoruba: Ní àsìkò tá a ń kọ ìròyìn yìí, ilé méjìdínláàádọ́ta (48) tó jẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́ nígbà tí ilé mẹ́jọ bàjẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.

English: Many of the publishers living on Great Abaco Island were evacuated to Nassau, the capital of the Bahamas.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn akéde tó ń gbé ní erékùṣù Great Abaco ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò pé kí wọ́n kó lọ sí ìlú Nassau, tó jẹ́ olú ìlú Bahamas.

English: They were warmly welcomed by local brothers and sisters at the airport.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó sì wà níbẹ̀ kí wọn káàbọ̀ tayọ̀tayọ̀ ní pápá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú.

English: Our brothers and sisters collect and package relief supplies at the West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center The Disaster Relief Committee and the local circuit overseer are organizing relief aid and shepherding the publishers affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin ń ṣètò àwọn nǹkan ìrànwọ́ ní gbọ̀ngàn àpéjọ tó ń jẹ́ West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní agbègbè náà ń ṣètò ìtọ́jú pàjáwìrì, wọ́n sì tún ń ṣètò ìbẹ̀wò olùṣọ́ àgùntàn fún àwọn akéde tí àjálù dé bá.

English: Brothers from the United States branch office have also traveled to the area to assist in the relief efforts and provide spiritual encouragement to the congregations.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà náà rìnrìn àjò lọ sí agbègbè náà kí wọ́n lè pèsè àwọn ohun tí àwọn ará yìí nílò kí wọ́n sì fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú.

English: Relief supplies shipped from the West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center arrive in Freeport, Bahamas.
Yoruba: Àwọn nǹkan ìrànwọ́ tí wọ́n fi ọkọ̀ òkun kó láti gbọ̀ngàn àpéjọ West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center dé sí Freeport ní Bahamas.

English: Local brothers load the boxes onto a truck for distribution In the United States, the storm primarily affected North and South Carolina.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó wà níbẹ̀ ń kó àwọn páálí ẹrù náà sínú ọkọ̀ tó máa pín in kiri Ní orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà, apá Àríwá àti Gúúsù Carolina ni ìjì náà ti ṣọṣẹ́ jùlọ.

English: No brothers or sisters were injured in the disaster, but 737 of our brothers have been displaced, most of whom were temporarily evacuated until they are able to return to their homes.
Yoruba: Ko sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin kankan tó fara pa nínú àjálù náà, àmọ́ àwọn ará tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje àti mẹ́tàdínlógójì (737) ló ni láti sa fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.

English: Also, 50 homes and 12 Kingdom Halls sustained damage.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ní ìgbìmọ̀ náà ṣètò pé kí wọ́n kó kúrò fúngbà díẹ̀ títí dìgbà tí wọ́n a fì lè pa dà sílé.

English: No injuries were reported among our brothers in Canada.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àádọ́ta (50) ilé àti gbọ̀ngàn ìjọba méjìlá (12) ló bà jẹ́.

English: The storm caused minor property damage to some of our brothers’ homes as well as power outages.
Yoruba: A ò gbọ́ ìròyìn pé ẹnikẹ́ni lára àwọn ará wà ní Kánádà fara pa. Ìjì náà ba àwọn nǹkan díẹ̀ jẹ́ lára ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa kan, bẹ́ẹ̀ ló sì ba iná mànàmáná wọn jẹ́.

English: The brothers and sisters in the local congregations were able to assist those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó wà nínú ìjọ ládùúgbò yẹn ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn ará tí àjálù náà dé bá.

English: We are grateful that Jehovah is hearing the “pleas for help” of our brothers who are trusting in him during these difficult times.
Yoruba: A mà dúpẹ́ o, pé Jèhófà ń gbọ́ “ẹ̀bẹ̀ [àwọn ará wa] fún ìrànlọ́wọ́,” bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbọ́kàn lé e ní àkókò tí nǹkan lè koko yìí.​

English: The wildfires in California have been largely contained, and the United States Branch Committee has provided the following updated information regarding our brothers in the region.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń kápá iná runlérùnnà tó ń jó lọ́nà tó kàmàmà ní California.

English: No deaths have been reported, but eight of our brothers were injured and more than 1,400 were displaced.
Yoruba: Nínú ìsọfúnni díẹ̀ tá a rí gbà látọ̀dọ̀ Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Amẹ́ríkà nípa àwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà lágbègbè yẹn, kò sí arákùnrin wa tàbí arábìnrin wa kankan tó kú, àmọ́ àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́jọ ṣèṣe, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin [1,400] ló sì ti sá kúrò nílé.

English: Additionally, a total of 29 of our brothers’ homes were completely destroyed.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n [29] ló ti bàjẹ́ pátápátá.

English: All the displaced brothers were cared for by other Witnesses in neighboring congregations and circuits, and the majority have already returned to their homes.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé torí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ń rí ìtọ́jú gbà látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ará tó wà ní ìjọ àti àyíká míì tó wà nítòsí wọn, púpọ̀ nínú àwọn arákùnrin wa ló sì ti pa dà sílé wọn.

English: While the fires were still raging, representatives from the branch office visited the circuit overseers, the Disaster Relief Committee, and local relief volunteers.
Yoruba: Lásìkò tí iná yẹn ṣì ń ṣọṣẹ́, àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì lọ́ ṣèbẹ̀wò sáwọn Alábòójútó àyíká, Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àtàwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù dé bá.

English: Encouraging visits were held with the families who lost their homes.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tó pàdánù ilé wọn sínú ìjàǹbá yẹn.

English: Additionally, special meetings with the two primary circuits impacted by the fires were arranged to provide scriptural comfort and support to the large number of evacuees.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún ṣe ìpàdé àkànṣe kan pẹ̀lú àwọn àyíká méjì tí àjálù yẹn dé bá gan-an kí wọ́n lè fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọn sì ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to comfort and support our brothers as they face this distressing situation.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa báa lọ láti pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà nínú ìṣòro yìí.

English: Torrential rain and melted snow triggered flooding in Nebraska and Iowa during mid-March 2019.
Yoruba: Òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá àti yìnyín tó yọ́ fa omíyalé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Nebraska àti Iowa lóṣù March 2019.

English: As rivers in the area rose to historic levels, water breached dams and levees, damaging hundreds of homes and killing at least four people.
Yoruba: Omíyalé náà mú kí àwọn odò tó wà lágbègbè náà kún kọjá ààlà, àwọn ibi tó ń gba omi dúró ya lulẹ̀, ó ba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé jẹ́, ó sì pa ó kéré tán èèyàn mẹ́rin.

English: The United States branch reports that none of the 5,123 publishers in the area died or suffered injuries.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà (5,123) akéde tó wà níbẹ̀ tó kú tàbí tó fara pa.

English: However, 84 publishers were displaced.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ akéde mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin (84) ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: Additionally, 8 of the brothers’ homes sustained major damage and 34 sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé mẹ́jọ àwọn ará wa bà jẹ́ gan-an, ilé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n (34) míì sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Volunteers in nearby congregations have begun the cleanup efforts with the support of Local Design/Construction personnel.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ìjọ lágbègbè náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́, wọ́n sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará tó wà ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.

English: The circuit overseers in the impacted areas are coordinating shepherding for those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ń fáwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ kàn níṣìírí.

English: We pray that our brothers will continue to be comforted by the practical and spiritual support they are receiving during this trial.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí ìrànlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará wa rí gbà nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí tù wọ́n nínú lásìkò ìṣòro yìí.

English: On January 9, a powerful storm resulting in widespread mudslides wreaked havoc on residents in the southern part of California, United States.
Yoruba: Ní January 9 lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ìjì líle kan jà ní gúúsù ìpínlẹ̀ California. Ìjì yẹn ló fa ọ̀gbàrá púpọ̀ gan-an tó sì han àwọn ará ìlú léèmọ̀.

English: News reports indicate that at least 21 people were killed and hundreds of homes were damaged or destroyed.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé àwọn mọ́kànlélógún [21] ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yẹn, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé ló wó, àwọn míì sì bàjẹ́.

English: No publishers were among those killed by the disaster.
Yoruba: Kò sí ọ̀kankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

English: In Burbank, the home and property of one publisher was damaged, and an additional eight families were evacuated in Ventura.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní ìlú Burbank, ìjì yẹn ba ilé àtàwọn nǹkan ìní akéde kan jẹ́. Bákan náà, ní ìlú Ventura ìdílé mẹ́jọ ló ti sá kúrò nílé.

English: No Kingdom Halls were damaged by the mudslides.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kankan kò bàjẹ́.

English: The circuit overseers and the Disaster Relief Committee, along with Local Design/Construction representatives, continue to support publishers who have been affected by the mudslides and the recent wildfires.
Yoruba: Àwọn Alábòójútó àyíká pẹ̀lú Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti àwọn aṣojú láti Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù dé bá.

English: During this time, we continue to keep our brothers in our prayers, confident that Jehovah will keep them strong.
Yoruba: Ní irú àsìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, àá máa báa lọ láti rántí àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa nínú àwọn àdúrà wa, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa fún wọn lókun tí wọ́n nílò.​

English: Joseph F. Rutherford, then serving as president of the Watch Tower Society, was present when construction began on the Kingdom Hall located at 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii.
Yoruba: Ọdún 1935 ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ amọ́kànyọ̀ yìí kọ́kọ́ wáyé.

English: The year was 1935.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Joseph F. Rutherford, tó jẹ́ ààrẹ Watch Tower Society nígbà yẹn wà níbẹ̀ nígbà tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ojúlé 1228 ní Pensacola Street, ìlú Honolulu, ìpínlẹ̀ Hawaii.

English: This little building would carry the distinction of being the first in the world to be named “Kingdom Hall.” It would also serve as an anchor for tremendous growth over the next eight decades.
Yoruba: Kò ní yà yín lẹ́nu pé ilé kékeré tí wọ́n kọ́ nígbà yẹn ni ilé ìjọsìn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tá a kọ́kọ́ pè ní “Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.” Àtìgbà yẹn làwa èèyàn Jèhófà ti ń pe àwọn ibi tá a máa ń kóra jọ sí láti jọ́sìn ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba, ìyẹn sì ti lé lọ́gọ́rin (80) ọdún báyìí.

English: Today, 85 years later, the Pensacola Street Kingdom Hall is used by four congregations that support meetings held in five languages, including Hawaii Pidgin.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, àwọn ìjọ mẹ́rin ló ń ṣèpàdé nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn, èdè márùn-ún ni wọ́n sì fi ń ṣèpàdé níbẹ̀, títí kan èdè Hawaii Pidgin.

English: * The Kingdom Hall shortly after it was built in 1935 Before the COVID-19 pandemic, our brothers invited the local community, government officials, and educators to an open house from February 11 to 15, 2020, after completely remodeling the historic building.
Yoruba: * Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tá a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tún kọ́ ní 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii Ní February 11 sí 15, 2020, ìyẹn kí àrùn COVID-19 tó gbayé kan, lẹ́yìn tá a ti tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àkọ́kọ́ yẹn kọ́, àwọn ará wa pe àwọn ará ìlú, àwọn aṣojú ìjọba àtàwọn olùkọ́ láti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò kí wọ́n sì rín yí ká ilé náà.

English: Visitors were escorted on a tour of the building, viewed historical displays, and listened to presentations by the brothers that highlighted the activities of Jehovah’s modern-day organization.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa mú àwọn àlejò náà rìn yí ká ilé náà, kí wọ́n lè rí onírúurú fọ́tò àtàwọn àkọ́sílẹ̀ ìtàn nípa ilé náà. Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn arákùnrin tún ṣàlàyé àwọn nǹkan táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń gbé ṣe lóde òní fún wọn.

English: The event culminated on February 16, with a dedication talk by Brother David H. Splane, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó di February 16, Arákùnrin David H. Splane tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà wá fọba lé e pẹ̀lú àsọyé ìyàsímímọ́.

English: One sister who helped with preparations for the program said: “Even though the community open house wasn’t about preaching, we feel that a great witness was given to many who may otherwise have never learned about Jehovah’s Witnesses.” The event helped our brothers and sisters gain a deeper sense of their rich spiritual heritage in the Hawaiian Islands and to personally see the fulfillment of the words, “In the islands of the sea they will glorify the name of Jehovah the God of Israel.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin kan tó wà lára àwọn tó ṣe àwọn ìmúrasílẹ̀ kan kí ètò náà lè kẹ́sẹ járí sọ pé: “Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kì í ṣe torí àtiwàásù fáwọn èèyàn náà la ṣe ní kí wọ́n wá ṣèbẹ̀wò, a gbà pé ẹ̀rí ńlá ni ìbẹ̀wò náà jẹ́ fún ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn tó ṣeé ṣe kí wọ́n má mọ̀ nípa àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.” Ètò tá a ṣe pé káwọn èèyàn rìn yí ká Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn mú káwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin túbọ̀ lóye ìtàn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láwọn erékùṣù Hawaii, ó sì mú kí wọ́n rí ìmúṣẹ Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tó sọ pé: “Ní àwọn erékùṣù òkun, wọ́n máa yin orúkọ Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run Ísírẹ́lì lógo.

English: ^ par. 2 During the current COVID-19 pandemic, all congregation meetings in the United States are temporarily being held via videoconference rather than in Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: ^ ìpínrọ̀ 2 Lásìkò tí àrùn COVID-19 gbòde, orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára ni gbogbo ìjọ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ń ṣèpàdé dípò kí wọ́n máa kóra jọ nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.

English: In recent months, multiple wildfires have blazed across the state of California, charring some 362 square kilometers (140 sq mi) and leaving a massive burn scar on the landscape.
Yoruba: Ní oṣù díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, àwọn iná kan jó ní ìpínlẹ̀ California, ó sì ba agbègbè tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé ọgọ́ta àti méjì kìlómítà jẹ́ níbùú àti lóòró (362 square kilometers).

English: The United States branch reports that more than 1,700 brothers and sisters had to evacuate due to the various fires.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé àwọn ará tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún méje (1,700) ló ti sá kúrò nílé nítorí àwọn iná tó jó léraléra náà.

English: No injuries or fatalities have been reported.
Yoruba: A ò tíì gbọ́ pé ẹnikẹ́ni fara pa tàbí kú.

English: The Sandalwood Fire in Calimesa that started on October 10, 2019, destroyed the home of one of our brothers.
Yoruba: Ní October 10, 2019, iná tó jó àdúgbò Sandalwood tó wà ní Calimesa ba ilé ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa jẹ́.

English: Also, some homes have sustained minor smoke damage.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, èéfín ba àwọn ilé kan jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Almost all who evacuated have been able to return home.
Yoruba: Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ gbogbo àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé ló ti pa dà sílé.

English: “We can’t overstate the importance of obeying direction in these cases,” stated one elder who lives in one of the affected areas.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn alàgbà tó ń gbé láwọn ibi tí iná náà ti jó sọ pé: “Ó ṣe pàtàkì gan-an pé ká máa tẹ̀ lé ìtọ́ni tí irú nǹkan báyìí bá ṣẹlẹ̀, kódà, ó yẹ ká tẹnu mọ́ ọn dáadáa.

English: “Our brothers quickly evacuated the danger zones, and this allowed firefighters to concentrate on fighting the blaze instead of searching for people.” Circuit overseers and local elders continue to coordinate relief supplies for evacuees.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ làwọn ará wa ti kúrò láwọn ibi tí iná náà ti ń jó, ìyẹn sì jẹ́ kó rọrùn fáwọn panápaná láti gbájú mọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe máa pa iná náà dípò kí wọ́n máa wá àwọn èèyàn kiri.” Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà tó ń gbé lágbègbè náà ń ṣe gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé.

English: The loving concern and hospitality demonstrated by publishers in the surrounding areas have been outstanding.
Yoruba: Ìfẹ́ àti ẹ̀mí ọ̀làwọ́ tí àwọn akéde tó ń gbé lágbègbè yìí fi hàn bùáyà.

English: Regarding this outpouring of Christian love, one circuit overseer noted, “We had no problem finding housing for all those displaced.” We are grateful to Jehovah for those who “have become a source of great comfort” for our brothers and sisters affected by these wildfires.
Yoruba: Torí ìfẹ́ tó jinlẹ̀ táwọn ará fi hàn, alábòójútó àyíká kan sọ pé: “Kò ṣòro fún wa rárá láti rí ilé táwọn tó sá kúrò nílé máa gbé.” A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà torí àwọn tó “ti di orísun ìtùnú” fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tí iná yìí lé kúrò nílé.

English: On November 14, 2019, a student opened fire on fellow classmates at a high school in Santa Clarita, California.
Yoruba: Ní November 14, 2019, ọmọ ilé ìwé kan dàbọn bolẹ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ kíláàsì rẹ̀ ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ girama tó wà nílùú Santa Clarita, ní California.

English: The gunman killed two students and wounded three, before shooting himself.
Yoruba: Ọmọ náà pa ọmọ ilé ìwé méjì, ó sì ṣe àwọn mẹ́ta léṣe, kó tó wá pa ara ẹ̀.

English: Sadly, Dominic Blackwell, the son of one of our sisters, was one of the students killed.
Yoruba: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé Dominic Blackwell, ọmọ arábìnrin wa kan wà lára àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé tó yìnbọn pa.

English: He was 14 years old and regularly attended meetings with his mother, Sister Nancy Blackwell.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlá (14) ni, ó sì máa ń lọ sí ìpàdé déédéé pẹ̀lú ìyá rẹ̀ tó ń jẹ́ Nancy Blackwell.

English: Dominic is survived by his parents and three younger siblings.
Yoruba: Bàbá, ìyá àti àbúrò mẹ́ta ni Dominic fi sílẹ̀.

English: The elders are providing Scriptural comfort and support to the family and the local congregation.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ń pèsè ìtùnú látinú Ìwé Mímọ́ fún ìdílé yìí àtàwọn ará ìjọ wọn.

English: We are deeply saddened to hear about this tragedy.
Yoruba: Ó bà wá nínú jẹ́ gan-an pé irú àjálù burúkú yìí ṣẹlẹ̀.

English: We long for the time when God will “wipe out every tear .
Yoruba: À ń retí ìgbà tí Ọlọ́run máa ‘nu gbogbo omijé kúrò tí ikú ò ní sí mọ́, tí kò sì ní sí ọ̀fọ̀ tàbí ẹkún tàbí ìrora mọ́.’

English: Dates: August 9-11, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: August 9 sí 11, 2019

English: Location: Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tó Ti Wáyé: Chase Field ní Phoenix, Arizona, Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà

English: Program Language: English
Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì

English: Peak Attendance: 40,237
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 40,237

English: Total Number Baptized: 352
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 352

English: Number of International Delegates: 5,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

English: Invited Branches: Australasia, Britain, Canada, Central Europe, Chile, France, Greece, India, Italy, Korea, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè: Australasia, ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Kánádà, Central Europe, Chile, Faransé, Gíríìsì, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Kòríà, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Tọ́kì

English: Local Experience: Steve Moore, the president and CEO of Visit Phoenix, which helps book conventions, hotels, and resorts in the Phoenix area, commented:
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Steve Moore tó jẹ́ ààrẹ àti Ọ̀gá àgbà iléeṣẹ́ kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Visit Phoenix, ló bá wa ṣètò ibi tá a ti ṣe àpéjọ náà, àwọn òtẹ́ẹ̀lì àti ibi ìgbafẹ́ tá a ṣeré lọ ní ìlú Phoenix, ó sọ pé:

English: “[This convention] is the most professionally organized convention I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with in a very long career.
Yoruba: “Ọjọ́ pẹ́ gan-an tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí, àmọ́ àpéjọ yín ló ṣì wà létòletò jù látìgbà tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí. Inú mi dùn pé a jọ ṣiṣẹ́.

English: And on top of that, you promise to clean the stadium before you leave—no one else does that.”"
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ ṣèlérí pé ẹ máa jẹ́ kí pápá ìṣeré yìí wà ní mímọ́ kẹ́ ẹ tó kúrò, kò sẹ́ni tó sọ bẹ́ẹ̀ rí, àfẹ̀yin nìkan.”"

English: In January 2019, the museum exhibits at world headquarters were officially made available in American Sign Language (ASL).
Yoruba: Bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti January 2019, ó ti ṣeé ṣe fáwọn tó gbọ́ Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL) láti túbọ̀ gbádùn ìbẹ̀wò wọn sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa.

English: Enrique Ford, who oversees the Museum Department, explains: “The translation and computer programming effort that went into making the museum content available to the ASL community was extraordinary!
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Enrique Ford, tó jẹ́ alábòójútó Ẹ̀ka Àwọn Nǹkan Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sọ pé: “Iṣẹ́ kékeré kọ́ ni ẹ̀ka ìtúmọ̀ èdè àti ti kọ̀ǹpútà ṣe láti mú káwọn ará wa lóye àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí ní Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL)!

English: Now deaf and hard-of-hearing brothers and sisters who visit our exhibits can have an immersive, engaging, and educational experience when they tour.” Ana Barrios, who is deaf and serves as a regular pioneer in New York, was among the first to tour the exhibits in ASL.
Yoruba: Torí náà, àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí wọ́n jẹ́ adití tàbí tí wọn ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ gbọ́rọ̀ tí wọ́n máa ń ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ wa máa gbádùn ẹ̀ dọ́ba báyìí. Á mú kí wọ́n túbọ̀ mọyì ohun tí wọ́n rí, á wú wọn lórí, á sì túbọ̀ kọ́ wọ́n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gan-an.” Arábìnrin Ana Barrios, tó jẹ́ adití tó sì ń ṣe aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé nílùú New York, wà lára àwọn tó kọ́kọ́ ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ yìí.

English: She commented: “Getting the device with ASL content was thrilling!
Yoruba: Ẹ gbọ́ ohun tó sọ: “Nígbà tí mò ń wo àlàyé nípa àtẹ náà lédè adití lórí ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n gbé fún mi, orí mi wú!

English: Although I had been to the museum before and was familiar with the layout, the information had not yet touched my heart because I didn’t fully understand the details from just reading the English captions.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí mo máa wá síbí rèé, léraléra ni mo sì ti rí àwọn nǹkan tí wọ́n pàtẹ, síbẹ̀ ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tí ohun tí mo rí wọ̀ mí lọ́kàn gan-an, ó sì yé mi dáadáa ju ìgbà tí mo kàn ka èdè òyìnbó tí wọ́n fi ṣàlàyé ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan wọn.

English: After watching a few tracks in ASL, I started to get a sense of Jehovah’s name in a way that I never had before.
Yoruba: Bí mo ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbọ́ àlàyé náà lédè mi làwọn nǹkan wá túbọ̀ ṣe kedere sí mi.

English: The exhibit highlighted aspects of Jehovah’s personality that stirred emotions in me to the point of tears!” The ASL project began in June 2017.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, mo wá lóye ohun tí orúkọ Jèhófà dúró fún, àṣé mi ò tiẹ̀ fi bẹ́ẹ̀ lóye ẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀! Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìpàtẹ yẹn jẹ́ kí n túbọ̀ lóye àwọn ànímọ́ Jèhófà, àlàyé yẹn wọ̀ mí lọ́kàn débi pé ṣe ni mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í da omi lójú!” June 2017 niṣẹ́ títúmọ̀ àti ṣíṣètò bẹ̀rẹ̀ lórí ìpàtẹ àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé ní Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà.

English: A total of 23 brothers and sisters, including 6 deaf and 6 hearing publishers who grew up with deaf parents, helped with the translation and production of the museum content into ASL.
Yoruba: Mẹ́tàlélógún (23) làwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó kópa nínu rẹ̀, adití ni mẹ́fà lára wọn, mẹ́fà míì sì láwọn òbí tó jẹ́ adití. Gbogbo wọn ló lọ́wọ́ nínú iṣẹ́ títúmọ̀ àwọn àlàyé yẹn sí ASL, wọ́n sì tún kópa nínú àwọn fídíò náà.

English: The translation group filmed over 900 videos, about nine hours of content, to match the museum audio tracks.
Yoruba: Fídíò tí wọ́n ṣe lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án (900), wọ́n sì gùn tó nǹkan bíi wákàtí mẹ́sàn-án, kó lè bá àlàyé tá a ti gba ohùn rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ mu.

English: Recording sessions for the ASL tour information were conducted in three studio locations: the ASL remote translation office in Fort Lauderdale, Florida; the United States branch facilities in Wallkill, New York; and the world headquarters offices in Warwick, New York.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbohùnsílẹ̀ mẹ́ta tó wà fún èdè adití la ti ṣe iṣẹ́ náà: Ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ Èdè Adití (ASL) ní Fort Lauderdale, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida; èyí tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ní Wallkill, ìpínlẹ̀ New York; àtèyí tó wà ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa ní Warwick, ìpínlẹ̀ New York.

English: Before releasing the final version of the ASL museum content, deaf brothers and sisters of different ages and backgrounds tested and helped refine the translation and tour experience.
Yoruba: Kó lè dá wa lójú pé kò sí tàbí-ṣùgbọ́n kankan nínú iṣẹ́ náà, a pe àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin mélòó kan tí wọ́n jẹ́ adití, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn sì yàtọ̀ síra pé kí wọ́n bá wa fojú ṣùnnùkùn wò ó. A ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àwọn àkíyèsí wọn kó tó di pé a gbé e jáde níkẹyìn.

English: Some of the brothers and sisters who assisted with the production of the ASL content for the Warwick museum.
Yoruba: Díẹ̀ rèé lára àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó túmọ̀ sí èdè adití nípa àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tá a pàtẹ sí Warwick.

English: The Museum Department purchased touch-screen devices that can display the ASL tour content in a similar format to the standard audio tour devices used for the Warwick museum exhibitions.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé ra ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé alágbèéká mélòó kan tó lè jẹ́ káwọn tó ń sọ èdè adití (ASL) lóye àwọn nǹkan tí wọ́n ń rí bí wọ́n ṣe ń rìn yíká tí wọ́n sì ń fojú lóúnjẹ. Àlàyé kan náà táwọn tó ti nǹkan bọ etí ń gbọ́ nípa ìpàtẹ Warwick yìí làwọn náà ń wò lórí ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n mú dání.

English: The Museum Department also enabled the existing 14 touch screens in the exhibits to accommodate ASL videos.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sáwọn ẹ̀rọ téèyàn lè mú dání, Ẹ̀ka Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tún ṣètò ohun tá a lè pè ní tẹlifíṣọ̀n gàdàgbà mẹ́rìnlá míì tó ń ṣàgbéyọ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé náà, tó sì ń ṣàlàyé wọn lédè ASL.

English: Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses, states: “The purpose of the Warwick museum is to encourage and build up the faith of all who visit world headquarters.
Yoruba: Mark Sanderson, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé: “Kí nìdí tá a fi ṣètò ìpàtẹ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí? A fẹ́ kó fún gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa níṣìírí, kó sì fún ìgbàgbọ́ wọn lókun.

English: We’re excited to have the museum exhibit content available in 14 languages, including ASL for visiting deaf and hard-of-hearing brothers and sisters and non-Witnesses alike.” To date, over half a million visitors have toured Warwick.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé èdè mẹ́rìnlá (14) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ la fi ṣàlàyé onírúurú nǹkan tó wà níbi ìpàtẹ yìí, títí kan Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL). Torí náà, ó dùn mọ́ wa pé àwọn ará wa tó jẹ́ adití àtàwọn tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ gbọ́rọ̀, títí kan àwọn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí ló máa jàǹfààní.” Tá a bá ṣírò ẹ̀, ó lè ní ìlàjì mílíọ̀nù èèyàn tó ti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa ní Warwick.

English: The worldwide brotherhood is invited to come and see firsthand the museum exhibits and learn more about the rich spiritual heritage of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: A ké sí ẹ̀yin ará wa níbi gbogbo láyé pé kẹ́ ẹ wá síbi, kẹ́ ẹ sì fojú ara yín rí àwọn nǹkan tá a pàtẹ síbi ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí. Ẹ̀gàn ni hẹ̀ẹ̀, á jẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ túbọ̀ mọyì àwọn ohun ribiribi táwa èèyàn Jèhófà ti gbé ṣe àtohun tó ti wáyé nínú ìtàn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: All who do so will be encouraged to continue to “put their confidence in God.”—Psalm 78:7.
Yoruba: Kò sí àní-àní, gbogbo àwọn tó ti wá síbí lo pinnu pé títí láé làwọn á máa “gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Ọlọ́run.”—Sáàmù 78:7.

English: Opened since April 3, 2017, the self-guided tours at world headquarters in Warwick, New York, are comprised of three exhibits.
Yoruba: A ṣí i ní April 3, 2017, ìpàtẹ yìí pín sọ́nà mẹ́ta ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa tó wà nílùú Warwick, ní New York. Kò sí pé ẹnì kan ń mú èèyàn kiri ibẹ̀ tàbí kó máa ṣàlàyé fúnni.

English: “The Bible and the Divine Name” highlights that both God’s Word and his name have been preserved throughout history.
Yoruba: “The Bible and the Divine Name” ṣàlàyé báwọn kan ṣe sapá fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún láti tẹ Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti orúkọ rẹ̀ rì àtohun tí kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣàṣeyọrí.

English: (Isaiah 40:8) Over 100 rare Biblical scrolls, leaves, manuscripts, and books are showcased.
Yoruba: (Àìsáyà 40:8) Èèyàn á rí àwọn Bíbélì tó ṣọ̀wọ́n, tó lé lọ́gọ́rùn-ún (100) àtàwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé míì tó jẹ mọ́ Bíbélì.

English: “A People for Jehovah’s Name” includes a visual history of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: “A People for Jehovah’s Name” ṣe àfihàn ohun táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbé ṣe àtohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa látọdún yìí wá.

English: Artifacts and first-person accounts showing how Jehovah has progressively guided his people are featured.
Yoruba: Àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé àti ìrírí àwọn tọ́rọ̀ ṣojú wọn jẹ́ ká rí bí Jèhófà ṣe ń darí àwa èèyàn rẹ̀ látọdún yìí wá.

English: “World Headquarters—Faith in Action” explains the work of the six committees of the Governing Body and how they organize the worldwide activities of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: “World Headquarters—Faith in Action” ṣàlàyé ojúṣe ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà ti Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń bójú tó onírúurú iṣẹ́ táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń ṣe kárí ayé.

English: “Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial” is a special rotational exhibit.
Yoruba: “Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial.” Wọ́n máa ń pààrọ̀ ohun tí wọ́n kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí látìgbàdégbà.

English: It covers the time period of 1914 to 1919, and shows how the Bible Students faced tests of their faith, both individually and as an organization.
Yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ká mọ bí nǹkan ṣe rí láàárín ọdún 1914 sí 1919, àdánwò ìgbàgbọ́ táwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì kojú lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan àti lápapọ̀.

English: The interactive experience allows visitors to enjoy rare original photographs, documents, and graphics, as well as audio and video interviews.
Yoruba: Ìpàtẹ yìí ń jẹ́ káwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò rí àwọn fọ́tò tá a ti yà látọjọ́ gbọ́nhan, àwọn àkọsílẹ̀, àwòrán àtàwọn ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò tá a ti gbà sílẹ̀ tipẹ́tipẹ́. Àwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò lè tẹ́tí sí i tàbí kí wọ́n wò ó ní fídíò.

English: It has been open since October 3, 2018.
Yoruba: October 3, 2018 nibi ìpàtẹ yìí ti di àpéwò.

English: The exhibit content will eventually be transported and put on display at other branches and a new special exhibition will be opened at Warwick.
Yoruba: A máa fàwọn nǹkan tá a kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa míì káwọn náà lè pàtẹ wọn, àá wá pàtẹ àwọn nǹkan míì sí Warwick.

English: Dates: May 24-26, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: May 24 sí 26, 2019

English: Location: Marlins Park in Miami, Florida, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É: Marlins Park nílùú Miami, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida, Amẹ́ríkà

English: Program Language: Spanish
Yoruba: Èdè: Sípáníìṣì

English: Peak Attendance: 28,562
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 28,562

English: Total Number Baptized: 230
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 230

English: Number of International Delegates: 4,600
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ìlẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 4,600

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Spain"
Yoruba: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá: Ajẹntínà, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Sípéènì"

English: On Saturday, July 13, 2019, a Category 1 hurricane made landfall in Louisiana before quickly downgrading to a tropical storm known as Barry.
Yoruba: Ní Saturday, July 13, 2019, ìjì líle kan rọ́ lu ìlú Louisiana, kó tó di pé ọwọ́ wà rọlẹ̀ díẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi wá ń pè é ní Barry.

English: This tropical storm caused wind damage, flooding, and widespread power outages across the states of Alabama, Louisiana, and Mississippi.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle yìí ba nǹkan jẹ́, ó fa àkúnya omi, ó sì jẹ́ kí iná mànàmáná lọ ní ibi púpọ̀ yí ká ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Louisiana, àti Mississippi.

English: Although no publishers were injured or killed by this storm, 123 were displaced.
Yoruba: Bí o tì lẹ́ jẹ́ pé kò sí akéde kankan tó fara pa tàbí kú nínú ìjì náà, àwọn mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà (123) ni wọ́n di aláìnílé lórí.

English: Additionally, the storm damaged 27 homes of our brothers and sisters, as well as 5 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Láfikún, ìjì líle náà ba ilé mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (97) tó jẹ́ ti àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa jẹ́, pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún.

English: Circuit overseers and local elders are shepherding those affected by the storm.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń lọ bẹ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn wò kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: Also, publishers in neighboring congregations are providing water, food, and shelter where needed.
Yoruba: Bákan náà làwọn akéde láti àwọn ìjọ tó wà nítòsí ń pèsè omi, oúnjẹ àti ibùgbé níbi tí wọ́n ti nílò wọn.

English: Efforts to stabilize properties and perform repairs locally are already underway.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n á ṣe tún àwọn ilé tó nílò àtúnṣe ṣe.

English: Our prayers and support will continue to be with our brothers and sisters in the southern United States as they cope with the aftermath of Tropical Storm Barry.
Yoruba: Àá máa fi àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wa ní Gúúsù Amẹ́ríkà tí ìjì líle Barry ṣe lọ́ṣẹ́ sínú àdúrà wa, àá sì máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn.

English: On May 31, 2019, a gunman opened fire on employees working in a municipal office building in Virginia Beach, Virginia, United States.
Yoruba: Ní May 31, 2019, ọkùnrin kan bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ròjọ̀ ọta ìbọn lu àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ọ́fíìsì ìlú Virginia Beach, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia, lórílẹ̀-èdè United States.

English: Twelve people were killed and four were injured.
Yoruba: Èèyàn méjìlá ló kú, àwọn mẹ́rin sì fara pa.

English: The United States branch reports that sadly, one of our sisters, LaQuita Brown, was among those killed in this attack.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà fi hàn pé, ó ṣeni láàánú pé arábìnrin wa kan tó ń jẹ́, LaQuita Brown, wà lára àwọn tó kù nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí.

English: Sister Brown was 39 years old and a regular pioneer in the Seaview French Congregation in Norfolk, Virginia.
Yoruba: Ẹni ọdún mọ́kàndínlógójì (39) ni Arábìnrin Brown, aṣáájú-ọ̀nà sì ni nínú Ìjọ Seaview tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Faransé nílùú Norfolk, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia.

English: She also served as a Local/Design Construction volunteer.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin yìí máa ń yọ̀ǹda ara rẹ̀ láti ṣisẹ́ pẹ̀lú Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.

English: The local elders, along with the circuit overseer, are providing Scriptural encouragement and emotional support to Sister Brown’s friends and family.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà àti alábòójútó àyílká wọn ń fún tẹbítọ̀rẹ́ Arábìnrin Brown níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń tù wọ́n nínú.

English: We are deeply saddened to hear about the loss of our sister.
Yoruba: Ikú arábìnrin yìí dùn wá gan-an.

English: We look forward to the time when tragedies like this will no longer occur and there will be an “abundance of peace” on the earth.
Yoruba: À ń retí àsìkò tí irú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ò ní wáyé mọ́, tí “ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àlàáfíà” á sì wá káàkiri ayé.

English: A series of more than 100 tornadoes tore through the southeastern United States from April 12 to April 13, 2020.
Yoruba: Ní April 12 àti 13, 2020, ó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún (100) ìgbà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní tornado ṣoṣẹ́ ní apá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: The National Weather Service reported that one tornado, which spanned some two miles in width, was one of the largest in recorded history.
Yoruba: Àjọ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ipò Ojú Ọjọ́ sọ pé ọ̀kan lára ìjì líle náà fẹ̀ tó kílòmítà mẹ́ta, ó wà lára àwọn ìjì líle tó tóbi jù tó tíì jà rí.

English: The branch immediately contacted circuit overseers in the area to determine how our brothers were affected.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì kàn sí àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní agbègbè yẹn kí wọ́n lè mọ bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wa.

English: No brothers or sisters were killed by the severe weather. One sister suffered minor injuries when a tornado hit her home.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tí ìjì náà pa. Àmọ́, arábìnrin kan fara pa díẹ̀ nígbà tí ìjì náà fẹ́ lu ilé rẹ̀.

English: In total, 63 publishers were displaced, 12 homes were destroyed, and 58 homes sustained damage.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́ta (63) ló ní láti kúrò nílé, ilé méjìlá (12) ló wó, ilé méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta (58) ló sì bà jẹ́.

English: Additionally, five Kingdom Halls were lightly damaged and one Kingdom Hall sustained major damage from a falling tree.
Yoruba: Láfikún síyẹn, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀, àmọ́ igi kan wó lu Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan, ó sì bà á jẹ́ gan-an.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are continuing to evaluate the situation.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká ṣì ń kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe rí.

English: They are caring for the immediate practical and spiritual needs of our brothers and sisters, providing much-needed comfort to those who suffered loss.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ń bójú tó ohun táwọn ará nílò nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn tí àjálù náà bá.​

English: Tropical Depression Florence has inundated large parts of North Carolina, South Carolina, and other states with floodwaters.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Florence jà lọ́pọ̀ ibi ní ìpínlẹ̀ North Carolina, South Carolina àtàwọn ìpínlẹ̀ míì lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, omíyalé sì tún ṣẹlẹ̀ níbẹ̀.

English: Initially a Category 4 hurricane, Florence has killed at least 32 people and displaced thousands.
Yoruba: Ìgbà kan wà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní Florence yìí pa ó kéré tán, èèyàn méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n (32), tó sì sọ ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn di aláìrílégbé.

English: The United States branch reports that no publishers have been killed or seriously injured by the storm, although over 4,000 Witnesses have been displaced.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn akéde wa tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ tàbí tó fara pa ju bó ṣe yẹ, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin (4,000) Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí ìjì náà lé kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: Though conditions are improving, some areas are still not accessible due to high floodwaters.
Yoruba: Lóòótọ́, ìjì náà ti jà tán, síbẹ̀ àwọn ibì kan ò tíì ṣeé dé torí omi tó bo gbogbo ibẹ̀.

English: Current assessments indicate that the storm damaged 351 homes of our brothers and sisters and 21 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ̀yìn fi hàn pé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànléláàádọ́ta (351) ilé àwọn ará wa pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kànlélógún (21) ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́.

English: Food, water, clothing, shelter, and basic medical needs are being coordinated through a Disaster Relief Committee (DRC).
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí bí àwọn ará ṣe máa rí oúnjẹ, omi, ibùgbé àti ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn tí wọ́n nílò.

English: Relief efforts include the work of two tree removal crews who are assisting with the widespread damage.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ méjì kan tún wà tó ń ṣèrànwọ́ láti kó àwọn igi tó wó lulẹ̀ kúrò lágbègbè náà.

English: With flooding now becoming the major concern, volunteers from local congregations and others invited from elsewhere are coming to assist and will be working under the direction of the DRC.
Yoruba: Ohun tó kù báyìí ni bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún àwọn nǹkan tí omíyalé ti bà jẹ́ ṣe. Àwọn ará láwọn ìjọ tó wà níbẹ̀ àtàwọn tó wá láti ibòmíì ń yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti bá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù náà ṣiṣẹ́.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are making shepherding visits on those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ìjọ àti àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà níbẹ̀ sì ń lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn láti fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We pray for our brothers and sisters who are dealing with difficult circumstances as a result of the recent storm and look forward to the time when we will “feel no dread.
Yoruba: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tí nǹkan nira fún nítorí ìjì líle tó jà lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, a sì ń retí ìgbà tí ‘ẹ̀rù kankan’ ò ní bà wá mọ́.

English: Deadly tornadoes ripped through portions of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia, on Sunday, March 3, 2019, resulting in 23 fatalities and dozens of injuries.
Yoruba: Ní Sunday March 3, 2019, ìjì tó le gan-an jà láwọn apá ibì kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Florida àti Georgia, ó gbẹ̀mí èèyàn mẹ́tàlélógún (23), ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló sì fara pa.

English: The United States branch reports that there were no deaths among our brothers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú.

English: However, one of our sisters was injured when a tornado completely destroyed her home in Fort Valley, Georgia.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ arábìnrin wa kan fara pa nígbà tí ìjì líle ba ilé rẹ̀ jẹ́ pátápátá ní ìlú Fort Valley, ìpínlẹ̀ Georgia.

English: She is getting the necessary medical attention at a nearby hospital.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń tọ́jú rẹ̀ nílé ìwòsàn kan tó wà nítòsí.

English: Additionally, the branch reports that six of our brothers’ homes sustained damage and four others were totally destroyed.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì sọ pé ilé mẹ́fà àwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́, ó sì wó ilé mẹ́rin míì pátápátá.

English: Under the direction of circuit overseers in the area, publishers have supplied food, shelter, and clothing to the affected brothers, and local elders are providing spiritual comfort.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà ń ṣètò báwọn ará ṣe ń rí oúnjẹ, ibi tí wọ́n á gbé àti aṣọ, àwọn alàgbà sì ń fi Bíbélì fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We pray that our brothers who have been impacted by this disaster are comforted by our yeartext for 2019, “Do not be anxious, for I am your God.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí kàn rí ìtùnú nínú ẹṣin ọdún wa ti 2019 tó sọ pé, “Má wò yí ká, nítorí èmi ni Ọlọ́run rẹ.

English: The ongoing economic crisis in Venezuela continues to affect our brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ṣe túbọ̀ ń dẹnu kọlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà nípa lórí àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.

English: Every week, the branch office in Venezuela receives reports of publishers who have been victims of crimes.
Yoruba: Ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ni ìròyìn nípa àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n hùwà ọ̀daràn sí ń dé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà.

English: Also, numerous Kingdom Halls in the country have been burglarized.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba lórílẹ̀-èdè náà ni wọ́n ti jí àwọn nǹkan tó wà nínu rẹ̀ kó lọ.

English: Our brothers face hyperinflation as well as shortages of food, medicine, and other basic goods.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa ń fara dà á bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo nǹkan ló ti gbówó lérí, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni kò sí oúnjẹ, oògùn àtàwọn nǹkan tó ṣe pàtàkì míì.

English: Since 2013, over 20,000 publishers have fled to other countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Italy, Peru, Portugal, Spain, and the United States.
Yoruba: Látọdún 2013, ó lé ní ọ̀kẹ́ kan (20,000) akéde tó ti sá lọ́ sáwọn orílẹ̀-èdè míì bíi, Ajẹntínà, Brazil, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Ecuador, Ítálì, Peru, Pọ́túgà, Sípéènì àti Amẹ́ríkà.

English: * Despite these difficult circumstances, the approximately 140,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses who remain in Venezuela are active in their spiritual activities.
Yoruba: * Láìka gbogbo ìṣòro yìí sí, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogóje (140,000) Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà báyìí ń bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.

English: The branch office in Venezuela continues to organize the ongoing relief work within the country.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà kò dáwọ́ dúró láti máa ṣètò ìrànwọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: There are now 60 relief committees, which have primarily been tasked with distributing food to the brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ọgọ́ta (60) ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ló ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti pín oúnjẹ fáwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.

English: To date, the Venezuela branch, with the assistance of the Brazil branch, has distributed hundreds of tons of donated food to over 64,000 publishers in 1,497 congregations.
Yoruba: Títí di báyìí, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà pẹ̀lú èyí tó wà nílẹ̀ Brazil ti pín oúnjẹ tí àwọn ará kó jọ, tó sì kún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọkọ̀ akẹ́rù fún àwọn akéde tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta (64,000) láwọn ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (1,497).

English: The Venezuela branch also continues to help care for the spiritual needs of the brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà tún ń pèsè àwọn ohun táwọn ará nílò láti máa bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.

English: This summer, there were 122 “Be Courageous”! Regional Conventions held throughout the country, the last of which concluded on September 2, 2018.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún yìí, Àpéjọ Agbègbè “Jẹ́ Onígboyà”! méjìlélọ́gọ́fà (122) ni wọ́n ṣe káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà, September 2, 2018 ni wọ́n parí èyí tó kẹ́yìn lára wọn.

English: The conventions provided a vital spiritual boost to the brothers and sisters, many of whom had to overcome severe economic challenges to attend.
Yoruba: Àpéjọ Agbègbè yìí túbọ̀ fún àwọn ará lókun gan-an nípa tẹ̀mí, ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ló sì tiraka gan-an kí wọ́n tó lè wá sí àpéjọ náà.

English: Witnesses in Venezuela are actively comforting the many distressed people in the country with the Bible’s message.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì tu ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tí wàhálà ti bá lórílẹ̀-èdè náà nínú.

English: Currently, publishers conduct close to 200,000 Bible studies each month.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, iye ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì táwọn akéde ń darí lóṣooṣù fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọ̀kẹ́ mẹ́wàá (200,000).

English: There has also been an increase of newly interested ones attending congregation meetings, and 7,259 individuals were baptized.
Yoruba: Iye àwọn tó ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́, tí wọ́n sì ń wá sípàdé ti pọ̀ sí i, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún méje ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jì àti mọ́kàndínlọ́góta (7,259) ló sì ṣèrìbọmi.

English: These positive spiritual developments demonstrate that God’s spirit is fortifying our Venezuelan brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìtẹ̀síwájú tí à ń rí yìí fi hàn pé ẹ̀mí Ọlọ́run ló ń fún àwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lágbára.

English: We pray that they continue to trust in Jehovah until his Kingdom ends all present distresses.—Proverbs 3:5, 6.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí wọ́n gbára lé Jèhófà títí dìgbà tí Ìjọba rẹ̀ máa fòpin sí gbogbo wàhálà tí à ń kojú báyìí.—Òwe 3:5, 6.

English: For more information on the situation in Venezuela, watch the video Venezuela—Love and Faith During Difficult Times.
Yoruba: Tó o bá fẹ́ mọ̀ sí i nípa ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà, wo fídíò Fẹnẹsúélà—Wọ́n Ní Ìfẹ́ àti Ìgbàgbọ́ Bí Nǹkan Tiẹ̀ Nira.

English: ^ par. 2 In times of economic, social, or political crisis, each publisher must decide whether or not to flee their country of residence.
Yoruba: ^ ìpínrọ̀ 2 Láwọn àkókò tí ọrọ̀ ajé àti ètò ìṣèlú ò bá fara rọ, akéde kọ̀ọ̀kàn ló máa pinnu bóyá kí òun kúrò lórílẹ̀-èdè tóun ń gbé tàbí kóun dúró.

English: The organization does not promote or encourage one’s decision to either leave or remain.
Yoruba: Ètò Ọlọ́run kì í pinnu fáwọn èèyàn bóyá kí wọ́n kúrò tàbí kí wọ́n dúró.

English: The social and economic crisis in Venezuela continues.
Yoruba: Ìlú ò fara rọ, ọrọ̀ ajé sì ti dẹnu kọlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà.

English: Access to food, water, fuel, and medicine is severely limited because of shortages and high prices.
Yoruba: Àwọn èèyàn ò rí oúnjẹ, omi, epo pẹtiróòlù, ati oògùn tí wọ́n máa lò torí kò sí lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó, èyí tó wà sì gbówó lérí.

English: Frequent power outages have intensified the food shortages, as the lack of power interferes with refrigeration.
Yoruba: Àìsí iná ti mú kí oúnjẹ túbọ̀ ṣọ̀wọ́n, torí kò sí bí wọ́n á ṣe tọjú rẹ̀ kó má bàa bà jẹ́.

English: Crime is a constant concern.
Yoruba: Ìwà ọ̀daràn sì ń peléke sí i.

English: Despite these difficult conditions, the over 136,500 publishers in Venezuela continue to share zealously in the ministry.
Yoruba: Síbẹ̀, lójú gbogbo ìṣòro yìí, àwọn akéde ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógóje àtààbọ̀ (136,500) tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà ó yéé fìtara wàásù.

English: For example, in January 2019, although there were 7,000 fewer publishers in the country compared to the previous year, they dedicated 90,000 more hours in the field ministry.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ní January 2019, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iye àwọn akéde lórílẹ̀-èdè náà fi ẹgbẹ̀rún méje (7,000) dín sí tọdún tó kọjá, wákàtí tí wọ́n fi wàásù fi ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́rùn-ún (90,000) ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.

English: In April 2019, more than 195,600 Bible studies were being conducted.
Yoruba: Ní April 2019, ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì tí wọ́n ṣe fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì (195,600).

English: The number of regular pioneers rose to over 30,000.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé pọ̀ sí i, wọ́n ti lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgbọ̀n (30,000).

English: In response to the special worldwide effort to invite others to the Memorial of Christ’s death, the number of auxiliary pioneers increased to 20,400.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará kọ́wọ́ ti ẹ̀tò tá a ṣe kárí ayé láti pe àwọn èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, ìyẹn sì mú kí iye àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà olùrànlọ́wọ́ di ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogún ó lé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́rin (20,400).

English: These efforts no doubt contributed to almost 471,000 people attending the Memorial—more than triple the number of publishers.
Yoruba: Ìsapá tí wọ́n ṣe yìí mú kí nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin (471,000) èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, èyí sì ju ìlọ́po mẹ́ta iye àwọn akéde tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: Additionally, congregation meetings are well supported, in part, because our brothers continue to provide the Bible’s message to people searching for a trustworthy solution to their problems.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló ń wá sípàde, torí pé àwọn ará ò yéé kọ́ àwọn tó ń wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.

English: The Venezuela branch continues to coordinate relief efforts to help our brothers receive basic food items to supplement their diet.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ṣètò iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ kí àwọn ará wa lè rí ohun tí wọ́n nílò jẹ.

English: Each month, with the assistance of neighboring branches and generous donations to the worldwide work, the Venezuela branch distributes hundreds of tons of donated food to 75,000 publishers in 1,595 congregations.
Yoruba: Lọ́lá ìrànwọ́ láti àwọn ẹ̀ka tó wà láyìíká àti owó ìtìlẹyìn kárí ayé, oṣooṣù ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń pín ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹrù oúnjẹ fún ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínlọ́gọ́rin (75,000) akéde ní ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún ó lé márùndínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (1,595).

English: Our brothers in Venezuela face many difficulties, but we are encouraged that they continue ‘exulting in Jehovah and being joyful in the God of their salvation.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ ìṣoro làwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń fara dà, àmọ́ inú wa dùn pé wọ́n ń ‘yọ̀ gidigidi nínú Jèhófà, inú wọn sì ń dùn nínú Ọlọ́run ìgbàlà wọn.

English: NEW YORK—International media outlets have been reporting on deteriorating conditions in Venezuela set off by economic troubles.
Yoruba: ÌLÚ NEW YORK— Kárí ayé ni àwọn oníròyìn ti ń sọ nípa wàhálà tó ń bá orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà nítorí ọrọ̀ ajé tó dẹnu kọlẹ̀.

English: The Venezuela Branch Committee reports that our brothers and sisters have also been affected by this crisis.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé wàhálà náà ò yọ àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa sílẹ̀.

English: The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses is deeply concerned by these reports.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìròyìn yìí ò múnú Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí dùn rárá.

English: Armed criminals have entered some Kingdom Halls during weekly meetings to steal electronic devices and other valuables.
Yoruba: Àwọn adigunjalè wọ àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan nígbà tí ìpàdé àárín ọ̀sẹ̀ ń lọ lọ́wọ́, wọ́n sì jí àwọn ẹ̀rọ̀ abánáṣiṣẹ́ àtàwọn nǹkan iyebíye míì.

English: Additionally, in some cases, meetings are held in private homes because violent conflicts block access to Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn ìgbà míì wà tí àwọn ará máa ṣèpàdé ní ilé àdáni, torí pé àwọn tó ń bára wọn jà ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n rọ́nà dé Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.

English: A number of our brothers and sisters are among those who have lost their jobs because their place of employment closed down.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ló wà lára àwọn tí iṣẹ́ bọ́ mọ́ lọ́wọ́ torí pé ibi tí wọ́n ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ kógbá wọlé.

English: Some who own businesses have been targeted by criminals and gangs and, as a result, have been forced to sell their business and flee the country for their safety.
Yoruba: Ṣe ni àwọn ọ̀daràn àtàwọn jàǹdùkú tún ń dájú sọ àwọn tó níṣẹ́ ara wọn, ìyẹn lò fà á táwọn kan fi gbé okòwò wọn tà, tí wọ́n sì sá kúrò nílùú kí wọ́n lè rímú mí.

English: Sadly, over the last few years, there have been at least 680 brothers and sisters kidnapped, over 13,146 have been victims of armed robbery, and 144 have even been victims of rape or attempted rape.
Yoruba: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé, láwọn ọdún àìpẹ́ yìí, ó kéré tán ọgọ́rùn-ún méje ó dín ogún [680] àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ni wọ́n ti jí gbé, ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlá àti mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́jọ [13,146] nínú wọn tí àwọn adigunjalè jí nǹkan wọn, àwọn mẹ́rìnlélógóje [144] ni wọ́n sì ti fipá bá lò pọ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ fún.

English: Tragically, reports as of August 10, 2017, indicate that 47 of our brothers and sisters have been murdered.
Yoruba: Èyí tó burú jù ni ohun tí ìròyìn tó dé ní August 10, 2017 sọ, pé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta [47] ni wọ́n ti pa.

English: Some have also died because they could not obtain needed medical treatment.
Yoruba: Àwọn míì tiẹ̀ tún gbẹ́mìí mì torí pé wọn ò rí ìtọ́jú tó yẹ gbà.

English: The Governing Body continues to closely monitor the situation, utilizing donated funds allocated to assist brothers and sisters who are in need of basic relief supplies.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ń wo bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí lójú méjèèjì, wọ́n ń lo lára owó táwọn èèyàn fi ṣètọrẹ láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tí wọ́n nílò oúnjẹ, ilé gbígbé àtàwọn nǹkan míì lọ́wọ́.

English: The Governing Body is also communicating with other branches around the world to ascertain the most appropriate means of providing support for our brothers and sisters in Venezuela, since individual efforts to provide direct assistance can be dangerous.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí tún ń bá àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì kárí ayé sọ̀rọ̀ kí wọ́n lè rí ọ̀nà tó dáa jù láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lọ́wọ́, torí pé ó léwu kéèyàn sọ pé òun fẹ́ lọ síbẹ̀ lọ ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.

English: The Venezuela Branch Committee has set up an emergency relief committee at the branch office that oversees 24 subcommittees throughout the country to care for the needs of our brothers.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà ti yan ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ pàjáwìrì sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà, ìgbìmọ̀ tí wọ́n yàn yìí sì ń bójú tó ìgbìmọ̀ kéékèèké mẹ́rìnlélógún [24] míì káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà láti pèsè ohun tí àwọn ará nílò.

English: The over 149,000 publishers in Venezuela are not only enduring despite suffering severe trials during the “last days,” they are also increasing their efforts to share the Bible’s comforting message with their neighbors.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe pé àwọn akéde tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogóje ó lé mẹ́sàn-án [149,000] tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń fara da ìpọ́njú tó lágbára “ní àwọn ọjọ́ ìkẹyìn” yìí nìkan ni, wọ́n tún ń fi kún ìsapá wọn láti máa sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ìtùnú tó wà nínú Bíbélì fún àwọn aládùúgbò wọn.

English: (2 Timothy 3:1-5; 2 Timothy 4:2) Luis R. Navas, a spokesman from the Venezuela branch office, explains: “Spiritually, we have never been so prosperous.
Yoruba: (2 Tímótì 3:1-5; 2 Tímótì 4:2) Luis R. Navas tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé: “A ò tíì lọ́rọ̀ nípa tẹ̀mí báyìí rí.

English: Our congregation meeting attendance has increased.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń wá sípàdé ìjọ ti pọ̀ sí i.

English: More publishers are regular pioneering while at the same time exercising greater caution in the ministry.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ akéde ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ra ṣe bí wọ́n ń wàásù.

English: Since our neighbors know that we are strictly neutral and that we do not share in any of the criminal activity plaguing the country, they welcome the Bible-based message of hope and comfort we share.” Jehovah’s Witnesses in Venezuela will continue caring for one another and comforting their neighbors.
Yoruba: Torí pé àwọn aládùúgbò wa mọ̀ pé a ò gbè sẹ́yìn ẹnikẹ́ni àti pé a ò lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà ọ̀daràn èyíkéyìí tó ń lọ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà, wọ́n tẹ́wọ́ gba ọ̀rọ̀ ìrètí àti ìtùnú tí à ń sọ fún wọn látinú Bíbélì.” Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà á máa bójú tó ara wọn nìṣó lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan, wọ́n á sì máa tu àwọn aládùúgbò wọn nínú.

English: Around the world, their fellow brothers and sisters will continue to support them and pray in their behalf.
Yoruba: Kárí ayé, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin bíi tiwọn á máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn nìṣó, wọn ò sì ní dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí wọn.

English: On Wednesday, August 23, Hato, a Category 10 typhoon, battered southern China, including the cities of Hong Kong and Macau.
Yoruba: Ní Wednesday, August 23, ìjì líle tó léńkekà kan tó ń jẹ́ Hato, jà ní apá gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Ṣáínà, ó sì dé ìlu Hong Kong àti Macau.

English: No deaths were reported in Hong Kong, but 34 people were injured.
Yoruba: Kò sí ẹni kankan tá a gbọ́ pé ó kú nílùú Hong Kong, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́tàlélógbọ̀n [34] ló fara pa.

English: In Macau, at least 9 people died and 153 were injured.
Yoruba: Nílùú Macau, ó kéré tán àwọn mẹ́sàn-án ló kú, àwọn mẹ́tàléláàdọ́jọ [153] sì fara pa.

English: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Hong Kong, which also coordinates the Witnesses’ work in Macau, reported that no Witnesses were killed by the typhoon.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa ní ìlu Hong Kong, tó tún ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí nílùú Macau, ròyìn pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìi kankan tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí lọ.

English: However, many are without power and potable water in Macau.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ni kò ní iná àti omi tí wọ́n máa lò nílùú Macau.

English: The branch office is coordinating with local Witnesses to provide their fellow believers in need with drinking water and other supplies.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ń ṣètò pẹ̀lú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí lágbègbè yẹn láti pèsè omi àti àwọn ohun míì tí àwọn ará wọn tí àjálù yìí dé bá nílò.

English: Over 5,500 Jehovah’s Witnesses live in Hong Kong, and another 320 live in Macau.
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa tó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún [5,500] ló ń gbé nílùú Hong Kong, àwọn ọgọ́rùn-un mẹ́ta àti ógún [320] ló sì ń gbé nílùú Macau.

English: Heavy monsoon rains in Kerala, India, triggered some 25 landslides, killing at least 75 people.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle tó máa ń bá òjò rìn jà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kerala, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, ó sì mú kí òkè ya lulẹ̀ níbi mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n (25), ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí gbẹ̀mí ó kéré tán, èèyàn márùndínlọ́gọ́rin (75).

English: According to the India Meteorological Department, the current southwest monsoon has produced some of the heaviest rains in the area’s history.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Ṣèwádìí Nípa Ojú Ọjọ́ Nílẹ̀ Íńdíà (India Meteorological Department) sọ pé ìjì líle tó máa ń jà lápá gúúsù ìwọ̀ oòrùn ayé ló tíì rọ òjò tó rinlẹ̀ jù lọ lápá ibí yìí nínú ìtàn.

English: We are saddened to hear from our India branch office that, due to landslides, a Witness couple in their 60s and a Bible student lost their lives and two Bible students suffered serious injuries and are recuperating in the hospital.
Yoruba: Ó dùn wá gan-an nígbà tá a gbọ́ ìròyìn láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa nílẹ̀ Íńdíà pé nígbà àjálù yìí, tọkọtaya Ẹlẹ́rìí kan tí wọ́n ti lé ní lẹ́ni ọgọ́ta (60) ọdún àti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì kan pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn, bákan náà àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì méjì ṣèṣe gan-an, wọ́n sì ti ń gbàtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn.

English: Additionally, a 17-year-old brother drowned while trying to save his neighbor.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, arákùnrin wa kan tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún (17) bómi lọ níbi tó ti fẹ́ ran ará àdúgbò rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́.

English: A local Disaster Relief Committee (DRC) was formed to assess the damage and organize the relief effort.
Yoruba: A dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù (DRC) sílẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè wo ibi tí nǹkan bà jẹ́ dé, kí wọ́n sì ṣètò ìrànwọ́.

English: Some Kingdom Halls have been designated to serve as relief centers.
Yoruba: Àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ni wọ́n lò láti ṣe iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ yìí.

English: Preliminary reports regarding our brothers’ homes indicate that at least 46 have been damaged or destroyed.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a sì kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ fi hàn pé ó kéré tán, mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta (46) lára ilé àwọn ará wa ló wó tàbí tó bà jẹ́.

English: Some 85 families (475 publishers) have been temporarily relocated to the homes of brothers or relatives.
Yoruba: Nǹkan bí ìdílé márùnlélọ́gọ́rin (85) ìyẹn (akéde 475) ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí mú kí wọ́n kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé, tí wọ́n sì lọ ń gbé nílé àwọn ará tàbí àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn.

English: It is reported that some Kingdom Halls have been partially submerged in the flood waters.
Yoruba: A gbọ́ pé omi ọ̀gbàrá ti mu àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan débì kan.

English: The DRC remains on alert as heavy rains have been forecast for the coming days.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ DRC ṣì wà ní sẹpẹ́ torí ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ ni pé òjò tó rinlẹ̀ ṣì máa tún rọ̀ láìpẹ́.

English: Representatives from the branch office, along with a local circuit overseer and congregation elders, visited our brothers and sisters to provide comfort and Scriptural encouragement.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àti alábòójútó àyíká kan lágbègbè náà pẹ̀lú àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọ́n sì fún wọn níṣìírí nípa tẹ̀mí.

English: Our thoughts and prayers are with all those affected by this devastating monsoon.
Yoruba: Ọkàn wa wà lọ́dọ̀ gbogbo àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kàn, a sì ń gbàdúrà fún wọn.

English: We look forward to the time when all such natural disasters and the resulting pain, will be no more.
Yoruba: À ń retí ìgbà tí gbogbo irú àjálù yìí àti gbogbo ìrora tó máa ń bá a rìn á dohun ìgbàgbé.​

English: On October 25, 2019, Brother Ashok Patel, a member of the India Branch Committee, released the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Telugu at a regional convention held in the Hyderabad International Convention Centre in Hyderabad, India.
Yoruba: Ní October 25, 2019, Arákùnrin Ashok Patel tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lédè Telugu ní àpéjọ agbègbè tá a ṣe ní International Convention Centre tó wà nílùú Hyderabad, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà.

English: An estimated 91.9 million people speak Telugu, making it the third most spoken language in India after Hindi and Bengali.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó mílíọ̀nù mọ́kànléláàádọ́rùn-ún (91,900, 000) ló ń sọ èdè Telugu, ìyẹn ló mú kó jẹ́ èdè kẹta tí àwọn èèyàn ń sọ jù ní Íńdíà lẹ́yìn èdè Hindi àti Bengali.

English: Currently, there are about 6,000 publishers who serve in the Telugu-language field, but the total attendance for the convention was 8,868.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, àwọn akéde tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà (6,000) ló ń sìn láwọn agbègbè tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Telugu, àmọ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́jọ àti méjìdínláàádọ́rin (8,868) làwọn tó wá sí àpéjọ náà.

English: These facts underscore the potential growth in this field, which has already seen the formation of two new circuits this year.
Yoruba: Èyí fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ló wà ní agbègbè yẹn tí wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí òtítọ́, kódà àyíká méjì la ti dá sílẹ̀ lọ́dún yìí.

English: One translator, who assisted with the five-year Telugu Bible project, observed that younger people in particular struggle with the archaic language used in other Telugu Bible translations.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè tó wà lára àwọn tó túmọ̀ Bíbélì Telugu náà fún odindi ọdún márùn-ún kíyè sí i pé kì í rọrùn fáwọn ọ̀dọ́ láti lóye àwọn èdè àtijọ́ tí wọ́n lò nínú àwọn Bíbélì Telugu míì.

English: “With this new translation, it can be said that Jehovah will now speak to the young ones using a straightforward and contemporary vocabulary that can be easily understood.”
Yoruba: Ó wá sọ pé: “Pẹ̀lú ìtumọ̀ tuntun yìí, Jèhófà máa bá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ sọ̀rọ̀ ní tààràtà lọ́nà tó máa yé wọn dáadáa tí kò sì ní lọ́jú pọ̀.”

English: Another translator added, “In the ministry, people will easily understand the scripture as soon as we read it to them at the door.”
Yoruba: Atúmọ̀ èdè míì tún fi kún un pé: “Lóde ẹ̀rí, àwọn èèyàn á máa tètè lóye ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ tá a bá kà fún wọn torí pé ó rọrùn.”

English: Additionally, since most Bibles in Telugu have omitted the Divine name, Jehovah, throughout the text, the New World Translation will help Telugu readers to know the name of the Almighty God.
Yoruba: Láfikún síyẹn, ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn Bíbélì tó wà lédè Telugu ló ti yọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, ìyẹn Jèhófà kúrò nínú Bíbélì wọn, torí náà Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun máa ran ọ̀pọ̀ lọ́wọ́ láti mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè.

English: It will also help readers to understand the original meaning of terms, such as soul and spirit, that other Telugu Bibles render in accordance with local Hindu beliefs.
Yoruba: Ó tún máa jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ ìtumọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ bí ọkàn àti ẹ̀mí. Ìdí sì ni pé ìgbàgbọ́ ẹ̀sìn Hindu làwọn tó tú àwọn Bíbélì míì gbé ìtumọ̀ wọn kà.

English: One publisher expressed, “I feel that the Telugu Bible will help readers to feel Jehovah’s love like never before!” Clearly, this new translation in the Telugu language will help readers to “taste and see that Jehovah is good.
Yoruba: Akéde kan sọ pé: “Mo mọ̀ pé Bíbélì Telugu yìí máa ran àwọn tó bá kà á lọ́wọ́ láti túbọ̀ rí i pé Jèhófà nífẹ̀ẹ́ wọn gan-an!” Ó ṣe kedere pé Bíbélì tuntun tá a mú jáde lédè Telugu yìí máa ran àwọn tó bá kà á lọ́wọ́ láti ‘tọ́ Jèhófà wò, kí wọ́n sì rí i pé ẹni rere ni.

English: According to a media outlet, floods in India have killed at least 169 people in the western states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Kerala.
Yoruba: Bí ìròyìn kan ṣe sọ, ó kéré tán, ọgọ́rùn-ún kan àti mọ́kàndínláàádọ́rin (169) èèyàn ló bá àkúnya omi tó ṣẹlẹ̀ láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ kan ní Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn Íńdíà lọ. Àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tọ́rọ̀ kàn ni ìpínlẹ̀ Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka àti Kerala.

English: The India branch office reports that none of our brothers and sisters were killed or injured by the flooding.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tó tẹ̀ wá lọ́wọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà fi yé wa pé kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó bá àkúnya omi náà lọ tàbí tó fara pa.

English: The branch has provided the following details.
Yoruba: Àlàyé tí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣe rèé:

English: Gujarat: In the city of Vadodara, a total of 145 publishers were affected by the floodwaters.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ Gujarat: Ní ìlú Vadodara, àwọn akéde márùnlélógóje (ni àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.

English: The Gujarati remote translation office, which is located in Vadodara, was not damaged.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, mìmì kan ò mi ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Gujarati tó wà ní ìlú Vadodara.

English: Maharashtra: In Mumbai, the homes of six families were affected.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ Maharashtra: Ní ìlú Mumbai, ìdílé mẹ́fà ni àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.

English: In the city of Sangli, located some 378 kilometers (235 mi) southeast of Mumbai, 25 publishers were displaced.
Yoruba: Ní ìlú Sangli, tó wà ní nǹkan bíi 378 kìlómítà sí ìlú Mumbai, àwọn akéde mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n (25) ló sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.

English: Brothers in a nearby city provided temporary accommodations.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ní ìlú kan tó wà nítòsí gbà wọ́n sílé.

English: Karnataka: Six families were displaced by the floods.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ Karnataka: Ìdílé mẹ́fà ni àkúnya omi náà ti mú kí wọ́n sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.

English: The branch office is located in this state, but it was not affected by the heavy rains or flooding.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ yìí ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wà, àmọ́ àkúnya omi yìí ò ṣe jàǹbá èyíkéyìí fún ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà.

English: Kerala: Some 100 families have moved to higher ground and are temporarily staying with other Witnesses.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ Kerala: Nǹkan bíi ọgọ́rùn-ún kan (100) ìdílé ló ti ṣí lọ sáwọn ibi tó ga, wọ́n ń gbé pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wa tó wà níbẹ̀.

English: A Disaster Relief Committee is assessing the situation.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ti ń bójú tó ọ̀rọ̀ náà.

English: The branch office is coordinating the relief efforts in the affected areas.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti ń darí ètò ìrànwọ́ láwọn ibi tọ́rọ̀ kàn.

English: Circuit overseers and Local Design/Construction field personnel have been working hard to evaluate and help our affected brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn aṣojú Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó Sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ náà sì ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí kí wọ́n lè ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tọ́rọ̀ kàn lọ́wọ́.

English: This includes providing material support, such as the distribution of basic supplies like potable water, and spiritual encouragement.
Yoruba: Wọ́n fún wọn láwọn ohun kòṣeémáàní bíi omi tó ṣé e mu, wọ́n ń fún wọn níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tù wọ́n nínú.

English: We pray that Jehovah will continue to be with our brothers affected by the flooding.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà má ṣe fi àwọn ará wa yìí sílẹ̀.

English: We look forward to the time when natural disasters will be replaced by an “abundance of peace.
Yoruba: À ń fojú sọ́nà fún ìgbà tó jẹ́ pé “ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àlàáfíà” ló máa wà níbi gbogbo dípò àjálù.​

English: An especially severe monsoon season has resulted in deadly lightning storms and what experts consider the heaviest rainfall in some parts of India in over a century.
Yoruba: Ó ti lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún [100] ọdún báyìí tí ojú ọjọ́ ti yí pa dà láwọn ibì kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, èyí sì ti mú kí mànàmáná tó léwu gan-an máa kọ, kí òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá sì máa rọ̀, kódà àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n sọ pé òjò ò rọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ rí lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: Several states have sustained damage from flooding and landslides; as many as 700 people have died and millions have been displaced.
Yoruba: Omi àti yẹ̀pẹ̀ tó ya ti ba nǹkan jẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ ìlú lórílẹ̀-èdè náà; àwọn tí ẹ̀mí wọn lọ sí i tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje [700], ọ̀pọ̀ mílíọ̀nù èèyàn ni ò sì nílé lórí mọ́.

English: As of July 31, 2017, there have been no casualties or serious injuries reported among Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Títí di July 31, 2017, a ò tíì gbọ́ pé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan ṣèṣe tàbí pé wọ́n fara pa yánnayànna.

English: However, the homes of at least three Witness families were flooded but did not sustain serious damage.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ó kéré tán, ilé mẹ́ta tó jẹ́ tàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ni omi ya wọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n kò bà jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.

English: Congregations of Jehovah’s Witnesses within India are providing necessary relief aid to their fellow worshippers.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìjọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Íńdíà ń ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn ará wọn tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.

English: On November 16, 2018, Cyclone Gaja devastated the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu.
Yoruba: Ní November 16, 2018, ìjì tí wọ́n pè ní Gaja ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní ìpínlẹ̀ Tamil Nadu lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà.

English: At least 46 individuals were killed, an estimated 250,000 were displaced, and over 85,000 homes were damaged or destroyed.
Yoruba: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta (46) ló kú, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà igba ó lé àádọ́ta (250,000) ló sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, ilé tó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínláàádọ́rùn-ún (85,000) ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀ tàbí tó bà jẹ́ pátápátá.

English: The home of one of our brothers in Mannargudi, Tamil Nadu, that was damaged by a fallen tree.
Yoruba: Ilé ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa nílùú Mannargudi, ní Tamil Nadu rèé. Igi wó lu ilé náà.

English: The India branch office reports that none of our brothers and sisters were injured or killed by the storm.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Íńdíà jábọ̀ pé ìjì náà ò pa ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa, kò sì ṣe wọ́n léṣe.

English: However, 38 homes of our brothers and 2 Kingdom Halls were damaged.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ilé àwọn ará wa méjìdínlógójì (38) àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì ló bà jẹ́.

English: The branch established a Disaster Relief Committee to organize the relief work, including the distribution of food and water to affected publishers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù kí wọ́n ṣèrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn akéde tí àjálù náà ṣẹlẹ̀ sí, wọ́n pín oúnjẹ, omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì.

English: We pray that our brothers and sisters in India affected by Cyclone Gaja will be comforted by Jehovah through the loving oversight of the elders.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí Ìjì Gaja ṣèpalára fún ní Íńdíà rí ìtùnú gbà látọ̀dọ̀ Jèhófà nípasẹ̀ àwọn alàgbà onífẹ̀ẹ́.

English: Òjò alátẹ́gùn tó lágbára gan-an rọ̀ ní Mumbai, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, ní ọ̀sẹ̀ August 28, ó sì yọrí sí ikú àwọn èèyàn mẹ́rìnlá [14].
Yoruba: Heavy monsoon rains fell on Mumbai, India, during the week of August 28, leading to the deaths of 14 individuals.

English: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Íńdíà ròyìn pé kò sí ẹni tó kú tàbí tó fara pa gan-an lára àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà níbẹ̀.
Yoruba: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in India reports that there have been no casualties or serious injuries among Jehovah’s Witnesses.

English: Àmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni omi ya wọ̀.
Yoruba: However, several homes of Witnesses were flooded.

English: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ládùúgbò yẹn fún àwọn ará wọn tí ilé wọn bàjẹ́ ní oúnjẹ, wọ́n sì bá wọn palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí ilé wọn tó bàjẹ́ mọ́.
Yoruba: Local Witnesses provided food and assisted in cleaning up the damaged homes of their fellow believers.

English: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní orílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà ń kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe lọ sí ní Mumbai àti àwọn apá ibòmíì ní Íńdíà tí omíyalé náà dé.
Yoruba: The branch office continues to monitor the situation in Mumbai as well as other parts of India that have been affected by the floods.

English: The COVID-19 pandemic has created unique challenges for the 11 remote translation offices (RTOs) in India, which translate our publications into 36 languages.
Yoruba: Àrùn COVID-19 tó gbòde kan yìí kò fẹ́ mú nǹkan rọrùn fáwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè (RTO) mọ́kànlá, níbi tí wọ́n ti ń túmọ̀ àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde wa sí èdè mẹ́rìndínlógójì (36).

English: With Jehovah’s help, the translation teams are surmounting these obstacles and continuing their work.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ Jèhófà, àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yìí ń rí ojútùú sáwọn ìṣòro tó ń yọjú yẹn, wọ́n sì ń báṣẹ́ wọn nìṣó.

English: Translation work depends heavily on collaboration.
Yoruba: Iṣẹ́ ìtúmọ̀ èdè kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ tí ẹnì kan lè dá ṣe.

English: But as COVID-19 spread, India went into strict lockdown, making it impossible for translators to meet in person.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ bí àrùn COVID-19 ṣe túbọ̀ ń tàn kálẹ̀, ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè India ṣe òfin kónílégbélé, wọ́n ò sì fọ̀rọ̀ náà ṣeré rárá, èyí ló wá mú kó ṣòro fún àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn láti wà papọ̀ níbi kan náà.

English: Also, those responsible for audio and video recording could not hold recording sessions within the RTOs.
Yoruba: Bákàn náà, àwọn amojú ẹ̀rọ tó máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àwọn fídíò wa, tí wọ́n sì máa ń gba ohùn àwọn èèyàn sílẹ̀ kò lè ṣiṣẹ́ wọn nínú ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè mọ́ bíi ti tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: In the RTOs, in-person collaboration was replaced with videoconferencing and remote recording sessions.
Yoruba: Àtorí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára làwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn ti máa ń bára wọn ṣiṣẹ́ báyìí dípò kí wọ́n jọ wà níbì kan náà, kódà tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ gba ohùn àwọn èèyàn sílẹ̀, ọ̀tọ̀ nibi tí ẹni tó ń mojú ẹ̀rọ àtẹni tó ń kàwé máa wà.

English: These methods have expanded the resources available to the translators as they can now be assisted by brothers and sisters from other countries, such as Bangladesh and the United States.
Yoruba: Èyí ló wá jẹ́ kó ṣeé ṣe fún àwọn ará tó wà ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè míì bíi Bangladesh àti Amẹ́ríkàláti ràn àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè tó wà ní India lọ́wọ́ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ wọn.

English: The brothers have also found creative ways to produce sign-language videos while maintaining physical distancing.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará yẹn tún ti wá rí àwọn ọ̀nà míì tí wọ́n lè gbà ṣe àwọn fídíò tó wà fún àwọn adití, láì jẹ́ pé àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ náà sún mọ́ra wọn.

English: Some translators have turned their bedrooms into studios and have created makeshift equipment, using cardboard boxes as camera tripods and cell phones in place of sophisticated cameras.
Yoruba: Àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè kan tiẹ̀ ti sọ iyàrá wọn di ibiṣẹ́ wọn, kódà wọ́n ti fi àwọn páálí àtàwọn nǹkan míì tó wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó wọn ṣe àwọn nǹkan tó máa jẹ́ kí iṣẹ́ wọn jáde dáadáa, àwọn kan tiẹ̀ ń fi fóònù wọn ṣe fídíò dípò àwọn kámẹ́rà tó le nílẹ̀.

English: Along with these practical innovations, translators in the RTOs are depending on Jehovah to help them stay positive and productive during this time.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ yàtọ̀ sóhun táwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn ṣe, ṣe ni wọ́n gbára lé Jèhófà pé ó máa ran àwọn lọ́wọ́ láti má ṣe rẹ̀wẹ̀sì,ó sì máa fún wọn lókun láti máa báṣẹ́ náà lọ.

English: Here are some of their expressions: Brother Jose Francis from Kolkata stated, “When under difficult situations, humans may see a wall, but Jehovah can see a way around it.” Sister Bindu Rani Chandan from Bangalore said, “Knowing that Jehovah is using me in these perilous times gives me immense joy despite challenges.” Sister Rubina Patel from Vadodara expressed her feelings this way, “Nothing can stop Jehovah and his organization—not even the coronavirus.” We are proud of our brothers and sisters who are working diligently in the translation work.
Yoruba: Ẹ gbọ́ ohun táwọn kan lára wọn sọ: Arákùnrin Jose Francis láti ìlú Kolkata sọ pé, “Tí ìṣòro kan bá yọjú, àwa èèyàn máa ń ríi bí ògiri, àmọ́ Jèhófà mọ ọ̀nà àbáyọ.” Arábìnrin Bindu Rani Chandan láti ìlú Bangalore sọ pé, “Ohun tó ń fún mi láyò lásìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí ni pé Jèhófà ń lò mí, ó sì jẹ́ kí n wúlò fún òun.” Arábìnrin Rubina Patel láti ìlú Vadodara sọ pé, “Kò sí ohun tó lè dá Jèhófà àti ètò rẹ̀ dúró, kódà àrùn corona gan-an ò tó bẹ́ẹ̀.” Orí wa máa ń wú tá a bá rántí àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun láti túmọ̀ àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde wa.

English: We are certain that Jehovah’s powerful holy spirit is behind their success and that his spirit will also ensure the fulfillment of Jesus’ prophecy: “This good news of the Kingdom will be preached in all the inhabited earth for a witness to all the nations.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé ẹ̀mí mímọ́ Jèhófà ló ń jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣe gbogbo àṣeyọrí tí wọ́n ń ṣe lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ náà, ó sì máa jẹ́ kí àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ Jésù nímùúṣẹ, èyí tó sọ pé: “A ó sì wàásù ìhìn rere Ìjọba yìí ní gbogbo ilẹ̀ ayé tí à ń gbé, kó lè jẹ́ ẹ̀rí fún gbogbo orílẹ̀-èdè.

English: At the end of July and the beginning of August, a series of earthquakes and aftershocks struck the island of Lombok, Indonesia, claiming the lives of at least 436 people and displacing about 350,000.
Yoruba: Ní ìparí oṣù July àti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù August, ilẹ̀ mì tìtì léraléra ní erékùṣù Lombok lórílẹ̀-èdè Indonéṣíà, ó gbẹ̀mí ó kéré tán, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mẹ́rìndínlógójì (436) èèyàn, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti àádọ́ta (350,000) ló sì ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: One of the earthquakes, a magnitude 7.0, flattened buildings and caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára ìmìtìtì tó wáyé náà lágbára gan-an, ṣe ni àwọn ilé wọlẹ̀ ráúráú, ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún mílíọ̀nù owó dọ́là sì làwọn nǹkan tó bà jẹ́.

English: Reports from our branch office in Jakarta indicate that there have been no injuries or deaths among our brothers, although some publishers’ homes were damaged.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa nílùú Jakarta ni pé ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa ò fara pa, ìkankan ò sì kú, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ilé àwọn akéde kan bà jẹ́.

English: Additionally, the facility used for meetings by the 40 publishers who make up the only congregation on the island was damaged.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ilé tí ìjọ kan ṣoṣo tó wà ní erékùṣù náà ti ń ṣèpàdé bà jẹ́, ogójì (40) akéde ló sì wà nínú ìjọ.

English: Two representatives from the branch office traveled to the affected area to evaluate any existing need for relief aid and to provide comfort.
Yoruba: Aṣojú méjì láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì rìnrìn àjò lọ síbi tí àjálù ti ṣẹlẹ̀ yìí kí wọ́n lè mọ ìrànlọ́wọ́ tí àwọn ará ibẹ̀ máa nílò, kí wọ́n sì lè tù wọ́n nínú.

English: Our prayers continue to be with our brothers during this difficult time, knowing that Jehovah is able to ‘comfort them in all their trials.
Yoruba: A ò dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa lásìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, torí a mọ̀ pé Jèhófà lè ‘tù wọ́n nínú nínú gbogbo ìpọ́njú wọn.

English: A magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Sulawesi on Friday, September 28.
